manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs used for disability are transported free of charge. Passengers may use their own wheelchair until the aircraft door, where it will be taken for stowage in the hold. Upon arrival, the wheelchair is typically returned at the aircraft door, although airport infrastructure may occasionally require delivery at baggage claim. Avianca recommends that wheelchair users keep their carry-on baggage weight under 10 kg (22 lbs) to facilitate easier movement and handling.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are transported in the aircraft cargo hold. Passengers must notify the airline at least 24 hours before the flight (48 hours for flights to/from Europe or London) and provide specifications including dimensions, total weight, battery type, and manufacturer instructions for disassembly and reassembly. On single-aisle aircraft (such as those operated by Avianca Costa Rica), powered devices are stored in the cargo hold according to safety and DOT regulations.
battery_handling_instructions: Dry, NiMH, and Lithium batteries should remain secured to the wheelchair unless removal is necessary for handling/stowage; terminals must be protected from short circuits and the device must be powered off. Spillable (wet) batteries are NOT allowed to be transported while installed; they must be removed, placed in leak-proof packaging with absorbent material, and labeled as 'BATTERY, WET, WITH WHEELCHAIR'. Spare battery limits: Lithium-ion (1 spare up to 300 Wh or 2 spares up to 160 Wh each, carried in cabin); Dry/NiMH (up to 2 spares in cargo); Non-spillable wet (1 spare in cargo).
special_assistance_contact_general: Assistance can be requested during the booking process on avianca.com, through the 'Manage your booking' section, or by calling the regional Contact Center at least 24 hours before departure (48 hours for European routes).

manual_wheelchair_policy: Challenge Airlines (IL) Ltd. is a freighter-only airline and does not operate scheduled passenger services. Manual wheelchairs are accepted as cargo shipments. Dimensions and weight are restricted by the cargo door limits of the Boeing 747-400F and 767-300F fleet. Devices must be securely crated or palletized to prevent damage during flight.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are transported as cargo and classified as Dangerous Goods. They must be declared and handled in accordance with IATA Dangerous Goods Regulations (DGR). Challenge Group is CEIV Lithium Battery certified, ensuring specialized handling for battery-powered mobility aids as freight.
battery_handling_instructions: Batteries must be protected against short circuits and accidental activation. For lithium-ion batteries shipped as cargo (UN3480), the state of charge (SoC) must not exceed 30%. Non-spillable batteries may remain installed if securely attached to the mobility aid and protected from damage.
special_assistance_contact_general: As a cargo-only airline, Challenge Airlines (IL) does not have a passenger special assistance department. For inquiries regarding shipping wheelchairs or mobility aids as cargo, customers should contact the local sales or tracing office.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Lufthansa transports up to two mobility aids (e.g., manual wheelchairs, walkers) free of charge. Manual wheelchairs can be foldable or non-folding. Passengers must provide dimensions (length, width, height) and weight during booking or via the online registration process. Foldable wheelchairs can typically be used up to the departure gate where they are tagged as 'Delivery at aircraft' and loaded into the cargo hold. Note that smaller aircraft have cargo door limitations, with the narrowest being 71 cm.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Transport of battery-powered wheelchairs requires prior approval from the airline at least 48 hours before departure. Passengers must complete a specific 'Information about electric mobility aids' registration form (PDF) and email it to specialcases@dlh.de. The wheelchair must be prepared for transport by protecting it against accidental activation and insulating the battery terminals. Depending on the aircraft type and cargo door dimensions (minimum 71 cm), size and weight restrictions may apply.
battery_handling_instructions: For Lithium-ion batteries: Permanently installed batteries are limited to a maximum of 160 Wh each (max 2). Removable batteries must be removed, terminals taped to prevent short circuits, and carried in the cabin as carry-on baggage; removable batteries are limited to one up to 300 Wh or two up to 160 Wh each. For Non-spillable/Gel batteries: Terminals must be insulated to prevent short circuits. For Wet batteries: Must be disconnected, terminals protected, and the wheelchair must be loaded and transported in an upright position. If upright transport is not possible, the battery must be removed and shipped as cargo.
special_assistance_contact_general: Lufthansa Service Center or Medical Operation Centre (MOC) for specialized inquiries.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Passengers requiring wheelchair service or traveling with their own manual wheelchair must contact the Service Centre at least 48 hours before flight departure. All non-foldable manual wheelchairs must be checked in as baggage (free of charge). Mobility aids like canes, crutches, and walkers may be carried onboard free of charge provided they meet safety and security regulations (e.g., fitting in overhead bins or under the seat).
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs require pre-approval and notification to the Service Centre at least 48 hours before departure. Passengers must provide details on the wheelchair type and battery installed. At the airport, users are required to bring the wheelchair user manual/specifications and any tools needed for disassembly/reassembly. Devices must fulfill IATA Dangerous Goods Regulations (DGR) and batteries must meet UN 38.3 test requirements.
battery_handling_instructions: Measures must be taken to prevent short circuits (e.g., by insulating or taping over exposed terminals) and unintentional activation. If the mobility aid does not provide adequate protection, the battery must be removed according to manufacturer instructions. Removed lithium-ion batteries must not exceed 300 Wh and must be carried in the cabin in a protective pouch. A maximum of one spare lithium-ion battery not exceeding 300 Wh, or two spare batteries not exceeding 160 Wh each, may be carried in the cabin.
special_assistance_contact_general: Contact the Service Centre at least 48 hours before departure for assistance requests and mobility device notifications.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs are accepted for carriage. Passengers are generally permitted to use their personal manual wheelchairs until reaching the aircraft door, where they are labeled as 'Delivery at Aircraft' (DAA) and stowed in the cargo hold. Passengers should request wheelchair assistance at the time of ticket purchase or at least 48 hours before departure. Assistance is provided for boarding, moving to the seat, and disembarking.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric or powered wheelchairs must be checked as baggage and carried in the aircraft cargo hold. These devices require prior coordination with the airline. The wheelchair must be prepared for transport by disconnecting the battery and ensuring the terminals are isolated to prevent accidental activation or short circuits. It is often required to remove the battery entirely before handing the device over to airline staff.
battery_handling_instructions: For electric wheelchairs, the battery must be disconnected and terminals must be insulated (e.g., with electrical tape) to prevent short circuits. If the mobility aid is powered by a lithium-ion battery, it must typically be removed from the device and carried by the passenger in the cabin, protected from damage. If the battery is non-removable, it must be securely attached and the power must be inhibited. Most sources indicate a capacity limit of 300 Wh for a single lithium-ion battery or 160 Wh each for two batteries.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special assistance should notify the airline during the booking process or contact their local Iran Airtour office. Assistance can be requested for airport transit, boarding, and seating.

airline_name: Air Cambodia Co., Ltd. (formerly Cambodia Angkor Air)
manual_wheelchair_policy: Passengers with reduced mobility may bring mobility equipment such as foldable wheelchairs, crutches, or canes free of charge. These items do not count toward the standard baggage allowance. Foldable wheelchairs meeting carry-on baggage standards (max 115 cm total dimensions and 7 kg weight) may be accepted in the cabin. Larger wheelchairs are transported as checked baggage. If a single dimension exceeds 119 cm (45 inches) or the sum of dimensions exceeds 158 cm (62 inches), the item is classified as oversized baggage and requires advance request and approval based on aircraft capacity.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Air Cambodia transports battery-powered wheelchairs and mobility aids provided they comply with the International Air Transport Association (IATA) Dangerous Goods Regulations. Passengers must provide advance notice: at least 3 days before departure for domestic Cambodia flights and at least 5 days for international flights. Acceptance is subject to the size and weight restrictions of the specific aircraft type operating the route.
battery_handling_instructions: Removable batteries must be removed from the wheelchair and carried in the passenger cabin. Batteries must be protected from damage by being individually packed in protective cases or bags. Exposed terminals must be insulated (e.g., by taping over them) to prevent short circuits. Batteries that remain attached to the wheelchair must be securely fastened and the electrical circuits isolated to prevent accidental activation.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special assistance should contact the Air Cambodia Online Helpdesk or Head Office at least 3 to 5 days before departure.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Avion Express requires passengers to report the use of a manual wheelchair (WCHP) at least 48 hours before departure. Personal manual wheelchairs are transported free of charge as checked baggage in the aircraft hold. Passengers must be able to sit in a normal passenger seat in an upright position. At the airport, station wheelchairs are provided for use until the passenger's own device is returned at the baggage claim or conveyor belt at the destination.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and mobility aids must be reported at least 48 hours prior to the flight. Avion Express accepts only dry battery (non-spillable) or lithium-ion battery-powered mobility aids. The device must be prepared for transport by disconnecting the battery and insulating the terminals to prevent short circuits. The wheelchair must be securely stowed in the hold, and for certain aircraft or routes, authorization may be subject to weight and dimension limitations of the cargo hold. Passengers must be capable of sitting in a standard passenger seat.
battery_handling_instructions: Batteries must be securely attached to the mobility aid or disconnected. Terminals must be insulated (e.g., taped) to prevent short circuits. If the mobility aid is designed with a removable lithium-ion battery (collapsible devices), the battery must be removed and carried in the passenger cabin. Spare lithium-ion batteries must also be carried in the cabin, protected from damage and short circuits, with a limit of one spare battery not exceeding 300Wh or two spares not exceeding 160Wh each.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers on flights with the 'X9' prefix should contact the Charter Passenger Service or the airline's headquarters for special assistance arrangements. If the flight is operated on behalf of another airline (ACMI), passengers must follow the assistance procedures of the marketing carrier.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Passengers who rely on wheelchairs for mobility are permitted to check one manual wheelchair free of charge, which does not count towards their standard baggage allowance. Wheelchairs may be stored in the aircraft cabin if suitable storage space and facilities are available (on a first-come, first-served basis); otherwise, they will be transported as checked baggage in the cargo hold for free. Passengers are not required to sign a liability waiver for the transport of their mobility aid unless it was already damaged at the time of check-in.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and mobility aids must be transported as checked baggage. Passengers must apply for the carriage of an electric wheelchair in advance (at least 48 to 72 hours before departure). The airline requires the device to be handled according to dangerous goods regulations to prevent accidental activation and short circuits during transport. It is recommended to contact the airline's call center or visit a ticket office to confirm the specific aircraft's cargo door dimensions can accommodate the device.
battery_handling_instructions: Lithium-ion batteries must be removed if the wheelchair is designed for them to be detachable; removed batteries must not exceed 300Wh (single) or 160Wh each (if two) and must be carried in the passenger cabin with terminals protected from short circuits. Non-spillable batteries can remain installed if securely attached to the wheelchair and the terminals are insulated to prevent short circuits. For spillable batteries, the wheelchair must be loaded and stowed in an upright position; if it cannot be kept upright, the battery must be removed and packed in specialized leak-proof packaging.
special_assistance_contact_general: Special assistance requests should be made through the Suparna Airlines Call Center at least 48 hours prior to the flight. Passengers may also visit local ticket offices to complete the 'Special Passenger Service Request Form'.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs are transported free of charge in the aircraft's baggage hold and are not counted towards the standard free baggage allowance. A request to carry a wheelchair must be made at least 36 hours before the scheduled departure. Passengers can use their manual wheelchair until boarding and have it returned immediately after disembarking (Delivery at Aircraft - DAA) if requested during check-in, except at the following airports: Bishkek, Bukhara, Samarkand, St. Petersburg, Tashkent, and Tehran.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs must be checked in as baggage. Passengers must notify the airline at least 36 hours before departure and provide the weight, dimensions, and battery type. The wheelchair must be prepared for transport by disconnecting the battery terminals. Passengers are required to carry their own tools (spanners/tools) for disconnecting the battery and must provide a container for the battery if required.
battery_handling_instructions: Batteries must be handled in accordance with ICAO Technical Instructions (Doc 9284). Passengers using powered wheelchairs must carry a set of tools for disconnecting the battery terminals. The battery must be placed in a protective container, such as its original packaging, a plastic box, or a cardboard box. Lithium-ion batteries must generally be removed and carried in the passenger cabin if the wheelchair is collapsible and the battery is not protected by the frame. Specific Watt-hour (Wh) limits follow ICAO standards (typically 300Wh for a single battery or 160Wh each for two).
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers with disabilities should request services when booking or by contacting the Call Center or the dedicated disability phone line at least 36 hours before flight departure.

manual_wheelchair_policy: AirBridgeCargo is an all-cargo airline and does not operate scheduled passenger services. Manual wheelchairs are accepted for transportation strictly as commercial cargo under 'abc general' or 'abc XL' (oversized) service categories. Dimensions and weight limits are governed by the cargo hold capacities of the operating fleet (Boeing 747-8F, 747-400ERF, and 777F).
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and battery-powered mobility aids are accepted as cargo under the 'abc DG/Li' service. They must be declared as Dangerous Goods. The airline provides specialized handling through its Dangerous Goods specialists to ensure compliance with the IATA Dangerous Goods Regulations (DGR) and ICAO Technical Instructions.
battery_handling_instructions: Transportation must strictly adhere to IATA DGR and AirBridgeCargo's specific Operator Variations (RU-02, RU-03, and RU-04). Standalone lithium-ion batteries must be shipped with a State of Charge (SoC) not exceeding 30%. Batteries must be protected against short circuits and accidental activation. Batteries removed from equipment must be packed in strong, rigid outer packaging.
special_assistance_contact_general: As an all-cargo carrier, the airline does not have a passenger special assistance department. For transport of mobility aids as cargo, customers should contact the Special Products and Services team or regional Customer Service offices.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Beijing Capital Airlines transports manual wheelchairs for disabled passengers free of charge in addition to the standard free baggage allowance. While manual wheelchairs are usually stowed in the cargo hold, passengers may use their own collapsible manual wheelchair until the boarding gate, where it must then be checked. The airline recommends notifying them of the wheelchair's dimensions and weight during booking to ensure proper handling.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are accepted as checked baggage only and cannot be stowed in the passenger cabin. Passengers must apply for electric wheelchair transportation at least 48 hours prior to the scheduled departure time through an official ticket office or the customer service hotline (95375). Information regarding the wheelchair's weight, dimensions (Length x Width x Height), and battery type is required for approval and cargo hold planning.
battery_handling_instructions: For lithium-ion batteries, if the battery is detachable, it must be removed and carried in the cabin; if non-detachable, the wheelchair must be protected against accidental activation. Lithium-ion battery capacity is limited to 300Wh for a single battery or 160Wh each for two batteries. For all types, battery terminals must be insulated with tape or other non-conductive material to prevent short circuits. Non-spillable and spillable batteries should remain attached to the wheelchair in an upright position and must be disconnected according to the manufacturer's instructions.
special_assistance_contact_general: Beijing Capital Airlines Customer Service and Special Assistance Center

manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual folding wheelchairs are carried free of charge in addition to the standard baggage allowance. Due to the use of regional aircraft (ATR 42-500, ATR 72-500, and Beechcraft 1900), space is limited and acceptance is subject to prior approval by the reservation department. Passengers must notify the airline at least 48 to 72 hours before departure by filling out a specific PMR (Person with Reduced Mobility) form.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are accepted subject to prior agreement from the airline's services. Passengers must provide precise technical specifications including weight, dimensions, and battery type via the PMR form at least 48 hours before the flight. Acceptance depends on the safety constraints and the specific aircraft operating the route (especially limited on Beechcraft 1900 aircraft).
battery_types_allowed: Lithium-ion (subject to verification and potential limits, note: 160Wh limit mentioned for other mobility devices like bikes)
battery_handling_instructions: Batteries must comply with hazardous materials regulations. Passengers should describe their equipment precisely (weight and battery type) during booking. For battery-powered wheelchairs, dry batteries are preferred/accepted. Terminals must be protected from short circuits. For any lithium-powered aid, technical sheets and user manuals may be required at the airport to ensure compliance with safety standards.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers must request assistance at the time of booking or by submitting the PMR form at least 48 hours before departure. General inquiries can be made through the main reservation services.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Eurowings transports up to two mobility aids (e.g., manual wheelchairs, crutches, or walking aids) per passenger free of charge. For non-foldable wheelchairs, the maximum transport height is restricted to 115 cm. Manual wheelchairs should be registered at least 48 to 72 hours before departure via the airline's 'Special Assistance' form or customer service email.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are permitted provided they use leak-proof dry or gel (non-spillable) batteries or lithium-ion batteries. Wet-cell (spillable) batteries are strictly prohibited. The wheelchair must be registered at least 48 to 72 hours before departure. Starting October 1, 2025, wheelchairs with permanently installed lithium batteries will be limited to a maximum of two batteries with a capacity of up to 160 Wh each. Currently, devices must comply with standard IATA/Eurowings limits for lithium power (e.g., max 300 Wh for a single battery).
battery_handling_instructions: Before departure, passengers must ensure the battery is not connected and the terminals (poles) are insulated or secured against short-circuiting. For wheelchairs where the battery can be removed (e.g., foldable lithium-powered chairs), the battery must be removed, protected in a suitable container, and carried in the passenger cabin as hand luggage. Gel or dry-cell batteries that are removed must be packed in robust, rigid packaging and stowed in the cargo hold. The battery must always be securely attached to the wheelchair if not removed.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers should register their assistance needs and mobility aids during the booking process or via the 'My trip' section. For specific inquiries or to submit the required registration form, contact the Eurowings Assistance Team.

manual_wheelchair_policy: AlMasria Universal Airlines accepts manual wheelchairs free of charge. They are typically stowed in the aircraft hold. Passengers are encouraged to notify the airline of their requirements during the booking process or at least 48 hours before departure to ensure proper handling. Manual wheelchairs should be foldable for easier stowage in the cargo compartment.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and mobility aids are accepted for transport in the aircraft hold. They are carried free of charge but require prior approval and notification (typically 48 to 72 hours in advance). Devices must be protected from accidental activation, and the weight and dimensions must be compatible with the aircraft's cargo door (approximate limits for the A320/A321 fleet are 114 cm in width and 86 cm in height, with a weight limit of up to 136 kg in some operational contexts).
battery_handling_instructions: For Lithium-ion batteries: Must meet UN Manual of Tests and Criteria (UN 38.3). If designed for removal, the battery must not exceed 300 Wh (or 160 Wh each for two batteries). Removed or spare batteries must be protected against short circuits and, according to airline station manuals, should be carried in strong, rigid packaging. For spillable batteries: Terminals must be insulated, and the battery must be secured in an upright position. For non-spillable batteries: Electrical circuits must be isolated (switched off) or disconnected and terminals protected from short circuits.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special assistance should contact AlMasria Universal Airlines via their 24/7 hotline or visit their sales offices. Notification of mobility aid details is recommended at the time of booking or at least 48 hours prior to the flight.

manual_wheelchair_policy: European Air Transport Leipzig GmbH (EAT Leipzig) is a dedicated cargo airline wholly owned by DHL Group and does not operate commercial passenger services for the general public. Mobility aids, including manual wheelchairs, are transported exclusively as cargo/freight under DHL Express shipping terms. For ad-hoc charter services (typically for cargo or specialized logistics), items must be secured and packaged according to standard air freight cargo requirements.
electric_wheelchair_policy: As a cargo-only carrier, EAT Leipzig transports electric wheelchairs solely as air freight. All motorized mobility aids must be declared as Dangerous Goods (DG) and require advance arrangements and approval by the Regional Restricted Commodities Group at DHL Express Europe Headquarters. Equipment must be properly crated or palletized for freighter transport.
battery_handling_instructions: Batteries must be handled in accordance with the IATA Dangerous Goods Regulations (DGR). For cargo transport: Batteries must be disconnected, terminals must be insulated to prevent short circuits, and the battery must be securely attached to the mobility aid or packed in strong, rigid outer packaging. Lithium-ion batteries must be removed if the mobility aid does not provide adequate protection for the battery. A Dangerous Goods declaration is mandatory for all battery-powered devices.
special_assistance_contact_general: As EAT Leipzig does not operate passenger flights, there is no dedicated passenger 'Special Assistance' desk. For logistics inquiries or shipping mobility equipment as cargo, contact DHL Aviation ACS or the Leipzig headquarters.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs are classified as special assistance items for 'Wheelchair Passengers' (轮椅旅客) and can be checked free of charge. For domestic flights, the maximum weight for checked baggage is generally 45kg per piece, and for international flights, the maximum weight is 32kg, with dimensions not exceeding 40 x 60 x 100 cm, though mobility aids are typically handled as priority items. Passengers are encouraged to notify the airline at the time of booking or at least 48 hours before departure.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs must be transported as checked baggage. Passengers must arrive at the airport at least 2 hours before the regular check-in deadline to complete handling procedures. The device must be protected from accidental activation and damage. If the wheelchair cannot be stored upright, the airline may require the battery to be removed and packaged separately.
battery_types_allowed: Non-spillable wet batteries (dry cell, gel, etc.)
battery_handling_instructions: Lithium-ion batteries must not exceed 300Wh (if one battery) or 160Wh each (if two batteries). Removable lithium batteries must be removed from the wheelchair and carried in the cabin (hand luggage); they are prohibited in checked baggage. Battery terminals must be insulated with tape or individual pouches to prevent short circuits. Spare lithium batteries are limited to one (max 300Wh) or two (max 160Wh each) and must also be carried in the cabin. Non-spillable batteries may remain attached if securely housed and protected from short circuit.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special assistance should contact Kunming Airlines customer service via their hotline at least 48 to 72 hours before the scheduled flight.

airline_name: Portugália - Companhia Portuguesa de Transportes Aéreos, S.A. (TAP Express)
manual_wheelchair_policy: Passengers can transport up to two wheelchairs free of charge in the aircraft hold. Requests must be made at least 48 hours before departure. For flights operated by Portugália (TAP Express) using Embraer 190/195 aircraft, the maximum dimensions for wheelchairs in the hold are 0.87 m (34 in) in height and 0.99 m (39 in) in width. Passengers may use their own manual wheelchair until the aircraft door at most airports.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are transported in the hold. Passengers must specify the wheelchair type, battery type, and specifications during booking. For flights operated by TAP/Portugália, a replacement manual chair is provided at check-in for use within the airport while the electric wheelchair is stowed. The device must be loaded, stored, secured, and unloaded in an upright position.
battery_handling_instructions: Batteries must be properly protected, stored, and disconnected, with terminals covered with insulating material to prevent short circuits. Lithium-ion batteries: If removable, they must be taken into the cabin and must not exceed 300 Wh (one battery) or 160 Wh each (two batteries). Non-removable lithium batteries are limited to two per device, each not exceeding 160 Wh. Non-spillable batteries must not exceed 12 V and 100 Wh, with a maximum of two spares allowed. Spillable batteries must remain installed and secured in an upright position.
special_assistance_contact_general: Assistance can be requested during booking or via the online 'Assistance Request' form on the TAP website at least 48 hours before departure. General assistance is available 24/7 through the Contact Center.

manual_wheelchair_policy: US-Bangla Airlines carries fully collapsible wheelchairs free of charge for passengers dependent on them. These are stowed in the aircraft luggage hold. Passengers may use their own wheelchairs until the aircraft entrance or boarding gate, at which point the device is collected by staff and stowed. The sum of dimensions for standard checked items is 158 cm (62 inches), though wheelchairs are generally accommodated if they are fully collapsible to fit the hold dimensions of specific aircraft (e.g., ATR 72-600 or Dash 8-Q400).
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are accepted for carriage but must be requested at the time of booking or through the airline's hotline. Personal wheelchairs are typically collected at the aircraft entrance and returned to the passenger upon landing. Passengers with special needs, including those using electric mobility aids, are advised to arrive at the airport at least 3 hours before departure for proper processing and handling.
battery_handling_instructions: Lithium batteries are prohibited in checked baggage and must be carried in the passenger cabin. For medical devices and portable oxygen concentrators (POC), lithium batteries are limited to 100 Watt-hours (Wh). Battery terminals must be protected from short circuits (e.g., by taping over exposed terminals or placing in individual pouches). Wet cell batteries are classified as restricted corrosive materials; passengers must contact the airline hotline to confirm specific handling requirements and ensure the device can be stowed in an upright position.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special assistance should notify the airline during the booking process or call the 24/7 hotline at 13605 (within Bangladesh) or 09666713605. Specific needs should be communicated at least 48-72 hours prior to flight.

airline_name: Martinair Holland N.V. (part of the Air France-KLM Group)
manual_wheelchair_policy: Martinair Holland N.V. currently operates exclusively as a cargo airline ('full freighter'). As it does not operate scheduled passenger services, manual wheelchairs are transported as standard cargo. When handled within the Air France-KLM Group (via KLM), manual wheelchairs are typically transported free of charge. Foldable or collapsible wheelchairs may be stored in the cabin on group passenger flights if they meet the maximum dimensions of 55 x 35 x 25 cm and a weight limit of 12 kg; otherwise, they are checked into the hold.
electric_wheelchair_policy: As a cargo-only airline, Martinair handles electric wheelchairs and mobility aids under 'Specialized Dangerous Goods Regulations' (DGR). Following IATA standards, electric wheelchairs must be declared at the time of booking as 'WCHR' (Wheelchair) cargo. The airline requires that the mobility aid be secured against movement in the cargo compartment and protected from damage. If the device cannot be loaded in an upright position, the battery must be removed and packed according to specific safety requirements.
battery_handling_instructions: Lithium-ion batteries are limited to a maximum of 300 Wh for a single battery or 160 Wh each for a device requiring two batteries. If the battery is not adequately protected by the design of the mobility aid, it must be removed and carried in the passenger cabin (per group policy). For non-spillable batteries, terminals must be protected from short circuits and the battery must be securely attached to the device. Spillable batteries must be loaded, stowed, and unloaded in an upright position; if this is not possible, the battery must be removed and placed in a strong, rigid, leak-proof packaging.
special_assistance_contact_general: As Martinair is a subsidiary of KLM, all accessibility and special assistance services are managed by the 'KLM Cares' department. For cargo-specific inquiries regarding mobility aid transport, contact AFKLMP Cargo service teams.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Personal manual wheelchairs, crutches, and orthopedic devices are transported free of charge in the hold. To ensure transport, devices must meet the standards for volume, weight, and size. On some aircraft types, such as the Boeing 737-800/700, the maximum cargo door dimensions for mobility aids are 84 cm (Height) and 122 cm (Width). Manual wheelchairs can often be used until the aircraft door and will be returned at the baggage claim area or the gate, depending on the airport.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are accepted as checked baggage only and must meet current transport regulations. Passengers must provide the manufacturer's instructions to assist with safe handling. The passenger or an accompanying person must be present to dismantle and reassemble the device if required. Advance notification of at least 48 hours is strongly recommended. For groups of 10 or more wheelchair users, prior clearance from the company is mandatory.
battery_handling_instructions: For non-spillable batteries, terminals must be disconnected and protected from short circuits using adhesive tape unless they are securely enclosed in a battery container. If the chair cannot be kept vertical, batteries must be removed and placed in rigid packaging with absorbent material. For spillable (wet) batteries, the passenger must provide a packing box and the tools necessary for removal and installation. Lithium-ion batteries must generally be removed from the wheelchair, protected from short circuits by insulating the terminals, and carried in the passenger cabin. Watt-hour limits typically follow IATA standards (300Wh for a single battery or 160Wh each for two batteries).
special_assistance_contact_general: Requests for special assistance can be made through the online 'Special Services' form, at the time of booking, or by contacting the call center at least 48 hours before departure. At the Casablanca Hub (Terminal 1), a dedicated 'Special Assistance' area is available for check-in formalities.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Precision Air allows one fully collapsible invalid's wheelchair as a personal item in both Business and Economy Class, provided the passenger is dependent on it. If not collapsible or if the passenger is not dependent on it, the wheelchair is checked in as luggage. Passengers are advised to inform the airline of their needs at the time of booking or at least 36 hours before departure.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric mobility aids are accepted for carriage but must be checked in as luggage. Passengers requiring electric wheelchairs are strongly advised to make travel plans in advance and notify the airline during ticket reservation. Requests for carriage of medical equipment or mobility aids must be declared at least 36 hours prior to departure.
battery_handling_instructions: Precision Air explicitly prohibits 'wet cell' batteries (spillable) as they are classified as dangerous corrosive goods. Battery-powered medical equipment must operate on dry-cell batteries. For all mobility aids, the airline requires terminals to be insulated/protected to prevent accidental short circuits, and the device should be prepared for secure transport in the cargo hold.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers can contact the Precision Air Contact Centre or the PW Station Manager/In Charge at the airport for special assistance and medical clearance (MEDIF) processing.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Cebu Pacific allows personal manual wheelchairs to be carried free of charge in addition to the standard 7kg carry-on baggage allowance. Manual wheelchairs, including folding or collapsible models, may be stowed in the aircraft cabin if space permits (priority storage) and they meet safety requirements. If cabin storage is not possible, the wheelchair will be stowed in the cargo hold as checked baggage at no extra cost.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Battery-powered wheelchairs and mobility aids require advanced notification at least 48 hours before departure. Passengers are required to fill out the 'Passenger Handling Form' to provide details about the device and battery. Acceptance is subject to the mobility aid being able to fit within the cargo hold dimensions and complying with safety protocols. The airline recommends arriving at the airport early for proper handling and inspection.
battery_handling_instructions: All battery terminals must be insulated or taped to prevent short circuits. For Lithium-ion batteries: the battery must not exceed 300Wh (or 160Wh each if the device uses two). If the battery is removable, it must be removed and carried in the passenger cabin in a protective pouch. Non-spillable batteries may remain installed if securely attached and protected from damage. Spillable batteries must be loaded and stowed in an upright position; if upright stowage is not possible, the battery must be removed and placed in strong, rigid packaging provided by the passenger.
special_assistance_contact_general: Cebu Pacific primarily uses digital channels for support, including a 24/7 live chatbot named 'Charlie' on their official website and social media platforms. Special requests should be made at the time of booking or via the Passenger Handling Form.

manual_wheelchair_policy: ABX Air is a FAR Part 121 cargo airline operating Boeing 767 freighters and does not provide scheduled passenger services. As such, there is no public passenger manual wheelchair policy. For authorized 'jump seat' travel (limited to employees, FAA, and business partners), travelers must be physically able to independently egress the aircraft and perform emergency procedures independently. Wheelchairs shipped as cargo must comply with standard IATA Dangerous Goods Regulations (DGR).
electric_wheelchair_policy: As a cargo-only carrier, ABX Air does not have a passenger policy for electric wheelchairs. For charter or cargo shipments, motorized mobility aids are classified as Dangerous Goods and must be declared and prepared according to IATA DGR and FAA regulations. This includes securing the device against movement and protecting electrical circuits from short circuits.
battery_types_allowed: Lithium-ion (subject to IATA DGR cargo limits)
battery_handling_instructions: For cargo shipments, batteries must be securely attached to the mobility aid or removed if the aid does not provide adequate protection. Terminals must be insulated to prevent short circuits. In 'jump seat' travel scenarios, the airline's policy requires that all occupants be able to independently evacuate, which generally precludes the use of powered mobility aids in the cabin or flight deck area.
special_assistance_contact_general: As ABX Air is a cargo-only airline, there is no dedicated passenger special assistance department. For general inquiries or charter coordination, contact the marketing or charter departments.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Rossiya Airlines transports manual wheelchairs free of charge as part of its special assistance services. Passengers are entitled to carry their own wheelchair plus one additional personal mobility aid (such as a stairclimber or wheelchair power attachment) for free. Folding manual wheelchairs may be carried in the aircraft cabin if space is available; if not, they are stowed in the baggage hold. Requests for wheelchair transportation must be submitted during booking or at least 36 hours before departure, including dimensions (length, width, height) and weight.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs must be checked in as baggage and transported in the cargo hold. They require advance notice (minimum 36 hours) including details on weight, dimensions, and battery specifications. The airline recommends packing the device to avoid damage. Special assistance desks are available at major hubs like Sheremetyevo (Terminal B: desks 317, 348; Terminal C: desks 425, 426). At most airports, a 'Delivery at Aircraft' (DAA) service is available to allow passengers to use their chair until the gate, though this service is restricted at certain airports including St. Petersburg (LED), Samarkand, and Tehran.
battery_handling_instructions: Powered wheelchairs must have their batteries disconnected and terminals isolated with insulation to prevent short circuits. In accordance with Russian Ministry of Transport Order No. 24 and ICAO Doc 9284, passengers using powered wheelchairs must carry their own set of spanners/tools for disconnecting the battery terminals and a suitable container (plastic or cardboard box) for the battery. For lithium-ion batteries, a removed battery may be carried in the cabin if its capacity does not exceed 160Wh; batteries exceeding 160Wh typically require carrier approval and may be treated as hazardous cargo.
special_assistance_contact_general: Special assistance can be requested during the ticket booking process on the official website, via the 'Feedback' section, or by contacting the dedicated call center. All requests must be confirmed at least 36 hours prior to the flight.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs must be checked in as checked baggage upon departure. They do not count towards the passenger's checked baggage allowance. For safety reasons, personal wheelchairs are not permitted for use within departure and arrival immigration areas or on board the aircraft. Scoot provides assistance (including wheelchairs and high-lifts where available) from check-in to boarding. For aircraft such as the Airbus A320, the maximum height of a mobility device is limited to 116 cm. Manual wheelchairs are returned to passengers at the arrival baggage claim belt.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Passengers must notify the Scoot Call Centre or provide notice via WhatsApp at least 48 hours before departure for all battery-powered mobility aids. Airline approval is required. Batteries that are securely attached and adequately protected from damage should remain on the mobility aid. The device must be switched off and protected from accidental activation. If the battery cannot be adequately protected, it must be removed. Scoot limits mobility aid height to 116 cm for A320 aircraft.
battery_types_allowed: Non-spillable Wet/Dry Cell (Gel cell, Absorbed electrolyte)
battery_handling_instructions: Lithium-ion: If removed, batteries must be protected from damage (e.g., in a pouch) and carried as cabin baggage. Single-battery limit is 300Wh; dual-battery systems are limited to 160Wh per battery. Non-spillable/Spillable: If removed, battery terminals must be protected from short circuits (e.g., enclosed in a battery container), placed in strong rigid packaging, and carried as checked baggage. All mobility aids must be switched off with terminals insulated to prevent short circuits.
special_assistance_contact_general: Contact the Scoot Call Centre at least 48 hours before departure. Assistance can also be requested via the official Special Assistance Webform or through the WhatsApp service. For passengers with movement or vision impairments, Call Centre booking fees are waived.

airline_name: Malindo Airways Sdn. Bhd. (dba Batik Air Malaysia)
manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs are carried free of charge and do not count toward the passenger's free baggage allowance. They can be used up to the aircraft door or boarding gate, where they will be tagged and stowed in the aircraft hold. Passengers are required to inform staff at check-in to have the wheelchair pre-tagged and must sign a Limited Release Tag (LRT). Fully collapsible wheelchairs are also permitted as personal items in the cabin for passengers who are dependent on them, provided they fit within cabin weight/size limitations.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric/battery-powered wheelchairs are accepted subject to advance notification (at least 48 hours prior to departure) and approval from the airline. They must comply with safety handling guidelines regarding battery type and capacity. Passengers with total immobility are not accepted on ATR aircraft flights for safety reasons. Motorized wheelchairs containing wet cell (spillable) batteries are generally not permitted to be loaded, as they are categorized as dangerous goods.
battery_handling_instructions: Lithium batteries must not exceed a watt-hour (Wh) rating of 300Wh. For devices with two batteries, each must not exceed 160Wh. Batteries must be individually protected to prevent short circuits (e.g., by taping over terminals) and must be securely attached to the mobility aid or properly packaged with correct markings and labeling. Advance notification is mandatory to allow for safety preparations.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special assistance should notify the airline upon ticket reservation or at least 48 hours prior to departure via the Customer Care Centre.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Passengers may use their own manual wheelchair up to the aircraft boarding gate, where it will be loaded separately as checked baggage. Jin Air provides delivery service to make the wheelchair available at the arrival gate. For small aircraft like the Boeing 737, wheelchairs exceeding 122cm (width) x 84cm (height) may be difficult to load; passengers are advised to contact the customer center for assistance. Requests should be made 2 hours before international departures and 1 hour before domestic departures.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs require special arrangements and advance inquiry through the Jin Air Customer Center. Dimensions and weight must be shared to ensure compatibility with the aircraft's cargo hold. Passengers must provide information on whether the battery is removable and its specific type (lithium, dry cell, or wet cell).
battery_handling_instructions: For electric wheelchairs with lithium batteries, removable batteries must be removed and carried in the cabin; they are not allowed in checked baggage. Terminals must be protected against short circuits (e.g., by taping over exposed terminals or using a protective pouch). Removable lithium batteries are limited to a maximum capacity of 300Wh. For devices with two batteries, each must not exceed 160Wh. Dry cell and wet cell batteries are typically carried as checked baggage and must have their removability and spillability information confirmed at check-in.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers can apply for special assistance through 'My Page' on the official website after booking, or by contacting the Customer Center. Dedicated special assistance seats can be requested up to 24 hours before departure.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs are accepted as checked baggage for transport in the aircraft hold. Passengers are required to provide the weight and dimensions of the wheelchair at the time of booking. Loose items such as pressure-relief cushions and removable footrests should be removed and carried in the passenger cabin. The airline recommends the purchase of travel insurance as liability for damage is governed by the Montreal Convention.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and mobility aids are accepted as checked baggage. Carriage is subject to international dangerous goods regulations (IATA/ICAO). Passengers must notify the airline at the time of purchase or at least 48 hours before the flight, providing the device's make, weight, dimensions, and battery type. The device must be protected from accidental activation and the power must be disconnected or isolated.
battery_handling_instructions: For Lithium-ion batteries: If the battery is designed to be removable, it must be removed, the terminals taped to prevent short circuits, and the battery carried in the passenger cabin (maximum 300Wh for a single battery or 160Wh each for two batteries). For non-spillable batteries: Terminals must be protected from short circuits and the battery securely attached to the device. For spillable batteries: The device must be loaded and stowed in an upright position; if not possible, the battery must be removed and packed in a leak-proof container.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special assistance should contact the airline's Reservation Department at the time of booking or use the dedicated Complaint Resolution Official (CRO) for accessibility concerns.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Folding wheelchairs and crutches are carried free of charge for passengers with reduced mobility and are not included in the free baggage allowance. Request for carriage must be made and agreed upon with the airline at least 48 hours prior to departure. Passengers who are unable to move independently on board must be accompanied or apply for carrier supervision.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric mobility aids are accepted for carriage as checked baggage but must be pre-authorized. Transportation of special categories of passengers, including those in wheelchairs, must be agreed with the airline at least 48 hours before the flight. Passengers should provide the airline with the type of battery and dimensions of the device during booking.
battery_handling_instructions: As an IATA member, Somon Air follows standard IATA Dangerous Goods Regulations: Lithium-ion batteries must be removed from the mobility aid if the device is not designed to protect the battery; removed batteries must not exceed 300Wh (or 160Wh each for two batteries) and must be carried in the passenger cabin. Terminals must be protected from short circuit (e.g., by taping over exposed terminals). For non-spillable batteries, the battery may remain installed if securely attached and protected from short circuit.
special_assistance_contact_general: Special assistance requests must be made during booking through the Somon Air head office or authorized sales agents. Assistance must be confirmed at least 48 hours prior to departure.

manual_wheelchair_policy: As an all-cargo airline, Nippon Cargo Airlines (NCA) does not operate commercial passenger services for the general public. Mobility aids and manual wheelchairs are handled as cargo or unaccompanied baggage. According to NCA's Conditions of Carriage (Article 5), packages of unusual weight, shape, or size require advance arrangement. If special devices are required for safe handling, they must be provided and operated by the shipper or consignee at their own expense.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are transported as cargo or unaccompanied baggage and must comply with IATA Dangerous Goods Regulations (DGR) for battery-powered equipment (UN3171 or UN3481). NCA requires that mobility aids be protected against accidental activation and damage. In accordance with NCA's 'Conditions of Carriage,' the airline may refuse carriage of any items that endanger the aircraft or persons, or which are not packed in a manner suitable for air carriage.
battery_handling_instructions: NCA strictly adheres to IATA DGR. Lithium-ion batteries (UN3480) must be offered for transport at a State of Charge (SoC) not exceeding 30% of their rated capacity. For all mobility aids, terminals must be protected from short circuits, and the device must be deactivated to prevent unintentional operation. NCA specifically requires that single metal-made packages containing dangerous goods be overpacked to prevent leakage or damage. Batteries removed from equipment must be packed in strong, rigid outer packaging.
special_assistance_contact_general: NCA is a cargo-only specialist and does not maintain a commercial passenger special assistance desk. For inquiries regarding the transport of mobility aids as cargo, customers should contact NCA's regional sales or cargo service offices.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Salam Air provides wheelchair assistance free of charge to passengers with permanent disabilities who present a disability identification card at the airport. Other passengers may request wheelchair service for a minimal fee. The airline encourages passengers to notify them of special requirements at least three working days before the flight to ensure proper care. Manual wheelchairs are generally carried in the aircraft hold.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Acceptance of battery-powered wheelchairs is subject to safety conditions and requires prior notification at least three working days before travel. Mobility aids with non-removable lithium-ion batteries are strictly not accepted. For all other electric wheelchairs, measures must be taken to prevent unintentional activation. If the device cannot be stowed or protected adequately in an upright position, the battery must be removed.
battery_types_allowed: Non-spillable (wet, nickel metal hydride, or dry)
battery_handling_instructions: Lithium-ion: Only removable batteries are permitted; they must be removed, have terminals insulated/taped, be placed in protective pouches, and carried in the passenger cabin (limit 300 Wh for a single battery or 160 Wh each for two batteries). Spillable: Must be stowed upright; if not possible, the battery must be removed and placed in a strong, leak-tight, rigid packaging with absorbent material, marked with 'BATTERY, WET, WITH WHEELCHAIR' and 'Corrosive' labels. Non-spillable: If removed, batteries must be stored in strong, rigid packaging in the cargo compartment. All removed batteries must be protected from short circuits.
special_assistance_contact_general: Contact the Salam Air 24/7 Call Centre at 1210 (within Oman) or +968 24 27 2222 (from outside Oman). Special service requests should be submitted at least three working days before the flight date.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Delta accepts manual wheelchairs, including folding, collapsible, and non-folding types. Collapsible manual wheelchairs may be stowed in the aircraft cabin if they meet size restrictions (generally 13 x 36 x 42 inches) and take priority over other carry-on items. If the device is too large for the cabin, it will be checked and stowed in the cargo hold without charge. Customers are encouraged to provide dimensions and weight at least 48 hours before travel to ensure fit.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Delta transports all types of battery-powered wheelchairs and scooters. Passengers are requested to provide 48-hour advance notice and check in at least one hour before departure for battery-powered equipment. Customers should complete and attach a Mobility Device Handling Form to their device to assist agents with safe handling. If a device exceeds cargo door dimensions for a specific aircraft, Delta will work to rebook the passenger on a suitable aircraft.
battery_handling_instructions: To prevent accidental activation, users should turn off the device, remove the key, use a kill switch, or remove the power arm. Battery terminals must be insulated with tape or other non-conductive material to prevent short circuits. For spillable (wet-cell) batteries, upright stowage is required; if the device cannot be stowed upright, the battery must be removed and placed in a specialized battery box provided by Delta. For lithium-ion powered mobility aids with a removable battery, one spare battery up to 300 Wh or two spare batteries up to 160 Wh each are permitted in carry-on baggage.
special_assistance_contact_general: Delta Disability Line

manual_wheelchair_policy: Passengers can request manual wheelchair assistance during the booking process at sales counters, online, or during check-in at the airport. The service generally commences once the passenger has checked in. Air Astra recommends requesting this service at the time of reservation and notifying the airline's experience center prior to the flight to ensure availability.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and mobility aids powered by lithium batteries are accepted as checked-in baggage, provided they comply with IATA Dangerous Goods Regulations. Passengers must inform the Air Astra Reservations department at least 48 hours in advance of travel and must also alert check-in staff at the airport regarding the device and its battery type.
battery_types_allowed: Non-spillable (dry-cell/gel) - implicit via IATA DGR compliance
battery_handling_instructions: For lithium-ion powered devices, the power rating must not exceed 300Wh for a single battery, or 160Wh per battery if the device requires two batteries for operation. All spare batteries must be removed from the mobility aid and carried in the passenger cabin; they are strictly prohibited in checked baggage. A maximum of one spare lithium battery (up to 300Wh) or two spare batteries (up to 160Wh each) is permitted per passenger.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special assistance should contact the Air Astra Experience Center or Reservations department via the hotline or email at least 48 hours before departure.

airline_name: Aerotransportes Mas de Carga S.A. de C.V. (mas)
manual_wheelchair_policy: Aerotransportes Mas de Carga (mas) is a dedicated cargo airline and does not operate scheduled passenger services. Consequently, manual wheelchairs are only accepted as air freight (General Cargo). Shippers must provide the weight and dimensions (length, width, height) at the time of booking to ensure the shipment can be accommodated on the aircraft's cargo deck.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and mobility aids are transported exclusively as air freight and are classified as Dangerous Goods (DG). They must be packaged, labeled, and documented in accordance with the International Air Transport Association (IATA) Dangerous Goods Regulations (DGR). Acceptance is subject to aircraft capacity and the specific cargo configuration of the flight.
battery_handling_instructions: Mobility aid batteries must be handled according to IATA DGR Packing Instructions (e.g., PI 965-970 for lithium). Lithium-ion batteries must generally be protected from short circuits and secured to the device or removed and packed in a protective pouch if required by safety standards. Spillable batteries must be handled in an upright position or removed and packed in leak-proof containers to prevent spills during transport. Shippers must provide a Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS) or battery test report at the time of cargo acceptance.
special_assistance_contact_general: Because 'mas' is a cargo-only airline, there is no passenger special assistance department. For information regarding the shipment of mobility devices as cargo, customers should contact the Customer Care or Cargo Reservations teams.
Legal Name: Aerotransportes Mas de Carga S.A de C.V

manual_wheelchair_policy: Flyone accepts manual wheelchairs and other mobility equipment (crutches, auxiliary equipment) free of charge. Manual wheelchairs must be checked in as hold baggage. The airline specifies that wheelchairs weighing more than 60 kg (excluding the battery) are not accepted for travel. Passengers are encouraged to inform the airline of the wheelchair's weight and dimensions (pliable/non-pliable) at the time of booking.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are accepted only under special conditions and must be checked in as baggage. They must be powered by dry or gel batteries; wheelchairs powered by wet (spillable) or lithium batteries are explicitly stated as not accepted for travel. Equipment must be pre-booked at least 48 to 72 hours before the scheduled departure to ensure the carrier can make necessary arrangements and verify aircraft capacity.
battery_handling_instructions: Batteries must be dry or gel-based to avoid liquid leakage. Before departure, batteries must be disassembled (if possible) and terminals must be separately isolated to prevent short circuits and accidental activation. If the design allows, the battery should be removed and placed in strong, rigid packaging. The passenger must provide written consent if requested for specific battery handling.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special assistance must contact the Flyone Call Center or notify the airline during the booking process at least 48-72 hours before departure. Assistance can also be requested via the 'Manage Booking' section on the official website.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Badr Airlines accepts a passenger's own manual wheelchair as checked baggage without charge and in addition to the standard free baggage allowance. Wheelchair assistance is provided free of charge at the airport. Passengers must notify the airline of their wheelchair requirement at the time of booking. For bookings made via the website, the airline must be contacted at least 48 hours prior to the flight departure.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and battery-powered mobility aids are accepted for carriage as baggage, but they require advance coordination. Passengers requiring special care or mobility assistance must notify the airline during the booking process or at least 48 hours before departure for web bookings. The airline classifies passengers requiring assistance into two categories: 'Passenger requiring care' (can walk to the gate but needs a wheelchair) and 'Passenger requiring special care' (requires assistance walking/boarding and must travel with an escort).
battery_types_allowed: Lithium-ion batteries (subject to IATA Dangerous Goods Regulations)
battery_handling_instructions: Electrical circuits must be inhibited to prevent accidental activation. If a wheelchair is required, passengers must notify the airline at least 48 hours before departure (for website bookings) to ensure proper handling and compliance with safety regulations. Passengers are advised to provide specific details about the battery type and dimensions of the mobility aid at the time of request.
special_assistance_contact_general: Contact the Badr Airlines Customer Care Team or visit a local sales office. General inquiries can be directed to the headquarters in Khartoum.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Nordic Regional Airlines (Norra) operates on behalf of Finnair, and its policies align with Finnair's regulations. Passengers can bring up to two mobility aids at no extra cost. For Norra-operated aircraft, specific size and weight limits apply: ATR 72 aircraft allow a maximum dimension of 150 x 50 x 143 cm (59 x 19.5 x 56 in) and a maximum weight of 200 kg (440 lbs). Embraer 190 aircraft allow a maximum dimension of 140 x 70 x 71 cm (55 x 27.5 x 27.9 in) and a maximum weight of 200 kg (440 lbs). Manual foldable wheelchairs may be brought into the cabin if they do not exceed 55 x 40 x 23 cm (22 x 16 x 9 in) and 12 kg (26.5 lb).
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and scooters must be notified at least 48 hours before departure via the official special assistance form or customer service. Approval is required for all battery-powered mobility aids. Due to space constraints on Norra's regional aircraft (ATR 72 and Embraer 190), the total number of large mobility aids may be limited per flight. Passengers are advised to bring the device user manual and any tools needed to prepare the wheelchair for flight (e.g., to disconnect batteries or fold the device).
battery_handling_instructions: Lithium-ion: If the battery is adequately protected by the device design, it can remain installed with no Wh limit. If removed, the battery must not exceed 300 Wh. A maximum of one spare battery up to 300 Wh or two spares up to 160 Wh each is allowed, and these must be carried in the cabin. Non-spillable batteries: Can remain in the mobility aid if securely attached. Spillable batteries: May remain installed if the device can be loaded upright; otherwise, they must be removed and placed in a special battery box for transport in the hold. All batteries must have terminals protected from short-circuiting and be disconnected if the device is not protected from accidental activation.
special_assistance_contact_general: Special assistance and accessibility services for Norra-operated flights are handled by Finnair. Passengers should use the Finnair Special Assistance Request Form available on the official website or contact the dedicated assistance line.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Passengers may check in up to two mobility devices free of charge. Devices must be checked in at the check-in desk, although passengers can choose to use their own manual wheelchair up to the boarding gate, where it will be stowed in the aircraft hold. There are no explicitly stated weight or dimension limits for manual wheelchairs, but the airline specifies that equipment should be correctly packed and protected.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Vueling permits the carriage of battery-powered wheelchairs and mobility aids subject to prior authorization and safety requirements. Mobility devices with spillable wet batteries are strictly prohibited. Devices with non-spillable batteries (dry, gel, or sealed wet) are accepted without advance authorization if they weigh less than 150 kg and have terminals isolated. For devices exceeding 150 kg or using lithium batteries, approval and specific handling are required.
battery_types_allowed: Non-spillable (dry, gel, or sealed wet batteries)
battery_handling_instructions: Electrical circuits and battery terminals must be isolated to prevent short circuits and accidental activation. Non-removable lithium batteries have no Watt-hour (Wh) limit if they remain attached. Removable lithium-ion batteries must be removed, carried in the cabin, and protected in individual pouches; they must not exceed 300 Wh for a single battery or 160 Wh each for two batteries. Non-spillable spare batteries have no limit to the Wh rating but are limited to one spare. All devices in the hold must be completely switched off.
special_assistance_contact_general: Vueling Special Assistance Service is available for booking and coordination of mobility needs. Assistance must be requested at least 48 hours before departure via the website, app, or dedicated phone lines.

manual_wheelchair_policy: China Eastern Airlines allows passengers to transport one manual folding wheelchair free of charge. For China-US routes, passengers can request to store one adult folding or manually assembled wheelchair in the cabin if the aircraft has designated storage space (usually limited to one wheelchair per flight on a first-come, first-served basis). For such cabin storage, the wheelchair dimensions (without removing parts) must not exceed 33 cm x 91 cm x 106 cm (13 in x 36 in x 42 in). If cabin space is unavailable, the wheelchair will be transported as checked baggage in the cargo hold for free. Passengers are advised to notify the airline at least 48 hours in advance if they require wheelchair assistance.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs must be transported as checked baggage. Passengers are required to notify the airline at least 48 hours before departure and arrive at the airport at least 2 hours (120 minutes) prior to the flight for check-in. The wheelchair must be packaged to prevent accidental activation and short-circuiting. If the wheelchair cannot be loaded into the cargo hold due to size constraints or aircraft type, the airline may assist with rebooking. China Eastern provides specific cargo door dimensions for various aircraft models (e.g., B777, B787, A350) to help passengers determine if their device fits.
battery_handling_instructions: Lithium-ion: If the battery is designed to be removable, it must be removed and carried in the passenger cabin. The rated energy must not exceed 300 Wh for a single battery, or 160 Wh each if the device uses two batteries. Passengers may carry one spare battery up to 300 Wh or two spare batteries up to 160 Wh each in carry-on baggage. Non-spillable: Batteries must be securely attached to the wheelchair, and terminals must be protected from short circuits. If removable, they may be removed and placed in a sturdy rigid package. Spillable: Batteries must be removed and placed in sturdy, leak-proof, rigid packaging with suitable absorbent material to contain any leaks.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers can apply for special assistance via the China Eastern official website, mobile app, or by calling the main customer service hotline at 95530 (within China) or +86 21 206 95530 (Global/Headquarters). Advance notice of 48 hours is required for most mobility services, including electric wheelchair carriage and cabin wheelchair requests.

manual_wheelchair_policy: China Postal Airlines is a dedicated cargo-only airline and does not operate scheduled passenger services. Manual wheelchairs are transported as cargo or express mail. Items must be appropriately packaged for freight transport to prevent damage and ensure stability during flight.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are transported as cargo and must comply with the 'Technical Instructions for the Safe Transport of Dangerous Goods by Air' (ICAO) and IATA Dangerous Goods Regulations. Prior approval and a 'Dangerous Goods Declaration' are required for shipment. The device must be protected from unintentional activation, and the motor must be disengaged.
battery_handling_instructions: Batteries must be securely attached to the mobility aid or removed if the design allows. For lithium-ion batteries: if removed, the battery must not exceed 300Wh (or two batteries not exceeding 160Wh each). All removed batteries and spare batteries must be individually protected to prevent short circuits by insulating terminals (e.g., taping over exposed terminals) and must be placed in a strong, rigid packaging. Non-spillable batteries must remain securely attached to the device with terminals protected.
special_assistance_contact_general: As a cargo-only carrier, special assistance is provided through the cargo and logistics departments regarding the transport of mobility aids as freight. General inquiries can be directed to the Beijing headquarters.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Discover Airlines transports manual wheelchairs free of charge. Passengers are requested to notify the airline at least 48 hours before departure (72 hours for flights to/from the USA) with the wheelchair's weight and dimensions (length, width, height in folded state). On flights to/from the USA, a collapsible manual wheelchair can be stowed in the aircraft cabin on a first-come, first-served basis if space is available in the designated stowage area. If cabin stowage is not possible, the wheelchair will be transported in the cargo hold. Detachable parts like cushions and footrests should be carried in the cabin.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Transport of electric wheelchairs requires prior approval from Discover Airlines. Passengers must complete the 'Information on Electric Mobility Aids' form and submit it to mobilitydevices.discover-airlines@lufthansa-group.com at least 48 hours before departure. Approval is based on the technical specifications of the device and aircraft cargo door dimensions (A320/A321 and A330). Effective October 1, 2025, wheelchairs with permanently installed, non-removable lithium batteries are limited to a maximum of two batteries, each with a capacity of up to 160 Wh. The device must be protected against accidental activation and damage.
battery_types_allowed: Non-spillable wet batteries (gel, nickel-cadmium, nickel-metal hydride, sealed-lead-acid)
battery_handling_instructions: For all battery types, terminals must be individually isolated to prevent short circuits. Removable lithium-ion batteries must be detached and carried in the passenger cabin; limits for removable batteries are either max 2 batteries up to 300 Wh each (including 1 spare) or max 4 batteries up to 160 Wh each (including 2 spares). Non-spillable batteries may remain attached if securely fastened and protected from short circuits. Spillable batteries are only accepted if the mobility aid can be loaded, stowed, and unloaded in an upright position at all times. Batteries must be clearly labeled as 'LEAK-PROOF' or 'NOT LEAK-PROOF'.
special_assistance_contact_general: Discover Airlines Service Center (Germany): +49 (0) 69 86 798 200 (Daily 08:00–22:00 CET); USA Service: +1 833 737 1414 (Daily 08:00–22:00 EST).

airline_name: Virgin Australia International Airlines Pty Ltd.
manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs are accepted for carriage. Guests may choose to use their own wheelchair through the airport to the boarding gate (subject to local airport restrictions) or check it in. Wheelchairs must fit within aircraft-specific dimensions. Maximum dimensions: Boeing 737 (H: 84cm, W: 100cm, L: 125cm, Max Weight: 120kg); Airbus A320 (H: 84cm, W: 100cm, L: 125cm, Max Weight: 80kg); Fokker F70/F100 (H: 65cm, W: 100cm, L: 125cm, Max Weight: 80-120kg); Embraer E190 (H: 80cm, W: 74cm, L: 125cm, Max Weight: 80kg). Weights and dimensions apply to both folded and unfolded states. Devices exceeding these limits require prior contact with the Guest Contact Centre at least 72 hours before travel.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric mobility aids are accepted but must travel in an upright position in 'free wheel' mode. They are stowed in the aircraft hold. Virgin Australia staff cannot assist with the dismantling or reassembling of mobility aids; guests must prepare their device for travel. The device must be protected against accidental activation (e.g., by removing the key or isolating the battery).
battery_handling_instructions: Battery terminals must be protected from short circuits (e.g., by taping over exposed terminals). For Lithium-ion: If the battery is designed to be removed, it must not exceed 300Wh and must be carried in the cabin. One spare lithium-ion battery up to 300Wh or two spares up to 160Wh each are permitted in the cabin. Non-spillable batteries removed for transport must be carried in strong, rigid packaging provided by the user and stowed in the hold. If the battery remains attached, it must be securely fixed to the mobility aid.
special_assistance_contact_general: Assistance can be requested via the 'Specific Service Request' form on the official website or by calling the Guest Contact Centre. It is highly recommended to notify the airline at least 48 to 72 hours before departure.
Legal Name: Virgin Australia International Airlines Pty Ltd.

manual_wheelchair_policy: ASL Airlines France carries up to two items of mobility equipment (e.g., wheelchair, walker) free of charge in the hold, in addition to the standard baggage allowance. This is subject to available space on the aircraft. Passengers must inform the airline or their travel agent of their needs at the time of booking or at least 48 hours before the flight's departure. Required information includes the type of wheelchair (manual, foldable/non-foldable), dimensions in the folded position (length x width x height), and weight.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are transported free of charge in the hold. Passengers must provide notification at least 48 hours before departure (or 96 hours for wheelchairs with wet batteries). At the time of booking, passengers must provide the device's weight, dimensions (folded), and battery type. Carriage may be refused if preliminary information is not provided or if safety requirements regarding dangerous goods are not met.
battery_handling_instructions: For Lithium-ion batteries, the energy must not exceed 300 Wh for a single battery or 160 Wh each for two batteries; these must be removed from the device and carried in the cabin with terminals protected against short circuits. Non-spillable (dry) batteries must be securely attached to the wheelchair, and terminals must be protected from short circuits to prevent accidental activation. Spillable (wet) batteries require special precautions and specific prior approval from the airline, as they may compromise flight safety.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special assistance must notify ASL Airlines France or their travel agent at least 48 hours before departure. If the ticket was purchased via a tour operator, that operator is the primary contact for assistance requests. For medical authorizations or unusual assistance needs, passengers must contact the ASL Airlines France Medical Department at least 48 hours in advance.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs can be checked at the ticket counter or at the gate free of charge. They are not counted against the passenger's baggage allowance. Assistive devices such as walkers and canes may be stowed in the aircraft cabin (overhead bin or under the seat) provided they do not impede access to emergency exits or protrude into the aisle. For larger manual wheelchairs, stowage occurs in the cargo hold. Cargo door dimensions for Sun Country's 737 aircraft are 48 inches (width) by 35 inches (height) for the forward door, and 48 inches (width) by 33 inches (height) for the rear door.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Powered wheelchairs and scooters should be loaded and stowed in an upright position. If the device fits upright through the aircraft cargo door, it should not be disassembled and batteries should remain attached. If the device does not fit, it may require disassembly; in such cases, passengers are asked to provide written handling and disassembly instructions. Sun Country recommends arriving at the airport at least one hour before the standard check-in time for any electrical equipment to ensure proper dangerous goods handling.
battery_types_allowed: Non-spillable (Dry cell, Gel cell, Sealed Lead Acid)
Spillable (Wet cell) - Allowed only for powering mobility devices
battery_handling_instructions: Batteries should remain attached to the mobility device if it can be loaded upright. If the device must be tilted or disassembled, batteries must be handled according to their type: Non-spillable batteries must be securely attached to the chair or removed and placed in a strong, rigid packaging. Lithium-ion batteries that are removable must be removed, terminals protected from short-circuiting, and carried in the passenger cabin (typically limited to 300Wh for a single battery or 160Wh each for two batteries, per FAA/IATA standards). Spare (uninstalled) lithium batteries must be in carry-on baggage only. Spillable batteries require specific protective packaging and must be identified as spillable to ensure proper hazardous materials handling.
