special_assistance_contact_general: KLM Cares provides dedicated support for passengers with disabilities. Requests should be made at least 48 hours before departure via the website form, phone, or email.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Finnair allows up to two mobility aids (e.g., manual wheelchairs, walkers) free of charge. Necessary mobility aids like foldable manual wheelchairs, canes, or crutches can be brought into the cabin as an extra allowance if they meet dimensions of 55 x 40 x 23 cm (22 x 16 x 9 in) and weigh no more than 12 kg (26.5 lb). On direct flights to/from the United States operated with Airbus A330 and A350 aircraft, one manual foldable wheelchair (max 33 x 92 x 107 cm / 13 x 36 x 42 in) may be stored in the cabin on a first-come, first-served basis. Larger wheelchairs are transported in the aircraft hold with weight limits of 300 kg (661 lb) for Airbus and 200 kg (440 lb) for ATR/Embraer aircraft.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and mobility aids require prior approval from Finnair at least 48 hours before departure. Passengers are requested to provide dimensions, weight, and battery details (type, Watt-hours) via the special assistance form. It is recommended to bring the user manual and any necessary tools for disassembly. Easily detachable parts should be removed and taken into the cabin or secured to the device. Loading is subject to aircraft cargo hold door dimensions, with the smallest doors being on Embraer 190 (110 x 90 cm) and ATR 72 (129 x 150 cm).
battery_handling_instructions: Batteries must be protected from short circuits by taping over terminals or using original packaging. For Lithium-ion: If the battery is installed and protected by the device design, there is no Watt-hour (Wh) limit; if removed, it must not exceed 300 Wh. A maximum of two spare lithium-ion batteries are allowed (either 1x 300 Wh or 2x 160 Wh), which must be carried in the cabin. Non-spillable batteries can remain installed; max one spare is allowed and transported in the cargo hold. Spillable batteries can only remain installed if the device can be loaded and stored upright; no spare spillable batteries are permitted.
special_assistance_contact_general: Assistance must be requested at least 48 hours before departure through the Finnair Special Assistance Request and Information Form on the official website.

manual_wheelchair_policy: FlexFlight permits the carriage of manual wheelchairs as checked baggage. Due to the small size of the aircraft in their fleet (e.g., Pilatus PC-12 and Bombardier Challenger 604/605), passengers are advised to notify the airline in advance to ensure the equipment can fit through the cargo door and within the compartment dimensions. Standard EU Regulation (EC) No 1107/2006 applies, ensuring assistance is provided free of charge for persons with reduced mobility.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric mobility aids are accepted but require prior approval at least 48 to 72 hours before departure. The device must be protected against accidental activation. For the safety of the flight, the airline may require the device to be stowed in the cargo hold, and it must meet specific weight and dimension limits compatible with the operating aircraft (e.g., PC-12 or Challenger).
battery_handling_instructions: Batteries must be securely attached to the wheelchair or disconnected and terminals insulated with non-conductive tape to prevent short circuits. Lithium-ion batteries that are removable must be removed, protected in individual pouches, and carried in the passenger cabin. The maximum watt-hour (Wh) rating for a single lithium-ion battery is 300Wh, or 160Wh each for two batteries. Spillable batteries must be handled and stowed in an upright position to prevent leakage.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special assistance should contact the support department or the sales office at the time of booking. For flights booked under the W2 GDS code, assistance requests must be coordinated through the ticketing support service.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Petroleum Air Services (PAS) does not explicitly detail specific manual wheelchair weight or dimension limits on its public website. However, as an IATA member, the airline typically accepts manual wheelchairs as checked baggage free of charge. Passengers are advised to contact the commercial services department at com@pas.com.eg or by phone at +(202)-24032180 at the time of booking to provide dimensions and weight for stowage planning.
electric_wheelchair_policy: PAS adheres to international IATA safety standards for the transport of electric mobility aids. Passengers must notify the airline at least 48 hours in advance if traveling with a battery-powered wheelchair. The airline requires details on the type of battery and dimensions of the chair to ensure it can be safely stowed in the aircraft cargo hold. Assistance for boarding and deplaning is provided, but specific handling instructions should be provided by the passenger at check-in.
battery_types_allowed: Lithium-ion (Typically limited to 300Wh for a single battery or 160Wh each for two batteries)
battery_handling_instructions: In accordance with IATA Dangerous Goods Regulations, batteries must be securely attached to the wheelchair and terminals protected from short circuits. For lithium-ion powered devices, if the battery is designed to be removed, it must be taken into the cabin as carry-on baggage. Electrical circuits must be isolated to prevent accidental activation. Passengers are encouraged to carry the manufacturer’s instructions for disconnecting the battery.
special_assistance_contact_general: For special assistance requests, passengers should contact the PAS Commercial Services or Headquarter offices. General Phone: +(202)-24032180 (9 lines), Fax: +(202)-24024449.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs are transported free of charge and are only held as checked luggage in the aircraft hold; cabin stowage is not available. According to official guidelines, restrictions regarding the weight or size of the wheelchair are non-applicable.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are transported free of charge in the cargo hold. Passengers must notify the airline at least 48 to 72 hours in advance. Ground staff will prepare the device by removing loose parts, adjusting the seat back to its lowest position, and unplugging the battery via the main switch.
battery_handling_instructions: Batteries must be unplugged using the main switch and terminals must be insulated to prevent short circuits. For lithium-ion batteries, a maximum capacity of 300 Wh is allowed for the device. If the battery is removable, it must be carried in the cabin; if not, it remains in the device in the hold. A maximum of one spare lithium battery up to 300 Wh or two spares up to 160 Wh each may be carried in the cabin.
special_assistance_contact_general: Assistance can be requested during booking online, via 'Manage My Booking', or by contacting the Call Center at least 48 to 72 hours before departure. An INCAD (Incapacitated Passengers Handling Advice Document) may be required for certain mobility levels (WCHS/WCHC).

manual_wheelchair_policy: As CityJet operates exclusively as a wet-lease provider for other airlines (e.g., SAS, Lufthansa, Brussels Airlines), manual wheelchair carriage is subject to the policies of the marketing carrier. Physically, manual wheelchairs are stowed in the aircraft hold (primarily Bombardier CRJ900/1000). Passengers must notify the marketing airline at least 48 hours in advance to ensure the device fits the specific hold dimensions (typical CRJ door height is approximately 33 inches/84 cm).
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are accepted as checked baggage but must be authorized by the marketing carrier (SAS, Lufthansa, etc.). The device must be prepared for transport by protecting it from accidental activation. For the Bombardier CRJ fleet, weight and height limits apply (often a 300 lb/136 kg limit per item on regional jets), and the airline requires dimensions to be provided at the time of booking to verify fitment in the cargo compartment.
battery_handling_instructions: CityJet follows IATA Dangerous Goods Regulations. Lithium-ion batteries must not exceed 300Wh (or two batteries not exceeding 160Wh each). If the battery is removable, it must be taken into the cabin. Non-spillable batteries may remain attached if securely fastened and terminals are protected from short circuits. Spillable batteries must be loaded, stowed, secured, and unloaded in an upright position; if not possible, the battery must be removed and stored in a strong, rigid battery box.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers traveling on flights 'Operated by CityJet' must contact the airline they are ticketed with (e.g., SAS at +46 8 797 0000, Lufthansa at +49 69 86 799 799, or Brussels Airlines at +32 2 723 23 45) for all special assistance requests. CityJet does not process individual passenger assistance requests directly.
Legal Name: Business City Express Limited d/b/a CityJet

manual_wheelchair_policy: TUIfly allows passengers to bring up to two mobility aids free of charge, but manual wheelchairs require pre-registration. For European and Mediterranean destinations, the folded wheelchair must not exceed the maximum dimensions of 86 cm in height, 119 cm in width, and 119 cm in length. Manual wheelchairs must be labeled at the check-in desk and are transported in the baggage hold. Passengers can typically use their wheelchair until the gate.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and mobility aids must be pre-registered using the airline's special assistance form. They must be transported in an upright position. The maximum height permitted for the device is 86 cm (for European/Mediterranean routes). Only dry (non-spillable) and lithium-ion batteries are accepted; wet (spillable) batteries are strictly prohibited. Devices must be packaged sufficiently to prevent damage, or they may be refused carriage.
battery_handling_instructions: Electrical circuits must be insulated to prevent accidental activation by removing the key, using a special plug, or disconnecting the cables. Battery terminals (poles) must be protected from short circuits (e.g., by taping over exposed terminals). If the lithium-ion battery is removable, it must be removed and carried in the passenger cabin. If it is embedded, the power must be switched off and terminals insulated. For lithium batteries, a maximum capacity of 300 Wh for a single battery or 160 Wh each for two batteries is permitted.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring assistance should register their mobility aid during the booking process or via the contact form on the official website. For existing bookings, the Service Center can be reached by phone or email.

airline_name: Global Aviation Operations (Pty) Ltd. (trading as LIFT)
manual_wheelchair_policy: A passenger's own manual wheelchair or mobility aid is carried free of charge and stowed in the aircraft hold. Wheelchair service is available from the LIFT check-in counters to the aircraft and from the aircraft to the arrival halls. Requests must be added during booking as the number of requests per flight is limited.
electric_wheelchair_policy: No battery-powered wheelchair or mobility aid weighing in excess of 32 kg is allowed on board. If the weight exceeds 32 kg, the item must be transported as cargo, and arrangements for such transport must be made by the passenger. Passengers must notify the airline of their mobility aid at least 48 hours before departure.
battery_types_allowed: Battery-powered mobility aids (unspecified types, subject to weight limit)
battery_handling_instructions: Special assistance requests, including those for battery-powered mobility aids, must be requested via the Customer Support Desk no later than 48 hours prior to departure. The airline reviews information provided in the special assistance form to confirm requirements.
special_assistance_contact_general: LIFT Customer Support Desk

manual_wheelchair_policy: DHL Air Ltd. is a cargo-only airline and does not operate scheduled commercial passenger flights. Manual wheelchairs are transported as cargo (freight). They must be declared as general cargo and are subject to the aircraft's hold dimensions (e.g., Boeing 757-200 freighter or Boeing 777-200F). Shippers must provide the weight and dimensions (Length x Width x Height) at the time of booking to ensure compatibility with the cargo loading systems.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and mobility aids are classified as Dangerous Goods for air transport (UN3481 for Lithium-ion or UN2794/UN2800 for wet/non-spillable batteries). They must be securely stowed in an upright position and protected from damage by the movement of other cargo. The device must be deactivated, and the electrical circuits must be isolated to prevent accidental activation during the flight. For 'Cargo Aircraft Only' (CAO) shipments, specific labeling and documentation are mandatory.
battery_handling_instructions: For Lithium-ion batteries: The State of Charge (SoC) must not exceed 30% of their rated capacity for air transport. Batteries must be securely attached to the mobility aid or removed and packed in a strong, rigid outer packaging if the device design does not provide adequate protection. For non-spillable batteries: They must be protected from short circuits by insulating the terminals (e.g., with non-conductive tape) and be securely attached to the wheelchair. For spillable batteries: The battery must be removed if the aid cannot be loaded and stowed in an upright position at all times, and it must be packed in a leak-proof specialized battery box.
special_assistance_contact_general: As a cargo carrier, DHL provides accessibility support through its DHL Express UK 'Accessible Collections and Deliveries Charter' for customers requiring extra assistance with parcel handling and courier services.

airline_name: Nauru Air Corporation (trading as Nauru Airlines)
manual_wheelchair_policy: Nauru Airlines transports manual wheelchairs at no extra cost. In most airports, passengers can keep their manual wheelchair until the boarding gate, where it will be collected for stowage in the cargo hold. Passengers must provide the type, dimensions, weight, and whether the wheelchair is foldable at the time of booking. For the Boeing 737 aircraft, the mobility aid must fit within the maximum dimensions of 100cm (width) x 84cm (height) x 125cm (length). Manual wheelchairs must fit within these restrictions in an upright position; if they do not, they can only be carried if they weigh less than 32kg and the manufacturer confirms they can be transported on their side.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and mobility scooters must be checked in as baggage and cannot be reclaimed during stopovers. They must travel in an upright position (folded or unfolded) in 'free wheel' mode. For Boeing 737 aircraft, dimensions are limited to 100cm (width) x 84cm (height) x 125cm (length). Requests for electric wheelchair transport must be made at least 72 hours before the flight. Equipment exceeding 32kg must be able to travel upright in free wheel mode; otherwise, it may be carried as freight at standard rates.
battery_handling_instructions: Batteries must be securely attached to the mobility aid and the motor must be disengaged. Battery terminals must be insulated to prevent accidental short circuits, and the battery should be disconnected. Passengers are responsible for the assembly and disassembly of their mobility aids, though airport ground staff may provide assistance under the passenger's supervision and instruction.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring assistance should notify the airline at least 72 hours prior to travel. For those booking online, contact a local Nauru Airlines office or Sales Agent immediately after purchase to confirm arrangements.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Passengers can carry two pieces of mobility equipment free of charge, which do not count toward the standard baggage allowance. Requests for wheelchair assistance should be made at the time of booking or at least 48 to 72 hours prior to departure. Large or heavy manual wheelchairs may be carried as checked baggage. Onboard stowage of assistive devices is available if space permits. A charge of LKR 5000 applies for wheelchair requests made at Colombo airport without prior notice (except for flights to/from the U.S.).
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are accepted with prior approval and must meet safety safeguards. For collapsible mobility aids with lithium-ion batteries, the battery must be removed and carried in the passenger cabin. The device itself is typically carried as checked baggage. For non-collapsible devices, batteries must be securely attached and disconnected/isolated to prevent accidental activation.
battery_types_allowed: Non-spillable wet batteries (Sealed Lead Acid, AGM, Gel)
Lithium-ion batteries (max 300Wh for single or 160Wh each for two)
Spillable batteries (subject to specific handling and removal if not kept upright)
battery_handling_instructions: For lithium-ion powered mobility aids, batteries must be removed if the device is collapsible and carried in the cabin. Terminals must be protected from short circuits (e.g., by taping over exposed terminals) and placed in a protective pouch or rigid case. For non-spillable batteries, they must be securely attached to the wheelchair, and the electrical circuits must be isolated. Spillable batteries must be removed and carried in special leak-proof packaging if the wheelchair cannot be loaded, stowed, and unloaded in an upright position.
special_assistance_contact_general: SriLankan Airlines 24-hour Global Contact Centre and the Passenger Service Unit at Colombo airport handle special assistance requests. Requests should ideally be lodged via the 'Disability Assistance Request' form on the official website at least 72 hours before flight departure.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs and mobility devices without batteries are accepted as unchecked baggage. Guests can use their own wheelchair up to the aircraft door or passenger steps, after which it must be handed to staff for loading into the aircraft hold. Assistive devices weighing up to 15 kg are carried free of charge as additional baggage, subject to aircraft limitations. Pre-booking is required at least 48 hours prior to departure.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Battery-operated wheelchairs and mobility devices must be checked in. Guests are required to pre-book wheelchair services at the time of booking or via the 'Manage Booking' section on the website at least 48 hours before departure. A 'Battery Powered Wheelchair Information Form' must be submitted to the airline. Guests using their own electric mobility aids should report to the airport at least two hours prior to departure.
battery_handling_instructions: For Lithium-ion batteries: Batteries must be removed at the check-in counter and carried by the guest in the cabin in an appropriate manufacturer-issued battery pouch. The power rating must not exceed 300 Wh (for a single battery) or 160 Wh (per battery for a two-battery system). For Non-Lithium (Non-Spillable) batteries: The battery must be securely attached to the device, terminals protected from short circuits (enclosed in a manufacturer container), and electrical circuits inhibited. If the device is collapsible, the battery must be removed and carried in strong, rigid packaging. Spillable batteries are strictly forbidden.
special_assistance_contact_general: Guests requiring special assistance should contact the Global Contact Centre or use the live chat ('Tia') on the official website. Stretcher requests must be made at least 72 hours in advance through the call center.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Silk Way West Airlines is a dedicated cargo-only carrier and does not operate scheduled passenger services. Manual wheelchairs are accepted for transport as cargo (Special Cargo) in accordance with the airline's 'Conditions of Carriage' for cargo. Items must be properly packaged as general or special cargo depending on dimensions and weight.
electric_wheelchair_policy: As a cargo-only airline, electric wheelchairs are transported as Dangerous Goods (DG). Silk Way West Airlines is IATA CEIV Lithium Battery certified, ensuring that mobility aids with batteries are handled, stowed, and transported according to the highest international safety standards (IATA Dangerous Goods Regulations).
battery_handling_instructions: Handling must comply with IATA Dangerous Goods Regulations (DGR). As a CEIV Lithium Battery certified carrier, the airline requires batteries to be protected from short circuits and secured to prevent accidental activation. Lithium-ion batteries must generally meet UN 38.3 test requirements. Specific handling (e.g., disconnection or removal) depends on the battery type and packaging as specified in the Air Waybill (AWB).
special_assistance_contact_general: Silk Way West Airlines does not have a passenger special assistance department. For inquiries regarding the transport of mobility aids as cargo, customers should contact their Head Office or local cargo sales office.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Privilege Style carries one manual wheelchair or mobility aid per passenger free of charge as hold luggage, provided there is sufficient space in the aircraft hold at the time of booking. Requests must be made via the passenger's tour operator no later than 48 hours prior to travel, specifying the wheelchair type, dimensions, and weight.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and mobility aids are carried as hold luggage free of charge (one per passenger), subject to space availability. Requests must be made through the tour operator at least 48 hours before departure. The airline requires details on the type, dimensions, weight, and battery type of the device. Equipment with wet spillable batteries is strictly prohibited.
battery_handling_instructions: Passengers must notify the airline via their tour operator at least 48 hours in advance with specific details about the battery type and mobility aid specifications. Wet spillable batteries are not accepted. For other battery types, safe and secure transportation conditions must be met, typically involving protecting terminals from short circuits and preventing accidental activation.
special_assistance_contact_general: As a charter airline, Privilege Style requires all special assistance requests, including wheelchair carriage, to be made through the passenger's tour operator or travel agent at least 48 hours prior to travel. General inquiries can be directed to the airline's headquarters in Spain.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Airhub Airlines provides assistance for passengers with reduced mobility. Manual wheelchairs are carried free of charge and typically stowed in the aircraft hold. Passengers are required to request wheelchair assistance at least 48 hours before the scheduled time of departure to ensure the necessary accommodations are made.
electric_wheelchair_policy: The carriage of battery-powered wheelchairs and mobility aids requires prior approval from the airline as they are classified as dangerous goods. Requests for electric mobility aids should be submitted at least 48 hours in advance. The device must be prepared for transport by protecting the battery terminals from short circuits and preventing accidental activation. If the device cannot be loaded and stowed upright, the battery may need to be removed.
battery_handling_instructions: For lithium-ion batteries: If the battery is removable, it must be removed and carried in the cabin; if it is built-in, the device must be protected from accidental activation. A single lithium-ion battery must not exceed 300Wh, or if two batteries are used, each must not exceed 160Wh. For non-spillable and spillable batteries: Terminals must be insulated to prevent short circuits. Spillable batteries require the device to be stowed upright; otherwise, the battery must be removed and packed in a leak-proof container.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special assistance should contact the airline's support or sales departments at least 48 hours prior to travel. Since the airline focuses on ACMI and charter operations, passengers should also coordinate with the tour operator or the contracting airline through which the booking was made.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Korean Air transports manual wheelchairs and walking aids free of charge. Passengers may use their personal wheelchairs up to the boarding gate. If the dimensions of the wheelchair exceed 122 cm (width) x 84 cm (height), passengers must contact the Service Center in advance as it may not fit on smaller aircraft like the Boeing 737. Maximum sizes for larger aircraft are 157 cm x 149 cm (B787, 777, 747, A330, A350, A380) and 109 cm x 149 cm (A321).
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are transported in the cargo compartment free of charge. Passengers must notify the airline at the time of booking or at least 48 hours before departure. The airline will inspect the wheelchair for pre-existing damage during check-in. Acceptance is subject to the cargo door dimensions of the specific aircraft; if a wheelchair exceeds these dimensions, the airline may assist in finding an alternative flight.
battery_handling_instructions: For Lithium-ion batteries: Removable batteries must be removed, terminals protected from short circuits (e.g., with tape), and carried in the passenger cabin. A single removable battery must not exceed 300Wh, or two batteries must not exceed 160Wh each. For non-removable batteries, the electrical circuit must be isolated (switched off or disconnected) to prevent accidental activation. For Non-spillable batteries: Must be securely attached and terminals protected. For Spillable batteries: Must be loaded and stowed in an upright position and equipped with spill-resistant vent caps where feasible.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers can request assistance via the Korean Air website under 'Manage Booking' or by calling the Service Center. For flights to/from the U.S. and major Korean airports (Incheon and Busan), Complaint Resolution Officials (CROs) are available to resolve disability-related concerns.

manual_wheelchair_policy: New Pacific Airlines allows one manual wheelchair per passenger to be carried free of charge as checked baggage, provided it meets sizing requirements. Due to limited aircraft size and cargo hold capacity on their fleet, oversized and overweight mobility aids presented without a prearranged reservation may travel on a space-available basis. Wheelchairs are typically carried in the cargo compartment of the aircraft.
electric_wheelchair_policy: New Pacific Airlines accepts battery-powered wheelchairs and mobility aids as checked baggage. The airline requires that these devices be properly prepared for transport to prevent accidental activation and damage. Devices containing non-spillable batteries or lithium-ion batteries with a rating of 300 Wh or less are accepted. Because of limited cargo hold dimensions, passengers are encouraged to provide the dimensions and weight of the device in advance.
battery_handling_instructions: For battery-powered mobility aids, battery terminals must be protected from short circuits (e.g., by being enclosed in a battery container). Lithium-ion batteries must have a watt-hour rating of 300 Wh or less and, according to the airline's Contract of Carriage, may be carried as baggage or checked. Non-spillable batteries must be securely attached to the mobility aid and protected from damage.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special assistance or traveling with mobility aids should contact the New Pacific Airlines Help Center as far in advance as possible to ensure space and proper handling. A minimum of 48 hours' notice is recommended for special requirements.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Bangkok Airways allows passengers to carry one personal manual wheelchair at no extra charge, which must be loaded into the aircraft compartment. Passengers must notify the airline at least 48 hours prior to departure and provide the size, type, measurements, and weight of the wheelchair. Maximum weight allowed for a personal wheelchair is 120 kg. Maximum dimensions are aircraft-specific: ATR72 (50 x 100 x 50 cm) and A319/A320 (145 x 160 x 110 cm). Additional manual wheelchairs are subject to excess baggage charges.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Passengers traveling with battery-powered wheelchairs or mobility aids must notify Bangkok Airways at least 48 hours in advance. Information required includes the wheelchair type, dimensions, tare (unladen) weight, number of batteries, battery type, and Watt-hour (Wh) or voltage rating. The aid must be protected against damage and inadvertent operation. Maximum weight for electric mobility aids is 120 kg, and dimensions must fit within the specific aircraft's cargo door limits (ATR72: 50 x 100 x 50 cm; A319/A320: 145 x 160 x 110 cm).
battery_types_allowed: Dry batteries (Nickel-Metal Hydride, Alkali-manganese, Zinc-carbon, Nickel-cadmium)
battery_handling_instructions: Passengers must provide instructions for preventing inadvertent operation. For Lithium-ion batteries, if the mobility aid does not provide adequate protection, the batteries must be removed and carried in the passenger cabin. Spare non-spillable batteries are limited to a maximum of two, and each must be 12V or less and 100 Wh or less. All batteries must be protected from short circuits by insulating terminals.
special_assistance_contact_general: Special assistance requests, including wheelchair services, should be made at the time of booking or at least 24 hours before departure (48 hours for personal wheelchairs). Contact the Bangkok Airways Reservation Center or the Call Center for arrangements.

airline_name: Estafeta Carga Aerea S.A. de C.V.
manual_wheelchair_policy: As Estafeta Carga Aerea is strictly a cargo airline, it does not have a passenger mobility policy. Manual wheelchairs are transported as commercial cargo (Courier or LTL Freight). For courier services, individual packages typically have a maximum weight limit of 68 kg (150 lbs). Larger or heavier items must be shipped via LTL (Less Than Truckload) palletized freight services.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are handled exclusively as commercial cargo and are classified as Dangerous Goods (DG). They must be properly declared, packaged, and labeled in accordance with IATA Dangerous Goods Regulations. Shippers must ensure the device is secured to a pallet if sent via LTL to prevent movement and damage.
battery_handling_instructions: Shipping must comply with IATA Dangerous Goods Regulations (DGR). Lithium-ion batteries must be shipped at a State of Charge (SoC) not exceeding 30%. For batteries contained in equipment, terminals must be protected from short circuits, and the device must be protected from accidental activation. A Shipper's Declaration for Dangerous Goods (DGD) is required for most battery-powered mobility aids shipped as cargo.
special_assistance_contact_general: Estafeta Customer Service (Atención al Cliente)
Legal Name: Estafeta Carga Aerea S.A. de C.V.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Passengers may bring their own manual wheelchair or mobility aids (canes, crutches, walkers, etc.) free of charge for up to one (1) unit per passenger. Additional units are included in the free baggage allowance (FBA) and subject to excess baggage fees if they exceed it. Personal wheelchairs are not allowed inside the aircraft cabin due to limited space and must be stowed in the baggage/hold compartment as fragile items. Fully collapsible wheelchairs are also accepted for free as checked baggage.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are allowed as checked-in baggage. Passengers must inform the Reservations department at least 48 hours in advance and alert check-in staff at the airport. Devices are treated as fragile baggage and stowed in the hold. For wide-body aircraft (Boeing 777-300ER and Airbus A330), an on-board wheelchair (WCOB) is available for cabin use; narrow-body aircraft (Boeing 737 series) do not have on-board wheelchairs.
battery_handling_instructions: Lithium battery power ratings must not exceed 300Wh for a single battery, or 160Wh each if the device requires two batteries. A maximum of one (1) spare lithium battery (up to 300Wh) or two (2) spares (up to 160Wh each) may be carried in the passenger cabin. Spare batteries are strictly prohibited in checked baggage. Terminals must be insulated (e.g., with tape) to prevent short circuits. Batteries must be securely attached to the device or, if removable, must be taken out and carried in the passenger cabin. Electrical circuits must be inhibited to prevent accidental activation.
special_assistance_contact_general: Contact the 24-hour Contact Center at 0804 1 807 807 (within Indonesia) or +62 21 2351 9999 (International). Assistance can also be requested via WhatsApp at +62 811 2807 807.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Passengers can carry up to two mobility aids free of charge. Standard dimension limits for mobility aids are 130 x 85 x 70 cm with a maximum weight of 80 kg; if your aid exceeds these specifications, you must contact the airline in advance to check loading options. Folding wheelchairs can typically be used up to the departure gate and are loaded directly at the aircraft (Delivery at Aircraft).
electric_wheelchair_policy: Transport approval is required and must be requested at least 48 hours before departure. Technical details, such as the manufacturer's datasheet or manual, must be provided via the mobility aid form. Electric wheelchairs are subject to specific safety restrictions regarding battery type and capacity.
battery_handling_instructions: Lithium-ion: Removable batteries must be taken into the cabin; capacity is limited to one battery up to 300 Wh or two batteries up to 160 Wh each. Effective October 1, 2025, non-removable lithium batteries are limited to two batteries of max 160 Wh each. Non-spillable/Wet: Batteries must be securely attached, disconnected, and terminals protected from short circuits. Wet batteries must be transported upright; if they cannot be kept upright, the battery must be removed and shipped as cargo.
special_assistance_contact_general: Assistance should be requested at the time of booking or at least 48 hours before departure through the Service Centre or the online contact form.

manual_wheelchair_policy: As a primary ACMI (Aircraft, Crew, Maintenance, and Insurance) and charter provider, Air Atlanta Icelandic does not publish specific dimension or weight limits for manual wheelchairs on its official website. Passengers are subject to the policies of the marketing carrier (the airline from which the ticket was purchased) or the charter organizer. Generally, following IATA standards, up to two mobility aids are carried free of charge in addition to the standard baggage allowance, provided they fit within the aircraft's cargo hold dimensions.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs must be declared to the marketing carrier or charter organizer at the time of booking (minimum 48 hours notice). The device must be prepared for transport by protecting it against accidental activation (e.g., by removing the key or disconnecting the power cable) and ensuring the battery is securely attached and terminals are insulated to prevent short circuits. The airline adheres to IATA Dangerous Goods Regulations for the safe handling and stowage of power-driven mobility aids.
battery_handling_instructions: For Lithium-ion batteries: If the battery is removable (collapsible design), it must be removed and carried in the passenger cabin; the battery capacity must not exceed 300 Wh, or 160 Wh each if two batteries are required. For Non-spillable batteries: The battery may remain installed if securely attached and terminals are protected from short circuit. For Spillable batteries: These may remain installed if the wheelchair can be loaded and stowed in an upright position; otherwise, the battery must be removed and packed in a leak-proof container in accordance with safety regulations. Passengers are advised to contact the airline directly for specific handling of spillable batteries.
special_assistance_contact_general: Because Air Atlanta Icelandic typically operates flights on behalf of other airlines, passengers must contact the marketing carrier or travel agent to request special assistance. Direct inquiries for the operating carrier can be made to their headquarters in Iceland.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Alaska Airlines transports all types of manual wheelchairs, including folding, collapsible, and non-folding models, at no additional charge. One personal folding, collapsible, or breakdown wheelchair can be stowed in the passenger cabin on Alaska flights 1-1499 on a first-come, first-served basis, provided it meets the size and weight restrictions for the approved storage space. Otherwise, manual wheelchairs can be checked at the ticket counter or departure gate. Detachable items such as seat cushions and footrests may be carried into the cabin or checked with the device. Maximum dimensions are generally 33 inches in height and 34 inches in width to fit through the aircraft's cargo door.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric and battery-powered wheelchairs, scooters, and carts are accepted for transport. Passengers are encouraged to arrive at the airport at least 2 hours before departure to allow for proper handling. Devices must fit through the aircraft's cargo door with maximum allowable dimensions of 33 inches in height and 34 inches in width. Weight limits apply based on the aircraft type: 500 lbs (227 kg) for Boeing 737 and Bombardier Q400; 400 lbs (181 kg) for Embraer E175; and 300 lbs (136 kg) for Bombardier CRJ. If a device with a non-spillable battery is larger than the allowable cargo dimensions, it may be tipped on its side for loading but will be secured upright in the cargo hold whenever possible.
battery_handling_instructions: Lithium-ion batteries must be removed and carried in the passenger cabin if the mobility aid is checked; a single battery up to 300 Wh or two batteries up to 160 Wh each are permitted. Spillable batteries must be removed and placed in a battery box unless the aircraft is small and cannot accommodate the upright device, or if the device can be loaded and stowed upright. To prevent unintentional activation, passengers should provide disconnection instructions (e.g., removing the key, toggling the 'off' switch, or disconnecting the joystick). Battery terminals must be protected from short circuits by tape or isolation if the battery is removed.
special_assistance_contact_general: For special assistance, passengers should make reservations as early as possible and request services during booking or by calling the dedicated accessible services line. Assistance includes airport escorts, boarding and deplaning support, and onboard aisle chairs.

airline_name: BBN Hava Yollari Ve Taşimacilik A.S (BBN Airlines Türkiye)
manual_wheelchair_policy: BBN Airlines operates primarily as an ACMI (Aircraft, Crew, Maintenance, and Insurance) and charter provider. For ACMI flights, the airline does not handle ground services or booking management; passengers must follow the manual wheelchair policy of the carrier from which they purchased their ticket. For charter flights, passengers are advised to inform their tour operator or the airline at least 48 hours in advance to ensure the device can be accommodated based on the aircraft type (A320/A321).
electric_wheelchair_policy: As an ACMI and charter operator, BBN Airlines directs all special assistance requests to the ticketing carrier. For direct charter operations, the airline requires notification 48 hours before departure. Power wheelchairs must be prepared for safe transport according to IATA Dangerous Goods Regulations, which include securing the device to prevent accidental activation and protecting the battery from damage.
battery_handling_instructions: BBN Airlines follows standard IATA Dangerous Goods Regulations: Lithium-ion batteries must not exceed 300Wh (or 160Wh each if the device requires two). Removable batteries must be carried in the cabin. Non-spillable batteries must be securely attached to the wheelchair, with terminals protected from short circuits and circuits inhibited to prevent accidental activation. If the wheelchair cannot be loaded upright, the battery may need to be removed and packed separately.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers are instructed to contact the airline from which they purchased their ticket directly for all special assistance, baggage, and booking modifications. General inquiries for BBN Airlines can be made via their website contact form: https://bbnairlines.aero/contact-us/
Legal Name: BBN Hava Yollari Ve Taşimacilik A.S

manual_wheelchair_policy: Air Niugini provides dedicated wheelchair assistance throughout the journey, from check-in to boarding and arrival. Passengers can check their manual wheelchairs at the check-in counter or at the boarding gate. The airline requests that passengers provide the dimensions (height, width, and length) and weight of the device at the time of booking or at least 48 hours prior to departure to ensure proper stowage. Manual wheelchairs must be weighed and are typically carried free of charge in addition to the standard baggage allowance when used for mobility.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and mobility aids require prior approval from the airline's Special Handling Desk. Passengers must notify the airline at least 48 hours in advance (or at the time of booking) with details regarding the battery type, weight, and dimensions. For safety, these devices are transported as checked baggage. If the wheelchair cannot be stowed in an upright position, the battery may need to be removed and packed appropriately according to dangerous goods regulations.
battery_handling_instructions: Batteries must be securely attached to the mobility aid or removed if the device is collapsible. For non-spillable batteries, terminals must be protected from short circuits (e.g., by taping over exposed terminals) and the battery must be disconnected. Lithium-ion batteries that are easily removed from the device must be taken into the passenger cabin; these removed batteries must have their terminals insulated and be placed in a protective pouch. Generally, lithium batteries for mobility aids are limited to 300Wh for a single battery or 160Wh each for two batteries, though Air Niugini's restricted items guide notes that lithium batteries larger than 100Wh specifically require prior approval.
special_assistance_contact_general: Special Handling Desk Team: Phone (+675) 327 3614, Email: special.handling@airniugini.com.pg. Requests should be made at least 48 hours before travel.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Edelweiss Air transports manual wheelchairs free of charge. Passengers may use their own wheelchair at the airport up to the aircraft door, after which it will be stowed in the cargo hold. Onboard wheelchairs are available on all long-haul aircraft and on short-haul aircraft upon request. For planning, passengers must provide the weight and dimensions of their wheelchair at least 48 hours before departure. Manual wheelchairs should be handed over in a way that minimizes the risk of damage, such as folding them if possible.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Transport of electric wheelchairs requires prior approval from the airline at least 48 hours before departure. Passengers must provide the manufacturer's technical datasheet or manual, along with the device's weight, dimensions, and battery type. Tires should remain inflated as pressure loss in the cargo hold is not a safety risk. The electrical equipment must be in perfect working order, and it is recommended to bring operating instructions for the loading crew.
battery_handling_instructions: Dry, gel, or leak-proof wet batteries must be securely attached to the wheelchair, disconnected, and their terminals insulated with adhesive tape or individually packed in plastic bags to prevent short circuits. Lithium batteries that are removable must be taken into the passenger cabin. For spillable wet-cell batteries, the battery must be removed from the wheelchair before departure and transported in a strong, rigid packaging. All spare batteries must be individually protected and packaged.
special_assistance_contact_general: Assistance should be requested at least 48 hours before departure via the Service Center telephone, the online contact form, or email. For flights booked via travel agencies or SWISS (LX8xxx flight numbers), passengers should contact the booking agency directly.

manual_wheelchair_policy: White Airways accepts manual wheelchairs for transport free of charge. While specific weight and dimension limits are not detailed on the public website, the airline operates aircraft such as the Airbus A320 and Boeing 737, which can typically accommodate standard manual wheelchairs. Passengers are encouraged to provide dimensions and weight at the time of booking or via special assistance contacts to ensure proper handling and stowage.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and mobility aids are accepted for carriage. Passengers must provide advance notice (typically at least 48 hours before departure) to ensure the device can be safely accommodated. Devices must be prepared for transport by protecting the battery from short-circuits and ensuring the chair is turned off and protected from accidental activation.
battery_types_allowed: Spillable (Wet Cell) - Subject to specific handling and packaging
battery_handling_instructions: White Airways follows IATA Dangerous Goods Regulations (DGR). For non-spillable batteries, terminals must be insulated to prevent short circuits, and the battery must be securely attached to the wheelchair. For lithium-ion batteries, the battery must typically be removed from the device if it is not specifically protected by the frame; removed batteries and spares (maximum one 300Wh or two 160Wh each) must be carried in the passenger cabin. Any spillable batteries may require removal and transport in a special leak-proof battery box if the device cannot be stowed upright.
special_assistance_contact_general: Special assistance and mobility requests should be coordinated via the primary sales and operations office or through the chartering tour operator/airline. General inquiries can be made to +351 219 457 560.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Nouvelair provides special assistance and transports personal manual wheelchairs free of charge. Manual wheelchairs are accepted for carriage as checked baggage. Passengers are required to notify the airline of the weight, size, and nature of the mobility aid at least 48 hours before the flight's departure to ensure proper handling and stowage.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are accepted as checked baggage. The airline classifies these as WCBD (dry batteries), WCLB (lithium batteries), or WCBW (wet batteries). They must be transported in an upright position. The airline limits the number of passengers with reduced mobility (PRM) per flight (e.g., 11 WCHR/WCHS/WCHC total, with specific limits for unaccompanied passengers). Special assistance must be requested at least 48 hours in advance.
battery_types_allowed: Wet-cell (Spillable) - accepted only if stowed upright
battery_handling_instructions: For lithium-ion batteries: If the battery is removable, it must be removed and carried in the cabin; capacity is limited to one battery not exceeding 300 Wh or two batteries each not exceeding 160 Wh. If the battery is securely attached and protected, it may remain installed. For non-spillable (dry) batteries: One official source states batteries must be removed for transport as checked baggage, while another suggests they must be securely attached with terminals protected against short circuits. For wet-cell batteries: The wheelchair must be transported in an upright position to prevent leakage; otherwise, they may be refused.
special_assistance_contact_general: Requests for special assistance and mobility aid approval must be sent at least 48 hours before departure to the passenger assistance service.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs are transported free of charge in the aircraft's cargo compartment and do not count toward the passenger's free baggage allowance. Passengers should provide the airline or tour operator with the wheelchair's dimensions and weight at least 48 hours before departure. The device must be able to fit through the cargo hold door, which varies by aircraft type (typically A320 or A321).
electric_wheelchair_policy: UAB GetJet Airlines accepts passenger-owned battery-powered wheelchairs (WCHP) for carriage in the cargo compartment. However, only wheelchairs powered by 'dry' (non-spillable) batteries are accepted. The airline explicitly states that wheelchairs equipped with wet (spillable) batteries cannot be accepted for carriage. Passengers must notify the airline at least 48 hours prior to the flight to ensure the equipment can be accommodated.
battery_handling_instructions: For battery-powered wheelchairs, the battery must be securely attached to the wheelchair. The passenger is responsible for ensuring the battery is disconnected and the terminals are insulated to prevent short circuits during transport. The wheelchair must be prepared for carriage in a way that prevents accidental activation.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers traveling on charter flights should primarily contact their tour operator (e.g., Novaturas) to request assistance. For direct inquiries, passengers can contact GetJet's Operations Control Center or customer service.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Passengers may use their own personal manual wheelchair up to the boarding gate, after which it will be checked and stowed in the aircraft hold. Wheelchairs are transported free of charge and do not count toward the standard baggage allowance. All Asiana aircraft are equipped with on-board wheelchairs to assist passengers within the cabin. Assistance can be requested through the Reservation Center, via the website, or at the airport, though advance notification is highly recommended to minimize wait times.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Passengers traveling with an electric wheelchair must notify the airline in advance upon booking or at least 48 hours prior to departure. The airline requires information regarding the battery type (lithium, dry, or wet) and capacity. Electric wheelchairs are typically checked at the counter or gate and stowed in the cargo hold. Passengers are generally required to remove the batteries from the wheelchair for transport, depending on the battery type.
battery_handling_instructions: Lithium-ion batteries must be removed from the mobility aid, and terminals must be insulated with tape or placed in individual transparent zip-lock bags to prevent short circuits. These detached batteries and any spares must be carried by the passenger in the cabin (not in overhead bins). Capacity limits for lithium-ion batteries are: removable batteries up to 300Wh, and spares limited to one up to 300Wh or two up to 160Wh each. For non-spillable batteries, the battery may remain installed if securely attached and protected from short circuits. For spillable (wet) batteries, passengers must indicate if the battery is leakable upon booking; the device must be stowed upright to prevent leakage.
special_assistance_contact_general: Special assistance can be requested via the Asiana Airlines Reservation Center or through the 'Special Assistance' request section on the official website. For US-based passengers, the airline complies with the Air Carrier Access Act and provides access to the DOT disability hotline.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Hebei Airlines allows passengers to transport manual wheelchairs free of charge. These are not counted toward the passenger's free baggage allowance. Manual wheelchairs must be checked as baggage, although small foldable manual wheelchairs may be accepted for cabin storage if space and aircraft type permit (standard 115cm total dimension for cabin items usually apply). Passengers are advised to apply for wheelchair service at least 24 hours before departure through the airline's hotline or sales offices.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs must be transported as checked baggage and cannot be brought into the cabin. They are transported free of charge for passengers with disabilities. Passengers must notify the airline at least 24 hours (preferably 48 hours for complex needs) prior to departure. The device must be protected against accidental activation (e.g., by removing the key or disconnecting the power) and the terminals must be insulated to prevent short circuits. Dimensions exceeding 40x60x100 cm or weights over 50kg may require prior consent from the airline.
battery_handling_instructions: For lithium-ion batteries: If the battery is designed to be removable, it must be removed and carried in the passenger cabin. The battery capacity must not exceed 300Wh (or 160Wh each for two batteries). Spare lithium batteries must also be carried in the cabin. For non-spillable/sealed batteries: Batteries may remain attached to the wheelchair if securely fastened, and the power must be disconnected and terminals insulated. Batteries must be labeled with 'Non-spillable' or meet IATA Special Provision A67.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special assistance should contact the Hebei Airlines Customer Service Center at 0311-96699 or visit an official ticket office at least 24 hours before the flight.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs are transported free of charge for disabled passengers, provided the passenger is on the flight. While standard carry-on size limits apply for the cabin (20x30x40 cm), the decision to allow a wheelchair in the cabin or require it to be checked into the cargo hold is at Arkia's discretion based on aircraft type and space availability. It is recommended to notify the airline in advance.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Arkia accommodates passengers with electric wheelchairs in compliance with Israeli accessibility legislation and 14 C.F.R. Part 382 (for U.S. flights). Passengers must notify the airline in advance (ideally 48 hours before departure) to ensure the mobility aid can be safely accommodated in the cargo hold. The device must be protected against accidental activation during transport.
battery_handling_instructions: For Lithium-ion batteries: Removable batteries must not exceed 300Wh (or two batteries not exceeding 160Wh each) and must be removed and carried in the passenger cabin. For all battery types: Terminals must be protected from short circuits (e.g., by taping over exposed terminals), and the device must be switched off to prevent accidental activation. Spillable batteries may require special packaging if the device cannot be stowed upright.
special_assistance_contact_general: Arkia Customer Service and Accessibility Coordinator. Support is available via phone, email, and WhatsApp. Passengers are encouraged to contact the Accessibility Coordinator for specific disability-related arrangements.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Incapacitated passengers may carry one manual wheelchair or other mobility aid free of charge provided they are fully dependent on the device. Fully collapsible wheelchairs may be carried as free carry-on items if they meet standard cabin baggage dimensions (sum of three dimensions under 115 cm and weight under 10 kg). If dimensions or weight are exceeded, the wheelchair will be transported as checked baggage.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Passengers using electric wheelchairs must notify the airline in advance through the reservation center or the official website to confirm service availability. Electric wheelchairs are typically transported as checked baggage. Passengers must provide details regarding the wheelchair's weight, dimensions, and battery type at the time of booking or at least 48 hours before departure.
battery_handling_instructions: For lithium-ion batteries: If the battery is designed to be removed, it must be removed and carried in the passenger cabin; if the battery is not removable, the device must be protected from accidental activation. Batteries must not exceed 300Wh for a single battery or 160Wh each for a device with two batteries. For all battery types: Terminals must be protected from short circuits using insulating tape or by placing them in individual plastic bags. The airline may require batteries to be disconnected and securely packaged for transport.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special assistance should contact the T'way Air Customer Center or use the '1:1 Question' page on the official website at least 48 hours before the flight.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Overland Airways allows passengers to travel with manual wheelchairs and mobility aids. Passengers are required to contact the airline's customer service or reservation staff at least 48 hours before the flight to make arrangements. Due to the fleet consisting of regional aircraft (ATR 42/72, Embraer E-175, and Beechcraft 1900D), the stowage of wheelchairs is subject to aircraft cargo door dimensions and weight limitations. The airline reserves the right to refuse boarding if a passenger's condition or equipment is deemed to jeopardize flight safety.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and battery-powered mobility aids require prior clearance from Overland Airways Customer Experience before booking and travel. Approval must be sought at least 24 to 48 hours in advance. The airline specifies that arrangements and costs for all equipment, including ambulift facilities for boarding, must be borne by the passenger. Equipment must be battery-operated and will not be recharged in-flight as no recharging facilities are available on board.
battery_handling_instructions: All battery-operated equipment must use dry, non-spillable, sealed batteries only. Passengers must ensure there is an adequate supply of fully charged batteries (sufficient for 150% of the maximum expected flight duration). Additional or spare batteries must be packed in accordance with IATA Dangerous Goods Regulations. For equipment used in-flight, it must not emit electromagnetic radiation that interferes with aircraft systems.
special_assistance_contact_general: Special assistance requests, including wheelchair arrangements and the submission of medical clearance forms (MEDIF), should be directed to Overland Airways Customer Experience or Flight Reservations at least 48 hours prior to departure.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Folding wheelchairs are transported free of charge. Passengers are encouraged to contact customer service at least 24 to 48 hours before departure to register the assistance. In most cases, wheelchairs must be handed in at check-in at certain airports, while walkers can typically be taken to the gate and stowed in the cargo hold.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are accepted for transport provided they are equipped with a dry cell battery approved for air transport. All electric mobility aids must be registered with the airline immediately after booking to ensure capacity and operational compliance. Carriage is subject to operational limitations.
battery_types_allowed: Non-spillable batteries approved for air transport
battery_handling_instructions: The battery must be a dry cell type approved for air transport. Passengers must contact DAT customer service directly for specific registration of the mobility aid and to provide technical details about the battery. For transport, the battery should be prepared according to safety regulations (terminals protected) and the airline must be notified of the battery type at least 48 hours in advance.
special_assistance_contact_general: Contact the regional customer service center relevant to your route for registration and assistance. General inquiries: info@dat.dk.

airline_name: Air Nostrum, Líneas Aéreas del Mediterráneo S.A.
manual_wheelchair_policy: Air Nostrum (operating as Iberia Regional) allows passengers to transport up to two pieces of mobility equipment (including manual wheelchairs) free of charge. Manual wheelchairs can generally be used up to the aircraft door or boarding gate, where they are collected for stowage in the hold. On some aircraft, if dimensions and space allow, a folding manual wheelchair may be carried in the cabin, though hold stowage is more common for the regional fleet.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs must be transported in the aircraft hold. Acceptance is subject to the 'cargo capacity of small aircraft' (such as the CRJ1000 or ATR72-600 used by Air Nostrum); if the weight or dimensions exceed the hold's capacity or represent a safety risk, the device may be rejected. Passengers are encouraged to provide the manufacturer's instructions for disassembly and assembly at check-in. The device must be protected against accidental activation.
battery_handling_instructions: For non-spillable and dry-cell batteries, terminals must be insulated to prevent short circuits, and the battery should be disconnected and securely fastened to the chair. Wet-cell batteries must be loaded, stowed, and secured in a vertical position with terminals insulated and the accumulator disconnected. For lithium-ion batteries: if removable, the battery must be removed and carried in the passenger cabin (limit: one battery not exceeding 300 Wh or two batteries not exceeding 160 Wh each); if the battery is non-removable, it must be disconnected and the terminals protected.
special_assistance_contact_general: Assistance should be requested at least 48 hours before the flight through the Iberia/Air Nostrum booking center or the 'Manage your booking' section on the website. In Spain, contact Serviberia at 900 111 500 or +34 913 33 67 01.
Legal Name: Air Nostrum, Líneas Aéreas del Mediterráneo S.A.

manual_wheelchair_policy: United accepts manual wheelchairs (folding, non-folding, or collapsible) free of charge in addition to the checked baggage allowance. All aircraft have dedicated space to store at least one adult-sized folding manual wheelchair in the cabin if it fits and space is available (first-come, first-served). If the wheelchair cannot be stored in the cabin, it will be transported in the cargo hold. While there is no strict weight limit for all planes, United notes that if a device exceeds 250 pounds (113 kg), it may be restricted based on the specific aircraft type and cargo door dimensions. A digital sizing tool is available on United's website to check if specific dimensions fit the scheduled aircraft.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and scooters are accepted as checked cargo. United requires 48 hours' advance notice and check-in one hour before the standard time for flights on aircraft with 60 seats or less. It is highly recommended to attach written instructions for assembly/disassembly to the device. United's website provides a wheelchair filter tool to find flights that can accommodate specific dimensions without tilting. If a device cannot fit upright, United may require battery removal and specialized packaging.
battery_types_allowed: Non-spillable (gel-cell, dry-cell, or absorbed electrolyte sealed lead acid)
battery_handling_instructions: Batteries should remain attached if the device fits upright in the cargo hold. If the battery is removed: Lithium-ion batteries must be carried in the cabin; for collapsible devices, the removed battery must not exceed 300 Wh. For non-collapsible devices, one large installed battery is allowed with no Wh limit, plus one spare up to 300 Wh or two spares up to 160 Wh each. Removed batteries must have terminals protected (e.g., with non-conductive tape) and be placed in a protective pouch. Spillable (wet-cell) batteries must remain upright; if tilting is necessary, they must be removed and placed in specialized battery boxes.
special_assistance_contact_general: United Airlines Accessibility Desk handles disability-related inquiries before and after travel. Travelers can also request a Complaint Resolution Official (CRO) at the airport for immediate assistance with disability-related issues.

airline_name: Air Philippines Corporation (operating as PAL Express)
manual_wheelchair_policy: Passengers may travel with their own manual wheelchairs at no additional charge. It is recommended to request assistance at least 48 hours before the flight. Personal manual wheelchairs are typically checked into the cargo hold, although the airline provides airport wheelchairs for use from check-in to the aircraft door. Aisle or cabin wheelchairs are available on board to assist passengers in moving to their seats and the lavatory.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Battery-powered wheelchairs and mobility aids require prior approval and pre-notification at least 48 hours in advance. The device must be loaded, stowed, secured, and unloaded while maintaining an upright position. If the device cannot be stowed upright, the battery may need to be removed and handled separately according to safety regulations.
battery_types_allowed: Lithium-ion batteries (max 300Wh for a single battery or 160Wh each for two batteries)
Lithium metal (non-rechargeable, limited to 8g for medical devices)
battery_handling_instructions: Battery terminals must be insulated to prevent accidental short circuits (e.g., by being enclosed within a battery container or taped). For lithium-ion powered devices, if the battery is removed, it must be protected from damage and carried in the passenger cabin. Spare batteries must also be carried in the cabin, with terminals protected using original packaging or by taping and placing them in individual plastic bags.
special_assistance_contact_general: Assistance can be requested during booking or by contacting the PAL Reservations Hotline at least 48-72 hours before departure. An Online Disability Assistance Form is also available on the official website.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Qantas allows manual wheelchairs to be carried in the hold or, on specific aircraft, in the cabin. On Airbus A380 and Boeing 787 international flights, one personal manual collapsible wheelchair (up to 30.9kg and dimensions 33cm x 91cm x 106cm) can be stowed in the cabin on a first-come, first-served basis. In the hold, wheelchairs must generally fit upright within aircraft-specific dimensions. If a manual wheelchair weighs under 32kg and the manufacturer confirms it can be stored on its side, the allowable dimensions are approximately 80cm (W) x 65cm (H) x 250cm (L). For narrow-bodied aircraft (e.g., A220, E190), height limits range from 74cm to 130cm. A maximum weight of 120kg applies for Alliance Aircraft E-190 and F100 operations.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs must travel in an upright position in free-wheel mode. They must be declared at the time of booking and require Dangerous Goods approval. Dimensions must fit the specific aircraft's cargo hold door; for wide-bodied aircraft (A330, A380, B787), limits are typically around 150cm (W) x 160cm (H) x 150cm (L). For narrow-bodied aircraft, height is the critical constraint (e.g., 74cm for E190). If a device exceeds these dimensions, Qantas may offer an alternative flight on a larger aircraft.
battery_types_allowed: Non-spillable (Gel cell, Dry cell, Sealed Lead Acid/SLA, AGM)
battery_handling_instructions: Passengers must obtain Dangerous Goods approval at least 5 business days before travel. For Lithium-ion batteries: If the battery is designed to be removed, it must be taken into the cabin (max 300Wh for a single battery or 2 x 160Wh for two). If the battery is not easily removed, it must remain attached, the aid must be switched off, and the free-wheel mode activated. For Non-spillable/Dry cell batteries: The battery should remain securely attached with terminals protected/taped to prevent short circuits. Spares for non-spillable batteries must be in checked baggage, while Lithium spares must be in carry-on.
special_assistance_contact_general: Qantas recommends notifying the airline of mobility requirements at least 48 hours before departure via the 'Manage Booking' tool or the Specific Needs Assistance Line. A 'Mobility Aid Customer Checklist' is available on the website to help provide mandatory dimensions and battery details.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs are transported free of charge if used for personal mobility due to a disability. Passengers may carry up to two mobility aids (e.g., wheelchair plus crutches) at no extra cost. It is recommended to notify the airline at least 24 hours before departure (48 hours for flights to/from Europe or London). Passengers can typically use their personal wheelchair until the aircraft door; however, arrival delivery at the gate may take up to 2 hours depending on airport infrastructure. For flights to/from the United States on single-aisle aircraft, wheelchairs are transported in the cargo hold following DOT regulations.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and power-driven mobility aids are accepted and generally stored in the cargo hold. Passengers must provide the manufacturer's instructions for disassembly and reassembly, along with the device's weight, dimensions, and battery type. For aircraft safety, spillable (wet) batteries are NOT permitted to be transported while installed in the mobility device; they must be removed and packed separately. Lithium-ion, dry, and non-spillable batteries should remain attached to the frame unless removal is required for safe handling.
battery_handling_instructions: Batteries must be delivered turned off with terminals protected against short circuits. Lithium-ion: One spare battery up to 300 Wh or two spares up to 160 Wh each are allowed in the cabin. Dry/NiMH/Non-spillable: Up to two spare batteries are allowed in the hold if packed in rigid, solid packaging (cardboard, plastic, wood, etc.). Spillable (wet) batteries: Must be removed from the wheelchair and placed in leak-proof, rigid packaging surrounded by absorbent material. The package must be kept upright and clearly labeled 'BATTERY, WET, WITH WHEELCHAIR' with corrosive and orientation labels.
special_assistance_contact_general: Requests for special assistance can be made through the 'Manage your booking' section on the official website, via the Avianca mobile app, or by contacting the Customer Service Center. Notification is required at least 24 hours before departure for standard routes and 48 hours for European routes.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Passenger's own manual wheelchair is accepted as checked baggage free of charge, provided the weight and dimensions fit within the standard checked baggage allowance. The maximum weight for a single piece of baggage is 32 kg (70 lbs), and the total dimensions (length + width + height) must not exceed 158 cm (62 inches). Items exceeding these limits are considered bulky and require advance arrangements with the airline.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are transported as checked baggage. Passengers must notify the airline during the booking process and fill out the 'Wheelchair request for walking disability' form to ensure the device is properly attached to the ticket and handled correctly. Advance notification is mandatory.
battery_handling_instructions: Wheelchairs and mobility aids with lithium-ion batteries are excepted from general high-capacity battery restrictions. However, if the battery is removable and its capacity is within 160Wh, it must be detached and carried in the passenger cabin. Spare batteries must be carried in carry-on baggage with terminals protected against short circuits. For mobility aids with non-removable batteries, the device must be protected from accidental activation during transport.
special_assistance_contact_general: Special assistance and wheelchair requests must be made in advance, ideally at the time of booking. Passengers may be required to submit a 'Wheelchair request for walking disability' form or medical clearance (MEDIF) for certain conditions. Contact the call center or customer service for detailed arrangements.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Kam Air provides wheelchair and mobility aid support for passengers with disabilities. Passengers are requested to provide at least 48 hours advance notice to arrange for wheelchair services. Manual wheelchairs and other mobility equipment like crutches and canes are accepted. Standard checked baggage limits (maximum 32 kg per piece and 158 cm total dimensions) apply generally, but the airline emphasizes early arrival (90 minutes before departure) for those requiring special assistance. Manual wheelchairs are typically checked into the hold as they are not permitted in the cabin if they do not meet carry-on standards.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are accepted as part of checked baggage for passengers with disabilities. The airline requires that batteries be disconnected from the wheelchair during transport. The battery box must be leak-proof and covered with a plastic seal for safety. Passengers must inform the airline at least 48 hours in advance if they intend to travel with a battery-powered mobility aid.
battery_types_allowed: Wet cell (spillable) batteries (specifically permitted for wheelchairs)
Lithium-ion batteries (implied under mobility aid and smart bag provisions)
battery_handling_instructions: Batteries must be disconnected from the mobility aid. For wet cell batteries, the battery box must be leak-proof and protected with a plastic seal. Battery-powered devices must be declared at the check-in counter and should be prepared to be stowed in the aircraft hold. For immobile passengers (WCHC), a Medical Information Form (MEDIF) may be required for approval by the airline's specialist.
special_assistance_contact_general: Kam Air operates a 24/7 call center for support and special assistance inquiries. Passengers can contact the helpline within Afghanistan at 4422 or worldwide at +93 799 974 422.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Aer Lingus permits the carriage of up to two pieces of mobility equipment per passenger free of charge. Manual wheelchairs must be capable of disassembly into constituent parts weighing not more than 120kg (264 lbs) each. Maximum dimensions vary by aircraft type: Airbus A330 (140cm x 85cm x 155cm), Airbus A321neo/A320 (140cm x 85cm x 108cm), and ATR 72 (118cm x 56cm x 150cm). On-board aisle chairs are available on all Airbus fleet aircraft (A330, A321, A320) to assist with access to toilets, though the toilets themselves are not wheelchair accessible.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric mobility aids must be checked into the hold. Passengers must provide details (type, weight, dimensions, battery type, and immobilization method) at least 48 hours before departure. For mainline flights, components must not exceed 120kg each; for Aer Lingus Regional flights (ATR 72), the total device weight is limited to 128kg. Devices must be capable of being immobilized for transport (e.g., keyed ignition, switch, or airsafe connector).
battery_types_allowed: Spillable (wet cell) batteries (Mainline flights only, with restrictions)
battery_handling_instructions: Power must be disconnected or deactivated to prevent accidental activation. For lithium-ion batteries: if designed to be removed, the battery must be removed and carried in the cabin (max 300Wh for one spare or 160Wh for two spares); if integrated, there is no Wh limit for the installed battery. Spillable (wet cell) batteries must be securely attached and stored upright; if removed, they must be placed in a rigid, leak-proof, marked 'BATTERY WET WITH WHEELCHAIR' container with absorbent material. Terminals of all spare batteries must be protected against short circuit.
special_assistance_contact_general: Requests for special assistance or mobility aid declaration must be made at least 48 hours before departure via the online Special Assistance Request Form or by phone.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs are transported free of charge as checked baggage in the aircraft's cargo hold and do not count towards the passenger's free baggage allowance. Passengers with limited mobility may use their own manual wheelchairs up to the aircraft side or ramp, after which they are stowed in the hold. For small folding wheelchairs, dimensions not exceeding 55 x 40 x 25 cm and weighing no more than 10 kg may be considered for cabin stowage depending on space availability and specific aircraft types.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and mobility aids are accepted for carriage only as checked baggage in the cargo compartment. Passengers must notify the airline of their intent to travel with an electric wheelchair at least 24 to 48 hours before departure. The device must be prepared for transport by disconnecting the battery and insulating the terminals to prevent accidental activation or short-circuiting during the flight.
battery_types_allowed: Non-spillable wet batteries (gel or dry cell)
Spillable (wet) batteries (under specific conditions and with prior approval)
battery_handling_instructions: For all battery-powered mobility aids, the control device must be switched off and the battery terminals must be disconnected and insulated (e.g., by taping over the terminals or placing the battery in a protective container) to prevent short circuits. For wheelchairs with lithium-ion batteries, the battery must typically be removed if it is not protected by the design of the aid and must be carried in the passenger cabin. Removed lithium-ion batteries must not exceed 300 Wh (or two batteries not exceeding 160 Wh each). For non-spillable batteries, they may remain attached to the wheelchair if securely fastened.
special_assistance_contact_general: Assistance can be requested during the booking process or by contacting the airline's call center at least 24-48 hours before the flight. For passengers with Group 1 disabilities and disabled children on domestic flights, SCAT offers significant discounts (up to 100% off the fare) when booked through official representative offices.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Assistive devices for disabled passengers, including manual wheelchairs, are not included in the free baggage allowance and are transported free of charge. Juneyao Airlines provides three types of wheelchair services: Ground wheelchair service (between terminal and aircraft), Boarding wheelchair service (for passengers who cannot climb stairs but can walk to their seat), and Onboard wheelchair service (for passengers completely unable to walk). Applications for Boarding and Onboard wheelchair services must be made at least 48 hours before flight departure by calling the customer service center.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and similar mobility aids must be checked in and transported in the aircraft cargo compartment. Passengers are required to apply for the transportation of electric wheelchairs in advance (at least 48 hours) to allow the airline to make necessary arrangements.
