The wheelchair must be properly packed to withstand pressure and safe transportation conditions.
battery_handling_instructions: For electric wheelchairs, handling depends on the battery type. In accordance with general safety regulations referenced by the airline, batteries should be protected against short circuits (e.g., by insulating terminals). Lithium-ion batteries are prohibited from being checked in as general baggage and typically must be removed and carried in the cabin if they are not adequately protected by the device. Passengers must provide information on the type of battery installed and instructions for handling the mobility aid, including battery isolation methods.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special care should contact the official Juneyao Airlines customer service hotline at +86-21-95520 or visit their official website/APP for application. Requests for specific wheelchair services (Boarding/Onboard) should be made 48 hours in advance.

manual_wheelchair_policy: As an all-cargo airline, Polar Air Cargo does not operate scheduled passenger services and treats wheelchairs primarily as freight. For manual wheelchairs shipped as cargo, they must be adequately protected by proper packing and legibly marked with the shipper and consignee's full street addresses. They are accepted as 'Special Cargo' and handled as oversized or high-maintenance goods that require specific attention during booking, loading, and unloading.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are transported as 'Dangerous Goods' (Cargo) due to their batteries. They must comply with IATA Dangerous Goods Regulations (DGR) and U.S. Department of Transportation Hazardous Materials Regulations. They are handled as oversized/special cargo requiring expert care during flight and ground handling. For 'attendants' or 'couriers' accompanying consignments, advance arrangements are required, and the carrier reserves the right to exercise discretion based on safety and security requirements.
battery_handling_instructions: Transport of battery-powered mobility aids as cargo follows IATA DGR standards. Lithium-ion batteries must generally be shipped at a state-of-charge (SoC) not exceeding 30% of their rated capacity. All terminals must be protected from short circuits, and batteries must be securely attached to the device or removed and packed in strong, rigid, leak-proof packaging if the device cannot provide adequate protection. Packages containing batteries must be marked and labeled (e.g., 'Battery, wet, with wheelchair' or Class 9 labels) as per international cargo safety procedures.
special_assistance_contact_general: Polar Air Cargo Customer Service Center / Global Customer Service

manual_wheelchair_policy: Aircalin transports manual wheelchairs free of charge. Passengers must notify the airline at the time of booking and provide the type of wheelchair (folding or non-folding), its weight, and its dimensions in the order: length x width x height. An onboard wheelchair is available on all Aircalin-operated flights to assist passengers with moving between their seat and the toilets.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs must be declared at least 72 hours before departure. Passengers must provide the weight, dimensions in the folded position (length x width x height), and the type of battery (dry or damp/spillable). The aid is typically carried in the hold as checked baggage. For safety reasons, electronic circuits must be inhibited or batteries disconnected and terminals protected if there is no effective mechanism to prevent accidental activation.
battery_handling_instructions: Lithium-ion batteries that are removable must be carried in the cabin; they must not exceed 300 Wh for a single battery or 160 Wh each for two spare batteries. Non-removable batteries must be securely attached to the wheelchair. All spare battery terminals must be protected against short circuits by using adhesive tape or by placing them in a separate protective pouch or container. Devices must be completely switched off and protected from damage.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special assistance should notify their Aircalin agency or the commercial services team at least 72 hours before departure.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Cargojet is an all-cargo airline and does not operate public transportation services or scheduled passenger flights. As such, it does not maintain standard passenger-facing manual wheelchair stowage or weight policies. Accessibility efforts are focused on barrier removal in its facilities, workplace, and cargo services as outlined in its Accessibility Plan 2023-2026.
electric_wheelchair_policy: As a cargo carrier, Cargojet handles electric wheelchairs and mobility aids exclusively as freight. These items are transported as 'Dangerous Goods' in compliance with IATA Dangerous Goods Regulations (DGR) and Canadian aviation safety standards. Specialized handling is provided for oversized or sensitive cargo through their charter services.
battery_handling_instructions: For shipments of mobility aids as cargo, batteries must be declared as Dangerous Goods. Shippers must ensure terminals are protected against short-circuiting and the device is secured to prevent accidental activation. Lithium-ion batteries must comply with specific Watt-hour (Wh) limits for air freight (typically 300Wh for single batteries or 160Wh for pairs in mobility aids) unless otherwise authorized under IATA cargo provisions. Detailed shipping instructions should be obtained by contacting Cargojet Cargo directly.
special_assistance_contact_general: Accessibility feedback, barrier reporting, and requests for accommodations (primarily for employees, job applicants, and visitors) are managed by the Designated Representative or the Human Resources department.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs are carried free of charge in the aircraft hold in addition to the passenger's normal baggage allowance. They are typically collected in the baggage reclaim area upon arrival. Passengers are advised to ensure the wheelchair is adequately insured as airline liability for loss or damage is limited.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electrically powered wheelchairs are accepted for travel subject to the general conditions of carriage outlined in the IATA Dangerous Goods Regulations. The device must be easily stored in an upright position when collapsed or prepared for transport. Passengers must notify the airline or travel agent prior to booking to confirm the availability of assistance and space.
battery_handling_instructions: The battery must be disconnected and the terminals must be insulated to prevent accidental short circuiting. The wheelchair or mobility aid must be loaded and stowed in an upright position. For lithium-ion batteries, if the device is collapsible and the battery is removed, it must be carried in the cabin and typically cannot exceed 300Wh (or 160Wh each for two batteries).
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special assistance should contact Red Sea Airlines or their travel agent prior to booking to confirm availability. Requests should ideally be made at least 48 hours before departure. Assistance includes meet and assist services, ramp assistance, and fast-track services at select airports.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual folding wheelchairs for passengers with disabilities are permitted as an additional item to the standard carry-on baggage allowance. Passengers must notify the airline in advance and provide accurate dimensions and weight. While checked baggage generally has a maximum single-item weight limit of 32 kg, mobility aids are typically accepted as special baggage subject to prior confirmation. Folding wheelchairs may be transported in the cabin if space allows and as an exception to standard hand luggage dimensions (55 x 40 x 20 cm).
electric_wheelchair_policy: Acceptance of electric wheelchairs is subject to prior arrangement and confirmation from Heston Airlines or the relevant tour operator (Client) before ticket purchase. Passengers must provide the exact type, dimensions, and weight of the device. The airline requires notification at the time of ticketing or at least 48 hours before departure to ensure the aircraft can accommodate the device and its battery type.
battery_handling_instructions: Heston Airlines follows standard IATA Dangerous Goods Regulations. For Lithium-ion batteries: if the battery is removable, it must be removed, terminals protected from short-circuiting, and carried in the passenger cabin (maximum 300Wh for a single battery or 160Wh each for two batteries). Non-spillable batteries may remain attached if securely fastened to the wheelchair, and the device must be protected from accidental activation. All terminals must be insulated to prevent short circuits.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special assistance must coordinate through the airline's customer support or their respective tour operator at the time of booking. For flights within 48 hours, direct contact with Heston Airlines is recommended.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Camair-Co accepts manual wheelchairs for transport. They are carried free of charge, typically in the aircraft hold. Passengers are required to inform the airline of their assistance needs (e.g., WCHR, WCHS, WCHC) at the time of booking or at least 48 hours before departure. Dimensions and weight should be provided to ensure the equipment can be accommodated on the specific aircraft type.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and mobility aids are accepted as checked baggage. Passengers must notify the airline during reservation with details regarding the wheelchair's weight, dimensions, and battery type. For safety, wheelchairs must be protected against accidental activation and batteries handled according to their specific type (Lithium-ion vs. Non-spillable).
battery_types_allowed: Spillable (Wet cell - subject to specific handling/packaging)
battery_handling_instructions: For lithium-ion batteries, if the battery is removable, it must be removed and carried in the passenger cabin (subject to a 300Wh limit or 160Wh for two batteries). If not removable, the battery may remain in the device. For non-spillable batteries, the battery must be securely attached to the wheelchair, the terminals must be protected from short circuits, and the electrical circuits must be disconnected/inhibited. Passengers are recommended to carry the manufacturer's manual for dismantling instructions.
special_assistance_contact_general: Assistance should be requested at the time of booking or by contacting the Call Center at least 48 hours before the flight. Passengers must arrive at the airport at least 2 hours before domestic flights and 3 hours before international flights.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs and mobility aids are carried free of charge provided they do not exceed the maximum dimensions of 75cm x 50cm x 27cm. Due to the structural limitations of the aircraft used (Cessna Citation executive jets), Hahn Air Lines is unable to carry passengers who cannot use stairs to embark or disembark. Mobility aids are typically stowed in the aircraft hold.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Battery-powered wheelchairs and electric mobility aids are strictly prohibited and cannot be carried on flights operated by Hahn Air Lines GmbH.
battery_handling_instructions: Hahn Air Lines does not transport battery-powered wheelchairs or mobility aids; therefore, no handling instructions are provided for these devices. General dangerous goods regulations prohibit the carriage of lithium-powered mobility aids on their aircraft.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring assistance must contact the Hahn Air Service Desk or their travel agency. For flights ticketed on Hahnair (HR-169) but operated by a partner airline, passengers must contact the operating carrier directly for special assistance. For flights operated by Hahn Air Lines GmbH, contact the service desk via email or phone.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs are transported free of charge and cannot be stored in the cabin due to aircraft dimensions. They can be checked at the check-in counter or the boarding gate. Dimensions limits: For A320/A321 fleet, max 150 cm (L) x 140 cm (W) x 119 cm (H). For Bombardier Q200/Q400 fleet (SATA Air Açores), max 142 cm (L) x 114 cm (W) x 114 cm (H). The maximum weight for any wheelchair is 200 kg (440 lbs).
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs must be checked at the airport counter and are transported in the hold. They require prior notification at least 48 hours before departure. Disassembly may be necessary for stowage. If the device has a non-removable battery, it must be securely attached and the electrical circuits inhibited. If the battery is removable, it must be removed, terminals protected, and transported according to its specific battery type requirements.
battery_types_allowed: Dry batteries (Special Provisions A123, A199, A67)
battery_handling_instructions: For Lithium-ion: If removable, the battery must be carried in the cabin in a protective pouch with terminals insulated (e.g., taped); spare limits are 1 battery up to 300Wh or 2 batteries up to 160Wh each. If non-removable, it remains on the device and must be deactivated. For Non-spillable/Dry batteries: Must be disconnected, terminals protected against short circuits, and securely attached to the chair; if removed, they must be placed in a rigid, leak-proof package and carried in the hold. For Spillable batteries: Require airline approval; must be disconnected, kept upright, terminals protected, and placed in a rigid outer packaging with absorbent material.
special_assistance_contact_general: Requests for assistance must be made at the time of booking or at least 48 hours before departure through the airline's Contact Center or dedicated accessibility services.

manual_wheelchair_policy: China Southern Airlines allows disabled passengers to bring one foldable manual wheelchair into the cabin free of charge on aircraft with more than 100 seats, provided it fits within the aircraft's cabin storage area. Storage is provided on a first-come, first-served basis. If cabin space is insufficient or if the wheelchair is non-foldable, it must be transported as checked baggage. Manual wheelchairs are generally accepted as regular checked baggage at the airport without additional fees. Maximum weight limits for checked baggage typically range from 32kg to 50kg depending on the route, but assistive devices for disabled passengers are handled as priority items.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs must be transported as checked baggage and require approval from China Southern Airlines at least 48 hours before departure (excluding U.S. routes where prior notice is recommended but not mandatory). The wheelchair must be checked in 2 hours before the standard check-in deadline. If the battery is removable, it must be removed by the passenger and carried in the cabin; if non-removable, it must be securely attached to the wheelchair and the electrical circuit must be disconnected to prevent accidental activation.
battery_handling_instructions: 1. Lithium-ion batteries: Removed batteries must not exceed 300Wh. Each passenger may carry one spare lithium battery (up to 300Wh) or two spare batteries (each up to 160Wh) in the cabin. 2. Non-spillable batteries: Must be protected against short circuits (e.g., by insulating terminals or enclosing in a battery box) and securely attached to the device. 3. Circuit Disconnection: For all electric mobility aids, the battery circuit must be disconnected or the power source isolated according to the manufacturer's instructions. 4. Protection: All batteries and terminals must be sufficiently protected from damage and short circuits.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers can apply for special services through the China Southern Airlines official website under 'Special Assistance Request' or by contacting the 24/7 Customer Service Center at 95539 (within China) or +86-4008695539 (overseas).

manual_wheelchair_policy: Air Koryo provides special wheelchair services for terminal use and in-cabin movement upon request. Passengers requiring a wheelchair must make a request at the time of booking in advance. Passengers with no mobility must be accompanied by a helper. Standard cabin baggage dimensions (sum of three dimensions not exceeding 115 cm/45 inches and weight not exceeding 5 kg) apply to items brought into the cabin, though wheelchairs are typically handled as special baggage or provided by the airline.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Passengers requiring the use of an electric wheelchair must make a request and provide details at the time of booking in advance. The airline notes that passengers requiring special care or movement on a wheelchair must secure consent and complete necessary formalities ahead of time.
battery_types_allowed: Not explicitly specified on the public website
battery_handling_instructions: Specific battery handling and disconnection instructions are not detailed on the official website. Passengers are required to notify the airline at the time of booking to arrange for the transport of battery-powered mobility aids and to ensure compliance with the airline's restricted and dangerous articles regulations.
special_assistance_contact_general: Special assistance and mobility requests should be made through Air Koryo booking offices or authorized travel agents at the time of reservation. Reservations for incapacitated passengers require prior consent from the airline.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Passengers can bring manual wheelchairs and other mobility devices (walkers, canes, crutches, gait trainers) free of charge in addition to regular checked baggage. Devices can be foldable or non-foldable. Manual wheelchairs can be used up to the aircraft boarding gate or checked at the counter. The device must fit through the cargo door dimensions, which are 84 cm in width and 1.17 m in height.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs must be checked at the counter and require notification at least 48 hours before the flight. They must fit through the cargo door (84 cm x 1.17 m). Passengers must provide details about the battery type and a battery certificate for airline approval. Devices must be prepared for safe transport by the passenger.
battery_handling_instructions: Wet-cell batteries are not permitted. For Lithium-ion batteries: if removable, the limit is 2 batteries up to 160 Wh each or 1 battery up to 300 Wh (must be removed and well-packed for cabin carriage); if non-removable, the limit is 2 batteries up to 160 Wh each. For Dry-cell or Gel-cell batteries, 48-hour advance notification and a battery certificate are required. All batteries must be set to 'flight-safe mode' before check-in and protected from short circuits.
special_assistance_contact_general: Assistance can be requested by checking the 'Passenger with Special Needs' box during booking, using the 'Request Assistance' form on the official website, or contacting the Call Centre at least 48 hours before departure.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Air Senegal accommodates passengers with wheelchairs free of charge. Passengers are encouraged to notify the airline in advance (ideally 48 hours) even if they do not require specific assistance. Manual wheelchairs are generally carried in the hold; for certain mobility aids like pushchairs, the airline allows them to be brought to the aircraft door before being placed in the hold.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and battery-powered mobility aids are accepted but must comply with current international legislation on dangerous goods. Passengers must notify the airline at least 48 hours in advance of the flight to provide details on the type, weight, and size of the wheelchair and its battery to ensure proper handling and stowage.
battery_handling_instructions: Battery-powered mobility aids must be prepared for transport by isolating the battery to prevent short circuits (e.g., insulating terminals). For lithium-ion batteries, if the design of the mobility aid does not provide adequate protection, the battery must be removed and carried in the passenger cabin (subject to limits: one battery up to 300Wh or two up to 160Wh each). Spares must be protected from damage and carried in the cabin. The airline complies with DOT 14 CFR Part 382 for flights to/from the United States.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special assistance should contact the airline's customer service or service center at least 48 hours before departure. Assistance includes support from check-in to (dis)embarkation and onboard support with an aisle wheelchair for lavatory access.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Bamboo Airways provides manual wheelchair services for passengers with reduced mobility. One manual wheelchair is carried free of charge and does not count towards the checked baggage allowance. Passengers must request this service at least 24 hours before the scheduled departure time. Services are categorized into three codes: WCHR (Ramp - passenger can climb stairs and move in the cabin), WCHS (Steps - passenger cannot climb stairs but can move in the cabin), and WCHC (Cabin - passenger is completely immobile). The airline accepts a maximum of 08 passengers requiring WCHR/WCHS per flight.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and mobility aids must be registered at least 24 hours (some official documents recommend 48 hours) prior to departure. The airline accepts mobility aids powered by non-spillable wet batteries or lithium-ion batteries. Devices must be transported in a manner that protects them from damage caused by collision with other baggage. If possible, the mobility aid must be loaded, stacked, and unloaded in an upright position. Mobility aids with non-removable lithium batteries are generally not accepted as checked baggage.
battery_types_allowed: Non-spillable wet batteries (gel cell, absorbed glass mat)
Spillable wet batteries (accepted only under specific handling conditions)
battery_handling_instructions: For lithium-ion batteries: If the battery is removable, it must be removed, the terminals must be insulated (e.g., with tape) to prevent short circuits, and each battery must be placed in a protective pouch to be carried in the passenger cabin. The battery capacity must not exceed 300Wh for a single battery or 160Wh each for two batteries. One spare battery (max 300Wh) or two spare batteries (max 160Wh each) are allowed in the cabin. For non-spillable wet batteries: Batteries must be firmly attached to the mobility aid, terminals protected from short circuit (e.g., in a battery container), and circuits isolated.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special assistance should contact the Bamboo Airways hotline or visit their ticket offices and travel agents.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Passengers with disabilities or reduced mobility are permitted to transport up to two units of mobility equipment free of charge. A folding wheelchair may be carried in the aircraft cabin as hand luggage in excess of the standard allowance, provided there is sufficient space as determined by the airline. If space is unavailable, it will be stowed in the cargo hold. Advance notice of at least 48 hours is required to ensure accommodation.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and mobility aids are transported free of charge for eligible passengers (up to two mobility units per person). Approval from the airline is mandatory and must be requested at least 48 hours before departure. The device must comply with the Technical Instructions for the Safe Transport of Dangerous Goods by Air (ICAO Doc 9284). Maximum dimensions for checked items generally follow standard baggage limits (up to 190x75x65 cm), but special arrangements are made for mobility aids.
battery_handling_instructions: Lithium-ion batteries that are removable must be taken into the cabin; the battery capacity is limited to 300 Wh for a single battery or 160 Wh each for two batteries. Battery terminals must be protected from short circuits by insulation (e.g., taping over terminals or placing in separate pouches). Non-removable batteries may remain installed if the device is protected from accidental activation and terminals are disconnected and insulated. Spillable batteries must be handled in an upright position or removed and packed in specialized leak-proof containers if the wheelchair cannot be stowed upright.
special_assistance_contact_general: Assistance can be requested during the booking process or by contacting the SkyUp Contact Center at least 48 hours before the flight.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Binter Canarias transports up to two pieces of mobility equipment per person free of charge. It is recommended to notify the airline at least 48 hours in advance to ensure space availability, especially given the smaller aircraft (ATR fleet) used on many routes. Passengers must provide the type of device, whether it is folding or non-folding, its weight, and its dimensions (length x width x height). If the wheelchair is foldable, dimensions should be provided for the folded state. Stowage typically occurs in the aircraft hold, but the airline provides assistance for boarding and deplaning in compliance with Regulation (EC) No 1107/2006.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and mobility aids require prior notification at least 48 hours before the flight. Passengers must specify the device type, dimensions, weight, and battery type (Dry, Wet/Spillable, Wet/Non-spillable, or Lithium). The device must be prepared for transport by disconnecting the battery and isolating the terminals to prevent short circuits. For wet batteries, the device must be loaded, stowed, secured, and unloaded in an upright position at all times.
battery_handling_instructions: For Lithium-ion batteries: If the battery is removable, it must be removed according to the manufacturer's instructions, terminals must be protected from short circuits (e.g., with electrical tape), and the battery must be carried in the passenger cabin in a protective pouch. Non-removable lithium batteries must be securely attached to the device. A single lithium battery must not exceed 300 Wh, or 160 Wh each if the device uses two. For Dry/Non-spillable batteries: The battery must be disconnected and the terminals insulated. For Wet/Spillable batteries: The battery must be disconnected and terminals insulated; the device must remain upright to prevent leakage.
special_assistance_contact_general: Special assistance can be requested during the booking process on the website, at travel agencies, or via their dedicated assistance phone lines. It is advised to communicate needs at least 48 hours before departure.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Passengers can carry up to two pieces of mobility equipment free of charge. For manual wheelchairs, passengers must provide the weight and dimensions at least 48 hours before the flight. Crutches and other mobility aids are also permitted on board and will be stowed by cabin crew after seating.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs require prior notification and approval at least 48 hours before departure. When requesting, passengers must provide the brand, model, weight, dimensions, and battery specifications. Wheelchairs may be powered by non-spillable, spillable, or lithium-ion batteries. Assistance categories offered include WCHR, WCHS, and WCHC (full assistance).
battery_handling_instructions: Lithium-ion batteries for collapsible mobility aids must be removed and carried in the cabin; the battery must not exceed 300Wh, or if the device has two batteries, each must not exceed 160Wh. Spare batteries must be individually protected from short circuits (e.g., by taping terminals or placing in separate bags) and carried in the cabin. One spare up to 300Wh or two spares up to 160Wh each are allowed. Power-driven wheelchairs with spillable batteries are considered 'dangerous goods' and are subject to specific safety conditions.
special_assistance_contact_general: Requests for mobility aid carriage and special assistance should be submitted via the online Special Assistance Form or by contacting the Medical Help Desk at least 48 hours prior to the flight.

airline_name: Air Dolomiti SPA Linee Aeree Regionali Europee
manual_wheelchair_policy: Air Dolomiti allows the transport of up to two mobility aids (e.g., wheelchair and walker) free of charge. Personal manual wheelchairs can be transported even if they are not completely foldable. Manual wheelchairs are typically collected at the check-in counter or after the passenger has boarded to be stowed in the aircraft hold. For certain manual wheelchairs, 'Delivery At Aircraft' (DAA) service may be requested to have the aid returned at the aircraft door upon arrival.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs must be registered with the airline at least 48 hours before departure. Transport authorization is required, and a manufacturer's technical datasheet may be requested. Air Dolomiti strictly prohibits the transport of mobility aids powered by unsealed (spillable) batteries. Sealed (non-spillable) and Lithium-ion powered devices are accepted subject to safety requirements. To prevent accidental operation, the device must be turned off, the key removed (if applicable), and electrical connections disconnected.
battery_handling_instructions: For lithium-ion powered devices: If the battery is removable, it must be removed by the user and carried in the passenger cabin inside a protective case; the removed battery must not exceed 300 Wh. For non-removable lithium batteries, a limit of 2 batteries with a maximum of 160 Wh each applies (noted as an updated safety standard from late 2025). For all electric aids: Passengers must ensure the device is switched off, the key is removed, and battery terminals are insulated or disconnected to prevent short circuits. Spillable/unsealed batteries are not accepted.
special_assistance_contact_general: Assistance must be requested during booking or at least 48 hours before flight departure. Customers can use the online request form on the official website or contact the Sales Center/Customer Service during operating hours (Mon-Fri 08:30-20:00 CET, Sat-Sun 09:00-17:00 CET).
Legal Name: Air Dolomiti SPA Linee Aeree Regionali Europee

manual_wheelchair_policy: Air Algérie provides free transport for manual wheelchairs. Passengers are encouraged to use collapsible manual wheelchairs to facilitate stowage in the aircraft hold. Under the 'Marhaba' service, requests for wheelchair assistance must be made at least 48 hours before the scheduled flight time. The number of wheelchairs permitted per flight is limited for safety and service quality reasons. Manual wheelchairs can be checked at the counter or gate and are returned at the destination's baggage claim or gate where infrastructure allows.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are accepted as checked baggage and must be declared at least 48 hours in advance. They are transported in the aircraft hold. Due to safety regulations concerning dangerous goods, the airline requires specific details about the chair (weight, dimensions, and battery type) during booking. The wheelchair should be protected against accidental activation and damage during the flight.
battery_types_allowed: Non-spillable (Gel, Dry cell, Sealed Lead Acid)
battery_handling_instructions: For lithium-ion batteries, the capacity is generally limited to 300Wh for a single battery or 160Wh each for two batteries; these must be removed and carried in the passenger cabin if the wheelchair is collapsible. For non-spillable batteries, they may remain attached if securely fixed to the mobility aid, with terminals protected from short-circuiting (e.g., by taping over terminals) and the electrical circuit disconnected to prevent accidental operation.
special_assistance_contact_general: Special assistance requests, including wheelchair bookings, should be directed to the 'Marhaba' service through Air Algérie agencies or the Contact Center at least 48 hours before departure. General inquiries can be made at the airport check-in desk.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Air Changan requires manual wheelchairs to be checked as baggage; they are not permitted for stowage in the aircraft cabin. Passengers should apply for wheelchair services (WCHR/WCHS) through official Air Changan ticket offices or authorized HNA Group ticket offices. It is recommended to arrive at the airport check-in counter at least 90 minutes before the scheduled flight departure time.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and mobility aids must be transported as checked baggage and are not allowed in the cabin. Passengers must provide the manufacturer's instruction manual/specifications for the mobility aid at the time of check-in to facilitate safety inspections. The wheelchair must be protected against unintentional activation and the terminals must be insulated to prevent short circuits.
battery_handling_instructions: For lithium-ion batteries: If the battery is removable, it must be detached, terminals insulated, and carried in the cabin; the rated energy must not exceed 300Wh for a single battery or 160Wh each for two batteries. If the battery is non-removable, the mobility aid must be switched off and protected from short circuits. For non-spillable batteries: They may remain installed if securely attached and protected from short circuits. For spillable batteries: If the aid cannot be loaded upright, the battery must be removed and carried in special leak-proof packaging.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special assistance should contact the airline through its 24-hour customer service hotline or visit an official ticket office.

airline_name: Transportes Aéreos Portugueses S.A. (TAP Air Portugal)
manual_wheelchair_policy: TAP Air Portugal transports up to two manual wheelchairs or other mobility aids per passenger free of charge. Manual wheelchairs can generally be taken to the aircraft door and will be returned to the passenger upon arrival at the aircraft door or in the baggage claim area, depending on airport facilities. Mobility aids such as walkers and canes are considered personal items and may be carried in the cabin if they fit within size limits.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are not permitted in the aircraft cabin and must be transported in the cargo hold. Passengers must notify the airline at least 48 hours in advance, providing the wheelchair's technical specifications and battery type. A manual wheelchair will be provided at check-in for airport use while the electric device is stowed. The device must be loaded, stored, and unloaded in an upright position.
battery_handling_instructions: Batteries must be securely attached to the mobility device and terminals must be insulated with material (e.g., tape) to prevent short circuits. For lithium-ion powered devices: if the battery is designed to be removable, it must be removed, terminals protected, and the battery carried in the cabin (max 300Wh for one battery or max 160Wh each for two). If the battery is fixed, it must be disconnected from the electrical circuits (e.g., by turning off the main switch or removing the key). Spillable batteries must be stowed in upright positions with terminals protected.
special_assistance_contact_general: Assistance can be requested during booking or via the 'Assistance Request' form on the official website. For detailed inquiries, contact the TAP Contact Center or local sales offices. Advance notification of at least 48 hours is required.

manual_wheelchair_policy: As a cargo-only airline, Challenge Airlines (BE) S.A. does not operate scheduled passenger services. Manual wheelchairs are accepted for transport as cargo. They should be properly packed to prevent damage, and dimensions/weight must fit within the aircraft's cargo hold (Boeing 747-400F). For specialized transport or supernumerary carriage (e.g., animal handlers), prior arrangement with the airline is required.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are transported as cargo in accordance with IATA Dangerous Goods Regulations (DGR). The device must be secured to prevent movement and protected from damage by other cargo. The battery must be protected from short circuits and accidental activation. If the device cannot be loaded upright, specific battery handling and removal procedures apply.
battery_handling_instructions: Batteries must be securely attached to the mobility aid or removed and packed according to IATA DGR standards. Lithium-ion batteries must meet UN 38.3 test requirements. For removable lithium-ion batteries, a limit of 300Wh (single) or 160Wh (each for two) applies. Terminals must be insulated to prevent short circuits. Spillable batteries require specific protective packaging and upright stowage; if tilting is necessary, they must be removed and shipped in a specialized battery box.
special_assistance_contact_general: Challenge Airlines (BE) S.A. provides logistics and cargo services. For inquiries regarding the transport of mobility aids as cargo or special flight arrangements, passengers/shippers should contact the Liege Airport hub or the Group headquarters.

manual_wheelchair_policy: EVA Air accepts manual wheelchairs free of charge as checked baggage. These may be checked at the check-in counter or the departure gate. Fully collapsible manual wheelchairs may be carried as carry-on baggage and stowed in the cabin if space is available; otherwise, they are loaded in the cargo compartment. Most aircraft types (except the A321-200) have designated onboard wheelchair storage spaces. Onboard storage dimensions vary by aircraft: 777-300ER (59x19.2x42.1 in), 787-10 (52.8x26x40.9 in), 787-9 (52.8x23x40.9 in), and A330-300 (58.5x28.4x26.2 in).
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are accepted as checked baggage free of charge. Passengers are required to provide 48 hours' advance notice and must supply the wheelchair's status (foldable or non-foldable), weight, dimensions (L x W x H), and battery details (type, count, and Watt-hour rating). The device must be securely packed. If the battery is securely attached, terminals must be protected from short circuits and electrical circuits isolated. If the battery cannot be securely attached, it must be removed. Some airports may have additional weight and size restrictions depending on their infrastructure and cargo door sizes (e.g., A321-200 cargo door is 33.4x25.5 in).
battery_handling_instructions: Batteries must be protected from short circuits by insulating terminals (e.g., taping over exposed terminals) and electrical circuits must be isolated. If the battery remains on the device, it must be securely attached. If removed, lithium-ion batteries must not exceed 300Wh and must be carried in the passenger cabin in a protective pouch. For lithium-ion, a maximum of one spare battery not exceeding 300Wh or two spares each not exceeding 160Wh are allowed as carry-on. Non-spillable wet or dry batteries must be removed if not securely attached and carried in strong, rigid packaging in the cargo hold. Spillable batteries may remain installed if the mobility aid can be stowed and unloaded in an upright position. The pilot-in-command must be informed of the battery's location.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special assistance should notify an EVA Air Reservations Office at the time of booking or at least 24 to 48 hours before departure. A Medical Information sheet (MEDIF) may be required depending on the medical condition. Specific check-in assistance is available at Counter No. 19 at Taoyuan International Airport.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Bahamasair provides storage for one passenger's collapsible, manual wheelchair in the cabin on a first-come, first-served basis, which has priority over other carry-on baggage. Carry-on wheelchairs are accepted if they collapse to fit in an overhead bin or under a seat. Manual wheelchairs can be checked at the ticket counter or departure gate. The airline offers a gate-check service where wheelchairs can be claimed at the arrival gate free of charge.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Bahamasair accepts motorised and non-motorised assistive devices for transport. Non-collapsible wheelchairs and scooters are accepted as checked baggage. When necessary, airline staff will disassemble and reassemble wheelchairs or assistive devices for customers. It is recommended to provide 48-hour advance notice for special needs and to arrive early at the airport for proper handling of powered mobility aids.
battery_handling_instructions: Batteries must be protected from short circuits by insulating terminals (e.g., using tape or a protective pouch). Lithium-ion batteries must be removed if the device does not provide adequate protection; removed lithium batteries are limited to 300Wh (one battery) or 160Wh each (two batteries) and must be carried in the cabin. Spillable batteries require upright stowage; if the device cannot be stowed upright, the battery may be removed and packaged separately. Written instructions for disassembly and battery management are highly encouraged to prevent damage.
special_assistance_contact_general: Requests for assistance can be made during booking or through the online Accessibility Services form. If travel is within 24 hours, passengers should call the Reservations Centre directly.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs are not permitted in the passenger cabin and must be transported as checked baggage in the cargo hold. Passengers may check in their personal manual wheelchair at the check-in counter or, with security department approval, at the boarding gate. One manual wheelchair or other mobility aid per passenger is transported free of charge and does not count toward the standard free baggage allowance.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs must be checked in as cargo and are subject to the airline's dangerous goods regulations. Passengers must submit a request for checked wheelchair service (especially WCHC/cabin wheelchair) at least 48 hours prior to flight departure. Electric wheelchairs should be delivered for check-in at least 2 hours before the standard flight check-in deadline. The number of non-ambulatory passengers (WCHS and WCHC) is limited to a combined total of 2 per flight.
battery_handling_instructions: Batteries must be securely attached to the wheelchair, the battery terminals must be protected from short circuits, and the electrical circuits must be disconnected. If the lithium-ion battery is securely fixed and protected, there is no specific watt-hour (Wh) limit for transportation. However, if the battery must be removed (e.g., if it cannot be adequately protected), each removed battery must not exceed 300Wh. For devices using two batteries, each must not exceed 160Wh. Removed lithium batteries and up to one spare battery (max 300Wh) or two spare batteries (max 160Wh each) must be carried in the passenger cabin.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special assistance should contact the official customer service hotline at 0532-96630 before purchasing tickets to ensure arrangements can be made.

airline_name: Freebird Airlines (Hürküş Havayolu Taşimacilik ve Ticaret A.Ş.)
manual_wheelchair_policy: Freebird Airlines transports manual wheelchairs free of charge. Passengers are classified into service codes (WCHR, WCHS, WCHP, WCHC) based on their mobility needs. Prior notification is required at the time of booking or at least 48 hours before the flight. While there are no specific stated dimension limits for manual chairs, passengers are advised to provide the weight and folded dimensions during notification. The airline provides wheelchairs for use at the airport and during boarding.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Battery-powered wheelchairs and mobility aids are accepted for transport but require prior approval and notification. The device must be prepared for transport to prevent unintentional activation. If the mobility aid's design does not adequately protect the battery, the battery must be removed and carried in the passenger cabin. Due to cargo hold limitations (especially on A321 aircraft which may lack cargo heating), specific loading restrictions may apply, and the airline must be contacted in advance to confirm acceptance.
battery_handling_instructions: Electrical circuits must be isolated to prevent accidental activation. For lithium-ion batteries: if the battery is removable or not adequately protected by the device, it must be removed and carried in the cabin. Spare lithium-ion battery limits are one battery not exceeding 300 Wh or two batteries each not exceeding 160 Wh. For non-spillable or dry batteries, terminals must be protected from short circuits and the battery must be securely attached to the wheelchair. Spillable (wet) batteries are generally not permitted unless specific conditions are met, and liquid oxygen systems are strictly forbidden.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special assistance should contact the airline's Ground Operations or Service Center at least 48 hours prior to departure.
Legal Name: Hürküş Havayolu Taşimacilik ve Ticaret A.Ş.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Aeroflot allows passengers to carry their own manual wheelchair and one additional personal mobility aid (such as a wheelchair power attachment, stair climber, or stairlift) free of charge in addition to the standard baggage allowance. Folding wheelchairs may be carried in the aircraft cabin if there is sufficient storage space; otherwise, they must be checked into the baggage hold. Requests for carriage must be made at the time of booking or at least 36 hours before the scheduled departure.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs must be checked as baggage and carried in the aircraft's baggage hold. Passengers must notify the airline at least 36 hours before departure, providing the wheelchair's dimensions, weight, and battery specifications. The mobility aid must be prepared for transport by disconnecting the battery and insulating the terminals to prevent short circuits. Aeroflot requires passengers to carry their own set of tools (spanners/wrenches) for disconnecting the battery terminals and, if necessary, a container for the battery.
battery_types_allowed: Spillable wet-cell storage batteries (with specific handling conditions)
battery_handling_instructions: For powered wheelchairs, batteries must be disconnected and terminals insulated (e.g., by taping over exposed terminals) to prevent short-circuiting. If the lithium-ion battery is designed to be removable, it must be removed and carried in the passenger cabin; removed batteries must not exceed 300 Wh (or 160 Wh each for a device with two batteries). Passengers are permitted one spare lithium-ion battery not exceeding 300 Wh or two spare batteries not exceeding 160 Wh each, which must be carried in the cabin. For non-spillable batteries, they may remain attached to the wheelchair if the circuit is isolated. Passengers must provide their own tools for battery disconnection.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special assistance should contact the Aeroflot Contact Centre or the dedicated line for passengers with disabilities at +7 (499) 270-34-70 (Moscow). Assistance requests must be submitted at least 36 hours before the flight.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs and other orthopedic tools (such as crutches or walking sticks) are carried free of charge and do not count toward the standard checked baggage allowance. Passengers can typically use their own manual wheelchair up to the departure gate, after which it will be stowed in the aircraft hold. Hand baggage dimensions for other items are limited to 58 x 34 x 23 cm and 7kg, but personal mobility aids are exempted from these weight and piece counts.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are accepted for carriage in the aircraft hold but require prior approval from the airline at least 48 hours before departure. Due to limited space and safety regulations, passengers must provide the airline with the wheelchair's weight, dimensions, and battery specifications. Electric wheelchairs must be prepared to prevent unintentional activation during transport.
battery_handling_instructions: Batteries must be securely attached to the mobility aid with the electrical circuits isolated. For wheelchairs with removable batteries, the battery must be removed, terminals protected from short circuit (e.g., by taping over exposed terminals), and the battery must be carried in the passenger cabin. Lithium-ion batteries are limited to a maximum of 300 Wh for a single battery or 160 Wh each if the device requires two batteries. Non-spillable batteries must meet IATA Special Provision A67 (max 12V and 100Wh for spare batteries).
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special assistance or wheelchair services are advised to contact the airline's reservation office at least 48 to 72 hours prior to flight departure to ensure arrangements can be made at the airport.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Air Cairo provides wheelchair assistance for mobility-impaired customers (categories WCHR, WCHS, and WCHC) for use to and from the aircraft. Passengers may also travel with their own manual wheelchairs, which are carried free of charge in the aircraft hold. The airline specifies that suitable backing or wrapping is highly required for personal wheelchairs. Requests for assistance should be made at least 48 hours before departure. Note that some flights or aircraft types may have restrictions on accepting wheelchairs.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Air Cairo accepts battery-powered wheelchairs as checked baggage, provided they use dry cell, gel cell, or non-spillable electric storage batteries. Wet cell batteries are strictly not accepted. Lithium-ion battery-powered wheelchairs are permitted but must meet UN Manual of Tests and Criteria standards. Passengers must contact the Air Cairo sales office or call center at least 48 hours in advance to provide the weight, size, battery type, and Watt-hour (Wh) rating of the device.
battery_handling_instructions: For lithium-ion batteries: If the battery is removable, it must be removed from the wheelchair, terminals must be insulated (e.g., taped), and the battery must be placed in a protective pouch and carried in the passenger cabin. If the battery is fixed, the terminals must be protected from short circuits (enclosed within a container) and the electrical circuit must be inhibited by a switch or by disconnecting and insulating the poles. The battery must not exceed 300 Wh. A maximum of one spare battery (up to 300 Wh) or two spare batteries (up to 160 Wh each) may be carried in the cabin.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special assistance should contact the Air Cairo Call Center or local sales office at least 48 hours before departure. General call center services are available daily from 6 AM to 12 AM.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Fully collapsible wheelchairs, crutches, walking sticks, and prosthetic devices are carried free of charge and do not count against the passenger's free baggage allowance. Due to limited cabin aisle dimensions, these devices cannot be accommodated in the cabin and must be stored in the cargo hold as checked baggage. Nile Air provides three types of wheelchair assistance: Passenger-Assisted (for long distances), Stair-Assisted (for navigating stairs), and Cabin-Assisted (for completely immobile passengers).
electric_wheelchair_policy: Passengers traveling with a battery-powered wheelchair must contact their local Nile Air office or the Customer Experience team at least 48 hours prior to departure to make necessary arrangements. These devices are stored in the cargo hold as checked baggage. A Medical Information Form (MEDIF) must be completed and submitted at least 48 hours before the flight. For safety, the airline requires notification of the device's specifications, including battery type and weight.
battery_handling_instructions: Removable lithium batteries must be removed from the wheelchair and carried by the passenger in the cabin; they are not permitted in checked baggage. Removable lithium batteries must not exceed a power rating of 160 Wh. Batteries remaining installed in the device must be protected from accidental activation. Electrolyte (spillable) batteries are generally listed as prohibited items under Nile Air's general dangerous goods restrictions.
special_assistance_contact_general: Contact the Customer Experience team or local sales office at least 48 hours before departure. Egypt Hotline: 19415; International: (+20) 2 26968000; WhatsApp: +2 010 300 14 444.

manual_wheelchair_policy: As a dedicated cargo airline (freighter operations only), AIRZETA does not provide passenger transportation services. Consequently, there is no manual wheelchair policy for passengers. Manual wheelchairs may be transported as commercial cargo subject to standard air freight terms and conditions.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are transported strictly as commercial cargo (Cargo Aircraft Only). They must be handled and packaged according to the IATA Dangerous Goods Regulations (DGR) for battery-powered equipment. No passenger-related stowage or assistance services are available.
battery_handling_instructions: For cargo transport, all batteries must be handled according to IATA DGR standards. Terminals must be insulated to prevent short circuits, and the device must be securely packaged to prevent accidental activation. Lithium-ion batteries must be prepared for shipment in accordance with Section IA, IB, or II of the relevant Packing Instructions (e.g., PI 965-967).
special_assistance_contact_general: AIRZETA does not offer passenger special assistance. For inquiries regarding the transportation of mobility aids as commercial freight, customers should contact the cargo sales or customer service departments.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Passengers with disabilities may use their own manual wheelchairs to the departure gate or aircraft door. One collapsible manual wheelchair may be stowed in the aircraft cabin on a first-come, first-served basis, provided it meets safety and space requirements. Most other manual wheelchairs are carried as checked baggage at no additional charge. For cabin stowage, devices must typically be collapsible to fit in designated priority storage areas or overhead bins.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and mobility aids are accepted as checked baggage. Passengers should provide the weight, dimensions, and battery type at least 48 hours before departure. The airline recommends bringing the user manual and any specialized tools needed for disassembly/reassembly. Staff will assist with handling and securing the device in the cargo hold to prevent unintentional activation.
battery_handling_instructions: For lithium-ion batteries, a UN 38.3 test document is required. If the battery is removable, it must be taken into the cabin; single batteries must not exceed 300Wh, and for devices with two batteries, each must not exceed 160Wh. Non-spillable batteries must be securely attached to the wheelchair with terminals protected from short circuits (e.g., by taping over terminals or placing in a separate bag). Spillable batteries must be handled as dangerous goods if the wheelchair cannot be loaded and stowed upright.
special_assistance_contact_general: Contact Customer Care at least 48 hours in advance for groups of 10 or more or for specific mobility requests. Assistance is available via the website 'Manage Booking' tool, mobile app, or by calling regional offices.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs are transported free of charge in the aircraft hold. They must not exceed the maximum dimensions of 170 cm (length) x 85 cm (width) x 80 cm (height). Passengers are requested to notify the airline of the wheelchair's dimensions and type at the time of booking or at least 48 hours before departure.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are accepted for transport but require advance notification (at least 48 hours). For flights operated with the Jetstream 32 (JS32) aircraft (typically on Hagfors and Torsby-Arlanda routes), passengers must be able to climb and descend aircraft stairs independently. On other aircraft like the Fokker 50, more extensive assistance (WCHS, WCHC) is available. Dimensions must not exceed 170 cm x 85 cm x 80 cm.
battery_handling_instructions: Lithium-ion batteries designed to be removed must be taken into the cabin and must not exceed 300Wh (or two batteries of max 160Wh each). For non-spillable batteries, the terminals must be insulated (e.g., taped) to prevent short circuits. If the mobility aid cannot be loaded and stowed in an upright position, the battery must be removed and the terminals protected. Batteries must be securely attached to the device if not removed.
special_assistance_contact_general: Special assistance must be booked at least 48 hours before departure by contacting the populAir Call Center. Passengers should arrive at the gate at least 30 minutes before domestic flights and 1 hour before international flights.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs (coded as WCMP) are carried free of charge in the baggage compartment in excess of the standard free baggage allowance. Wheelchairs must be foldable and should not exceed the dimensions of 150 x 50 cm when folded.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are accepted for carriage in accordance with IATA and ICAO regulations for the transportation of dangerous goods. They are carried in the baggage compartment. Types accepted include WCBD (dry cell), WCBW (liquid cell), and WCLB (lithium-ion). Pre-booking at least 48 hours before departure is mandatory. Passengers are recommended to coordinate specific requirements with the airline in advance.
battery_handling_instructions: The Pilot-in-Command must be informed of the location of the battery-powered mobility aid. Batteries that are not leak-proof must be fitted with leak-proof vent plugs where possible. For liquid batteries (WCBW), packaging must be clearly marked with labels reading 'liquid battery, with wheelchair' or 'liquid battery, with mobile vehicle' and include a corrosive hazard sign.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special assistance must notify the airline or its authorized agents at the time of booking or at least 48 hours before the scheduled departure time.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Air China allows passengers to check in one manual wheelchair free of charge. Collapsible or manual folding wheelchairs may be brought into the cabin as auxiliary items free of charge, provided there is sufficient storage space and they do not pose safety hazards. If cabin storage is unavailable, they must be checked. For non-American routes, the total number of checked electric and manual wheelchairs per passenger is limited to two; for American routes, there is no set limit on the number of checked wheelchairs.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs or mobility devices must be checked in at the airport counter and are not permitted in the cabin. One electric wheelchair is transported free of charge and does not count toward the free baggage allowance. Passengers must apply for this service at least 3 hours before departure for point-to-point flights; interline flights or special cases may require notification 48 to 72 hours in advance. The device must meet Air China's requirements for the carriage of dangerous goods.
battery_types_allowed: Lithium-ion (max 300 Wh for a single battery, or 160 Wh each for two batteries)
battery_handling_instructions: If the mobility device is designed with a removable battery, the battery must be removed. Both removed batteries and any spare batteries must have their terminals insulated to prevent short circuits. Removed lithium-ion batteries and their spares must be carried by the passenger in the cabin. Non-removable batteries must be securely attached to the wheelchair, and the power must be disconnected to prevent accidental activation. Passengers are encouraged to bring the manufacturer's manual or battery specifications for security verification.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers can request assistance through the Air China website, mobile app, or by calling the global hotline at 95583 (within China) or +86-10-95583 (from overseas). For American routes, the North America Call Center is available at 1-800-882-8122.

manual_wheelchair_policy: SKY express offers free transportation of manual wheelchairs. Passengers must submit their request at least 48 hours before departure. Assistance options include transfer from the check-in counter to the aircraft ladder, assistance boarding, and assistance to the seat. Passengers requiring assistance are advised to arrive at the check-in counter at least 90 minutes before the scheduled departure time.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and mobility aids are accepted for carriage. Passengers must notify the airline at least 48 hours in advance. For the safety of the passenger, a medical certificate may be required to confirm their ability to travel. If the battery is removable, it must be detached and carried in the passenger cabin. If the battery is built-in and securely attached, the device is typically stowed in the aircraft hold with terminals protected.
battery_handling_instructions: For lithium-ion batteries: If removable, the battery must not exceed 300Wh (or 160Wh each for two batteries) and must be carried in the cabin in a protective container/pouch with terminals taped to prevent short circuits. For non-spillable batteries: They can remain in the device if securely attached and terminals are protected. For spillable batteries: If the wheelchair cannot be loaded and stowed in an upright position, the battery must be removed and placed in a strong, leak-proof, rigid container.
special_assistance_contact_general: Requests should be made 48 hours in advance through the online booking process or by contacting the call center (8:00 AM - 9:00 PM GMT+2).
Legal Name: SKY EXPRESS S.A. (Cretan Aviation Operations Aviation and Commercial S.A.)

manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs are carried free of charge for passengers dependent on them. There is no limit on the number of manual wheelchairs or those accompanied by attendants allowed on a flight, provided they are registered in advance. Dimensions must not exceed 114 x 86 cm. Passengers are advised to inform the airline at least 48 hours before departure to ensure assistance is available.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are transported in the cargo compartment and must be notified at least 48 hours in advance via the Customer Contact Form to obtain confirmation. Dimensions must not exceed 114 x 86 cm (some sources specify a maximum height of 85 cm for the Dutch branch). The airline accepts a maximum of 10 wheelchairs per flight (limited by mobility degree: 10 WCHR, 10 WCHS, or 4 WCHC). It is the passenger's responsibility to ensure the wheelchair is ready for flight; ground staff do not have equipment to disassemble batteries.
battery_types_allowed: Lithium-ion batteries (max 300 Wh for single or 160 Wh per battery for two-battery systems)
battery_handling_instructions: For non-spillable/dry batteries: The battery must be disconnected, its poles insulated, and securely attached to the wheelchair. If the wheelchair cannot be loaded upright, the battery must be removed and placed in a separate container (e.g., plastic bin) to prevent contamination. For Lithium-ion batteries: The battery must be removed from the mobility aid and carried in the cabin as hand baggage. Battery terminals must be protected from short circuits.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers should request assistance at the time of booking or at least 48 hours before departure using the Special Request Form or Customer Contact Form on the official website. Ground assistance is provided locally at the airport.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Israir accepts manual wheelchairs for carriage. They are typically screened as a pre-condition for carriage and loaded into the aircraft's hold. Passengers are encouraged to inform the airline of irregular dimensions upon making a reservation. The airline's Airbus A320 aircraft can accommodate wheelchairs through cargo doors with approximate dimensions of 48 inches (121 cm) in height and 71 inches (180 cm) in width. In-flight narrow wheelchairs (aisle chairs) are available on board to assist mobility-impaired passengers.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and mobility aids are carried in the cargo hold. Passengers must provide advance notice (recommended at least 48 hours prior to flight) and are encouraged to provide written instructions for disengaging the drive system and handling the device. The airline has launched awareness campaigns specifically focused on the protection of passengers' wheelchairs during handling. The device must be protected from accidental activation during transport.
battery_handling_instructions: Lithium-ion batteries must be removed if the mobility aid is not specifically designed to protect them; removed batteries must not exceed 300 Wh (or 160 Wh each if the device requires two). Removed or spare lithium batteries must be carried in the cabin with terminals protected (e.g., taped) to prevent short circuits. For spillable batteries, if the wheelchair cannot be loaded and stowed in an upright position, the battery must be removed and packed in a specialized corrosive-resistant container. All devices must be protected from accidental operation.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers can contact the dedicated Israir Accessibility Team via email, phone, or WhatsApp for any special requests, wheelchair assistance, or accessibility adjustments.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Flynas only accepts folding, manual wheelchairs for carriage. These are transported in the aircraft hold free of charge and do not count toward the passenger's free baggage allowance. Non-folding manual wheelchairs are explicitly not accepted for carriage.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric or motorized wheelchairs are not accepted for carriage on Flynas flights according to the airline's official Terms and Conditions of Carriage and FAQ. The airline strictly limits mobility aid carriage to non-electric, folding manual models.
battery_types_allowed: None for wheelchairs (Electric wheelchairs not accepted)
battery_handling_instructions: As electric wheelchairs are not accepted, wheelchair battery handling is not applicable. For other permitted electric medical devices, lithium batteries must be removed (if designed to be) and carried in the cabin. Batteries must be protected from short circuits by insulating terminals with tape or placing them in separate protective bags. Spare lithium batteries are prohibited in checked baggage.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special assistance or with special medical needs must book through the Flynas Call Centre at least 24 hours in advance. Prior approval is required, and a valid medical certificate stating the nature of the illness and declaring the passenger 'fit to fly' may be necessary. Flynas provides airport wheelchairs for use from check-in to the aircraft.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Wamos Air does not have space in the passenger cabin to store personal wheelchairs; all personal mobility devices must be checked into the aircraft hold. Passengers may use their own wheelchair until the boarding gate if requested during booking, where it will then be loaded into the hold. An on-board wheelchair is provided by the airline to facilitate mobility within the aircraft for passengers who require it. Wheelchairs are delivered to the baggage reclaim hall at the destination.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs must be checked into the aircraft hold and cannot be carried in the cabin. Passengers must notify the airline of their status and specific needs at least 48 hours before the flight. Acceptance is subject to the dimensions of the aircraft cargo doors and gates. Mobility aids are transported in an upright position to prevent damage.
battery_handling_instructions: For lithium-ion batteries: If the battery is specifically designed to be removed, it must be removed by the passenger following manufacturer instructions and carried in the passenger cabin. If the battery cannot be removed, the mobility aid, batteries, and electrical cabling must be restrained and protected. For all types: Battery terminals must be protected against short circuits (e.g., by being enclosed within a battery container or insulating the terminals). For spillable batteries: The mobility aid must be loaded, stowed, and secured in an upright position at all times.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special assistance should notify the airline at least 48 hours in advance via their booking channel or the official reservations contact.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Air Mauritius transports manual wheelchairs as checked luggage at no extra cost. Passengers are permitted to bring two personal mobility devices (e.g., collapsible/folding wheelchairs, crutches, or walking frames) free of charge in addition to the standard baggage allowance. Manual wheelchairs can generally be used up to the aircraft door or boarding gate and may be delivered at the gate upon arrival or during long stopovers. Passengers must provide the wheelchair's type, dimensions, weight, and whether it is foldable at the time of booking or at least 72 hours before the flight.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs must be checked in as baggage and are not available for use during stopovers or immediately upon exiting the aircraft; they must be collected at the baggage delivery point. Requesting transport for an electric wheelchair is strongly recommended at least 72 hours before the flight to ensure the battery type is permitted. For oversized or heavy devices, prior arrangements with airport authorities are recommended. Information on dimensions and weight must be provided during reservation.
battery_types_allowed: Lithium-ion batteries (requires airline approval if exceeding 100Wh)
battery_handling_instructions: For lithium and other batteries, the battery must be disconnected and terminals insulated to prevent accidental short circuits, and the battery must be securely attached to the mobility aid. Gel type batteries do not require disconnection if terminals are insulated. Wheelchairs with spillable batteries are accepted only if they can be handled, loaded, and secured in an upright position; otherwise, the battery must be removed and placed in specialized packaging for cargo carriage.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special assistance should notify the airline at least 72 hours before departure. General inquiries can be made through the 24/7 Call Centre or the Reservations team.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs are carried free of charge and do not count toward the baggage allowance. One priority space is available in the cabin on each flight for one foldable manual wheelchair on a first-come, first-served basis; passengers should contact the Customer Service Center 24 hours prior to departure to reserve this space. Other manual wheelchairs will be carried as checked baggage and must be properly packaged. Non-battery wheelchairs can be taken into the cabin if size allows and space is available, but they cannot be used during the flight.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs must be checked and properly packaged to avoid damage. Passengers must provide the total weight, dimensions (H/W/L), and battery specifications at least 48 hours (2 business days) before departure. Dimension limits are: 100(H) x 139(W) cm (40 x 55 inches) for A321 narrow-body aircraft, and 150(H) x 142(W) cm (59 x 56 inches) for A330/A350 wide-body aircraft. Spillable (wet) batteries are generally not accepted unless they can be loaded, stowed, and unloaded in an upright position.
battery_handling_instructions: Lithium batteries must not exceed 300 Wh (or 160 Wh each for two batteries). If removable, they must be removed and carried in the passenger cabin. For non-removable batteries, the device must be protected from accidental activation and the terminals insulated. Non-spillable, Ni-MH, or dry batteries must have connectors secured to avoid short-circuiting. If removable, they should be removed and carried in strong, rigid packaging as checked baggage. If not removable, they must be securely attached to the device with the circuit insulated.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring assistance should contact the STARLUX Customer Service Center or apply through the official Web Form on the STARLUX website at least 24-48 hours before departure. For travel involving other airlines, contact each carrier in advance.

manual_wheelchair_policy: China Airlines provides free consignment for personal manual wheelchairs, which are not included in the free baggage allowance. Passengers can use their own wheelchairs to the boarding gate depending on airport facilities; otherwise, the airline provides airport wheelchairs. Foldable manual wheelchairs are accepted, and passengers must provide the folded dimensions (length/height/width) and weight during booking. Height restrictions apply based on aircraft type: Boeing 737-800 (B738) accepts mobility aids under 84 cm; Airbus A321 (A321) accepts aids under 77 cm in bulk and under 100 cm in the cargo hold.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs must be checked in at the airport counter and cannot be brought into the cabin. Passengers must request this service through the website at least 48 hours before departure or contact the Customer Service Center at least 24 hours prior. During booking, passengers must provide the wheelchair type (manual/electric), form (foldable/rigid), dimensions (L/W/H), weight (including battery), and battery type. For foldable models, folded dimensions are required. The airline provides general wheelchairs for boarding and transit.
battery_handling_instructions: Passengers are responsible for the installation and uninstallation of the battery following the manufacturer's instructions. Battery terminals must be protected from short circuits (e.g., by being enclosed in a battery container or using tape on exposed terminals). For lithium batteries: if the battery is removable, it must be removed and carried in the cabin (each battery ≤ 300Wh or two ≤ 160Wh each). If the battery is non-removable, it must be insulated and disconnected from the wheelchair before consignment. Non-spillable batteries must be securely attached to the device and switched off to prevent unintentional activation.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers can submit wheelchair requests through the 'Special Assistance' section of the China Airlines website or contact the Customer Service Center/local branch offices.

manual_wheelchair_policy: EL AL provides manual wheelchair assistance free of charge. Passengers can use their own manual wheelchairs until the aircraft entrance, where they are then stowed in the hold and returned upon landing. Onboard, narrow wheelchairs are available for accessing the lavatory (must be requested in advance). Manual aids like crutches, canes, and foldable walkers are allowed in the cabin if they fit in overhead bins. Passengers must provide the weight and dimensions (height, width, length) of their wheelchair during booking or via the 'Mobility Aid Declaration Form'. If a mobility aid weighs under 32 kg and cannot be stored upright, it may be stowed on its side.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and scooters require prior notification at least 48 hours before departure (14 days recommended for battery approval). Passengers must complete a Mobility Aid Declaration Form detailing the make, model, and battery type. EL AL provides an 'ELALIFT' device at Ben Gurion Airport for transporting passengers with mobility challenges from the aircraft to the terminal. Electric aids must be protected against accidental activation and short circuits. Lithium-ion batteries must be removable and carried in the cabin.
battery_types_allowed: Non-spillable (Gel, Dry cell, Sealed Lead Acid/SLA)
Wet cell (Spillable - restricted, requires specific approval and handling)
battery_handling_instructions: For Lithium-ion batteries: The battery must be removed from the mobility aid, terminals protected (e.g., with tape or a protective pouch), and carried in the passenger cabin. For Non-spillable batteries: The battery can remain attached provided it is securely fastened, the terminals are protected from short circuit, and the device is switched off to prevent accidental activation. For all types: If the battery is not on the airline's pre-approved list, passengers must submit a technical specification or Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS) to the Medical Department for review.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring assistance should contact EL AL at least 48 hours before the flight. At Ben Gurion Airport (TLV), assistance counters are located at Terminal 3 (Gate 32, Counters 98-99) and Terminal 1 (Counter 302). WhatsApp support is available at +972-3-9771111; passengers should type 'Request 15670' for dedicated accessibility assistance.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs are transported free of charge in addition to the standard baggage allowance. Most LATAM aircraft are equipped with closets or safety straps in the cabin to stow one typical adult-sized folding manual wheelchair (dimensions 13 x 36 x 42 inches or less) on a first-come, first-served basis. If cabin space is unavailable or the chair exceeds these dimensions, it will be transported in the cargo hold.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are transported as checked baggage in the cargo hold. Passengers must notify the airline at least 48 hours before departure. If traveling with a motorized wheelchair, the boarding pass must be obtained at the airport check-in counter (except for flights departing from Brazil). The wheelchair should be protected against accidental activation and batteries must be securely attached.
battery_handling_instructions: Lithium-ion batteries must be attached to the wheelchair; if the design does not provide adequate protection, the battery must be removed and carried in the passenger cabin. A single battery must not exceed 300 Wh, or if the device uses two, each must not exceed 160 Wh. Spare lithium batteries must be individually wrapped with terminals insulated (e.g., with tape) and carried in carry-on baggage. Non-spillable batteries can remain installed if protected from short circuits; spillable batteries require upright stowage or removal into a leak-proof container if the chair cannot be loaded upright.
special_assistance_contact_general: Special assistance must be requested through the LATAM Contact Center or via the official WhatsApp assistant at least 48 hours before flight departure.
