For spillable (wet cell) batteries: The wheelchair must be stowed upright; the battery should be removed and packaged in a strong, rigid outer case provided by the passenger or airline.
special_assistance_contact_general: Caribbean Airlines Special Services and Disability Assistance desk provides support for mobility aid arrangements and other accessibility needs between 7:00 AM and 8:00 PM.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Passengers with reduced mobility (PRM) may transport up to two pieces of mobility equipment free of charge. This includes manual wheelchairs. While specific weight or dimension limits for manual wheelchairs are not explicitly listed, passengers are required to notify the airline of their specific needs and equipment at least 48 hours before the flight's departure to ensure space and handling availability. It is recommended to arrive at the check-in counter at least 2 hours before the closing time.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are accepted for transport but require a request at least 48 hours in advance due to preparation and battery characteristics. The airline allows up to two mobility devices per passenger free of charge, including electric wheelchairs. Equipment must be properly protected against damage, and devices in checked baggage must be completely switched off.
battery_handling_instructions: Handling varies by battery type: 1. Wet cell (spillable): Battery connections must be removed to isolate and protect terminals. 2. Dry cell (non-spillable): If the battery is securely attached and the poles are isolated with the switch in the 'OFF' position, disconnection is not required; otherwise, it must be disconnected. 3. Lithium-ion: If the battery is removable, it must be removed and carried in the passenger cabin. For removable batteries, a limit of one spare battery up to 300Wh or two spare batteries up to 160Wh each applies. If the lithium battery remains installed in the device and is protected, there is no specific Wh limit mentioned, but the pilot-in-command must be notified of its location.
special_assistance_contact_general: Special assistance services must be requested at least 48 hours before departure. This can be done via the Call Center, the official website form, or by email.

manual_wheelchair_policy: SWISS carries up to two wheelchairs or mobility aids free of charge. Passengers are requested to notify the airline at least 48 hours before departure. For manual wheelchairs, passengers must provide dimensions (height, length, width in cm) and weight (kg) in advance. Foldable manual wheelchairs can typically be used up to the aircraft gate. Stowage is subject to aircraft cargo door dimensions: A220 (83cm height), A320/321 (124cm height), A330/A340 (168cm height), B777 (170cm height), and Embraer (78-90cm height depending on model).
electric_wheelchair_policy: Transportation of electric wheelchairs requires prior airline approval. Passengers must complete the 'Electric mobility device information form' and submit it to specialcases@swiss.com at least 48 hours before departure. The device must be protected against accidental activation and short circuits. Effective October 1, 2025, mobility aids with permanently installed, non-removable lithium batteries are limited to a maximum of two batteries, each not exceeding 160 Wh.
battery_handling_instructions: For lithium-ion powered wheelchairs, removable batteries must be taken into the passenger cabin; they must not exceed 300 Wh (or 160 Wh each for two batteries). Spare lithium batteries are also limited to one 300 Wh or two 160 Wh units and must be in the cabin. Non-spillable and dry batteries may remain in the device if securely attached, or be removed and carried as checked baggage. For all types, terminals must be insulated (e.g., taped) to prevent short circuits. Passengers must bring any tools required for the preparation of the device for transport.
special_assistance_contact_general: SWISS Service Centre (reachable via website) or the dedicated special cases team for mobility aids.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs are carried free of charge and do not count toward the passenger's free baggage allowance. If the aircraft cabin has sufficient storage space, a foldable manual wheelchair can be stowed in the cabin; otherwise, it must be checked. Passengers requiring non-ambulatory wheelchair service (WCHC) must submit a request at least 24 hours before departure. For groups of 10 or more wheelchair users, a request must be made 48 hours in advance.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are carried free of charge but must be transported as checked baggage. Lucky Air prohibits the carriage of electric wheelchairs or mobility aids with non-removable batteries (including non-removable lithium and non-removable sealed wet batteries). Passengers must provide advance notice 24 hours before the flight (48 hours for narrow cabin wheelchairs or group travel) and arrive at the airport at least 90 to 120 minutes before departure to complete check-in procedures.
battery_handling_instructions: All lithium-ion batteries must be removed from the mobility aid and carried in the passenger cabin. Batteries must meet UN38.3 testing standards. A single battery must not exceed 300Wh; if the device requires two batteries, each must not exceed 160Wh. One spare battery up to 300Wh or two spares up to 160Wh each are permitted in carry-on baggage. Terminals must be insulated to prevent short circuits, and batteries should be placed in protective pouches. Non-removable batteries and spillable (wet) batteries are strictly prohibited.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers can request special assistance through the 24-hour customer service hotline at 95326 (within China) or by contacting Lucky Air's direct ticket offices and authorized agents.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Air Guilin provides free check-in for manual wheelchairs. Passengers with limited mobility, including elderly passengers who can walk short distances (under 200m) but require assistance for longer distances, are encouraged to apply for wheelchair service. For passengers requiring manual wheelchair assistance through the terminal, applications should be made at least 24 hours before departure via the customer service hotline.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are accepted as checked baggage but require advance notification and approval. Passengers must contact Air Guilin at least 48 hours before the scheduled flight departure to request electric wheelchair transportation. The wheelchair must be within the dimensions and weight limits suitable for the aircraft's cargo compartment (Airbus A319/A320 fleet).
battery_handling_instructions: Lithium-ion batteries must be removed from the wheelchair if it is a foldable or removable design and carried in the passenger cabin; the rated energy of a single battery must not exceed 300Wh, or if two batteries are used, each must not exceed 160Wh. Spare lithium batteries must also be carried in the cabin (limit one 300Wh or two 160Wh). For non-spillable batteries, the battery should remain securely attached to the wheelchair with terminals insulated to prevent short circuits and the power disconnected to prevent accidental activation.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special assistance should call the 24-hour customer service hotline at 95013777 at least 48 hours before departure for electric wheelchairs or 24 hours for other special needs.

airline_name: Iran Air, The Airline of the Islamic Republic of Iran
manual_wheelchair_policy: Passengers requiring wheelchair services must request them at the time of ticket purchase or at least 48 hours before the scheduled flight. Manual wheelchairs are carried free of charge as checked baggage in the aircraft hold. Passengers are typically permitted to use their personal wheelchairs until they reach the aircraft door, at which point the device is moved to the cargo compartment. For international flights originating from abroad to Iran, a service fee of $40 may apply (150 AED for flights from Dubai), though veterans, family of martyrs, and individuals over 65 years of age are exempt from these charges.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are accepted as checked baggage only. Prior approval from the airline's medical department and coordination with the sales office are required at least 48 hours before departure. The device must be prepared for transport by removing or disconnecting the battery to prevent accidental activation. If the design of the mobility aid does not provide adequate protection for the battery, the battery must be removed and carried in the passenger cabin. Acceptance is subject to aircraft hold capacity and cargo door dimensions.
battery_types_allowed: Non-spillable wet batteries (gel cell, dry cell, AGM)
Spillable (wet cell) batteries (subject to strict supervisor approval and safe upright stowage)
battery_handling_instructions: For electric wheelchairs, batteries must be disconnected and terminals insulated with non-conductive tape to prevent short circuits. Lithium-ion batteries that are specifically designed to be removed must be detached from the wheelchair and carried by the passenger in the cabin; these batteries must not exceed 300 Wh for a single battery or 160 Wh each for a two-battery system. Batteries must be placed in protective pouches to prevent damage and short-circuiting.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers needing special assistance should contact the Iran Air Head Office or local sales offices. Requests for wheelchair support and medical clearance must be coordinated through the airline's medical center.
Legal Name: Iran Air, The Airline of the Islamic Republic of Iran

manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs required for mobility are transported free of charge and do not count toward the free baggage allowance. Hainan Airlines states that there is currently no space in the passenger cabin to store a passenger's own wheelchair, so all personal manual wheelchairs must be checked into the cargo hold. Passengers can choose to check their wheelchair at the counter or use it until the boarding gate. On-board wheelchairs (WCOB) are available on all wide-body aircraft (Boeing 787 and Airbus A330) for both international and domestic flights.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Passengers must apply for electric wheelchair transportation at least 48 hours before the scheduled departure time via a Hainan Airlines ticketing office or the customer service hotline. Electric wheelchairs must be checked into the cargo hold and cannot be carried in the passenger cabin. Passengers are required to bring the mobility aid's instruction manual and arrive at the check-in counter at least two hours before the standard check-in deadline. The airline requires details including brand, model, weight, and dimensions (length, width, height) at the time of application.
battery_types_allowed: Non-spillable wet batteries (Sealed wet batteries complying with Special Provision A67)
Dry batteries (complying with Special Provision A123)
battery_handling_instructions: Lithium batteries: If removable, they must be removed and carried in the passenger cabin in a protective case. Limits: one battery up to 300Wh or two batteries up to 160Wh each. If non-removable, the battery must remain securely attached and protected from short circuits and damage. Non-spillable/Sealed batteries: If non-removable, the circuit must be disconnected and terminals protected from short circuits. Spillable batteries: No spare batteries are permitted; they must be handled according to specific safety protocols to prevent leaks. All passengers are advised to bring enough charged batteries to last 150% of the flight duration.
special_assistance_contact_general: Requests for special assistance can be made through Hainan Airlines' direct ticketing offices or the 24-hour customer service hotline. Passengers departing from international locations should contact the local Hainan Airlines international office.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Hello Jets accepts manual wheelchairs for transport at no extra charge, provided that the assistance is requested at least 48 hours before the published departure time. The transport is subject to available space on board. Due to safety and security reasons, passengers requiring special assistance are assigned window seats and cannot use seats in the first row or near emergency exits. Staff provide assistance before, during, and after the flight, including aid in moving to toilet facilities if required.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and up to two pieces of mobility equipment per passenger are accepted for transport at no additional cost, subject to space limitations and compliance with dangerous goods regulations. Acceptance depends on prior arrangement with the airline. Passengers must notify the airline at least 48 hours in advance so that the battery type and specifications can be reviewed for safety and suitability for air transport.
battery_handling_instructions: Passengers traveling with battery-powered wheelchairs must provide advance notification 48 hours before the flight to ensure the battery meets safety requirements. For transport, batteries must be protected from damage and unintentional activation. Spare lithium-ion batteries are strictly prohibited in checked baggage and must be carried in the passenger cabin. Passengers are recommended to provide battery specifications during the booking process or via the contact form.
special_assistance_contact_general: Special assistance can be requested online during the flight booking process or added afterwards through the 'My Booking' section on the website at least 48 hours before departure. General inquiries and support requests can be submitted via the official contact form or directly to customer support.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs are accepted with no restrictions and are stowed in the Front Cargo Hold separately from other baggage or cargo. They must be tightened securely with restraint devices such as straps or tie-downs. The airline will collect the wheelchair at the aircraft entrance and return it to the passenger upon landing.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are accepted in the Front Cargo Hold only, provided the passenger has notified the airline and received approval at least 14 days before departure. Powered mobility aids using spillable wet cell batteries are strictly not accepted. For accepted types, the device must be protected from damage and secured with restraint devices. Passengers must fill out a 'Mobility Aid Device Check List' form.
battery_handling_instructions: Lithium-ion batteries must be removed from the mobility aid and carried in the passenger cabin; terminals must be protected from short circuits. For non-spillable batteries, they may remain in the device if terminals are protected and circuits are isolated, or removed by the user if the device is designed for it. Battery terminals must be covered with electrical tape or placed in a protective case/bag. Passengers must notify the Pilot-in-Command of the location of the mobility aid and its batteries.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers with special needs should arrive at the check-in counters at least 3 hours before the flight. For mobility aid approvals, a checklist form must be emailed to the airline 14 days in advance. Medical conditions (MEDIF) require notification 7 days in advance.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Wheelchair services (WCHR) are available at all airports and can be booked during the initial flight reservation. Manual wheelchair requirements must be finalized no later than 48 hours prior to departure. All passengers requiring special assistance must complete a Special Assistance Request Form, which can be submitted at the check-in counter on the day of departure. Passengers are advised to check in at least 90 minutes before departure to ensure sufficient time for handling.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric mobility aids (WCBD) must be arranged at least 72 hours before the flight's departure. The airline transports electric wheelchairs in the aircraft hold securely. However, carriage is at the passenger's own risk, and the airline strongly recommends that customers ensure their devices are insured. Due to safety regulations, CemAir limits the number of passengers requiring special assistance to two per flight.
battery_handling_instructions: Specific battery handling and disconnection instructions are not detailed on the public website; however, passengers are required to notify the airline 72 hours in advance to receive specific safety procedures. Passengers must specify the level of assistance and type of mobility aid at the time of booking. It is recommended to have technical sheets and user manuals available at the airport to assist staff if the battery requires removal.
special_assistance_contact_general: Special assistance arrangements should be centralized through the CemAir Call Centre. Passengers can request services during the online booking process or by contacting the dedicated Special Needs department during office hours (Monday to Friday, 07:00 to 19:00).

manual_wheelchair_policy: Personal manual wheelchairs and walking aids (sticks, crutches, frames) are transported free of charge and stowed in the aircraft hold. Passengers are encouraged to notify the airline at least 48 hours in advance. Standard manual wheelchairs that can be folded or disassembled are accepted. For safety reasons, passengers using mobility aids cannot be seated in emergency exit rows.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric mobility aids are accepted if they weigh 136kg or less and do not exceed dimensions of 114cm (width) x 86cm (height). Requirements for electric mobility aids (WCBD) must be finalized at least 72 hours prior to departure. The airline does not provide facilities to dismantle large mobility aids; they must fit through the cargo compartment door. Equipment is transported at the owner's risk and should be insured.
battery_handling_instructions: Batteries must be disconnected and terminals insulated to prevent short circuits. Lithium-ion batteries must be removed from the mobility aid and carried in the passenger cabin. Watt-hour limits for Lithium-ion batteries: a single battery must not exceed 300Wh, or if two batteries are used, each must not exceed 160Wh. Spillable (wet-cell) batteries are strictly prohibited.
special_assistance_contact_general: Special assistance can be requested during the online booking process or by contacting the Call Centre Special Needs department between 07:00 and 19:00 daily. Passengers needing assistance are requested to arrive at check-in at least 90 minutes before departure.

airline_name: Thai Lion Mentari Co., Ltd. (Thai Lion Air)
manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs and mobility devices are carried free of charge as priority checked baggage in addition to the regular free baggage allowance. Passengers must provide the dimensions and weight of their personal wheelchair during booking to ensure it can be loaded into the aircraft hold. If the wheelchair weighs over 32 kg (71 lbs), special authorization from the airline is required due to weight and space restrictions at certain airports.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs must be notified to the airline or call center at least 48 hours before departure. The airline requires the size and weight measurements at the time of booking to make necessary stowage arrangements in the cargo hold. Devices weighing more than 32 kg require prior authorization. Electric mobility aids must be prepared for transport by protecting them from damage and ensuring the battery is handled according to its type.
battery_handling_instructions: For Lithium-ion batteries specifically designed to be removed, the battery must be removed and carried in the cabin; single batteries must not exceed 300 Wh, or 160 Wh each if the device has two batteries. Non-spillable batteries must be 12V or less and 100 Wh or less. All batteries must be individually protected to prevent short circuits by insulating terminals (e.g., with tape) or placing them in separate plastic bags. For devices where the battery is not removed, it must be protected from accidental activation or the battery terminals must be disconnected and insulated.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special assistance should notify the airline at least 48 hours prior to departure via the Call Center or email. Assistance requested at the airport without prior notice will be provided based on availability and may be subject to a fee (e.g., THB 600 for wheelchair service).

manual_wheelchair_policy: Eastern Airlines provides assistance with loading, stowing, and retrieving manual wheelchairs and other assistive devices. Wheelchairs may be carried in the aircraft cabin if they meet FAA regulations for cabin stowage and space availability. If a device cannot be stowed in the cabin, it will be checked and carried free of charge in addition to the standard baggage allowance. The airline provides assembly and disassembly of wheelchairs at no additional charge.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are accepted for transport, typically as checked baggage in the cargo compartment. Eastern Airlines will assemble and disassemble these devices without charge. Acceptance is subject to federal (FAA) rules regarding hazardous and dangerous goods. Passengers are encouraged to provide instructions for the handling and stowage of their specific mobility device.
battery_handling_instructions: Eastern Airlines follows federal (FAA) and IATA regulations for battery-powered mobility aids. For lithium-ion batteries, if the battery is designed to be removable, it must be removed, terminals protected from short circuits, and carried in the passenger cabin. For non-spillable batteries, they may remain installed if securely attached and the device is protected from accidental activation. For spillable batteries, the airline may remove and package them separately in a leak-proof container if the wheelchair cannot be stowed upright.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special assistance are advised to contact the Eastern Airlines Reservations Center or visit a Customer Service Agent at their departure location. For general inquiries, passengers can use the online 'Contact Us' message form on the official website.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Passengers requiring special assistance, including the use of manual wheelchairs, must notify APG Airlines or their travel agent at least 48 hours before departure. Due to the operation of small aircraft (Beechcraft 1900D), stowage space for large equipment is limited, and pre-notification is essential to ensure the aid can be accommodated. Self-service wheelchairs are available at the terminal for use between check-in and boarding.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are accepted for transport but require prior authorization at least 48 hours before travel. Because APG Airlines operates 8-seater bi-turboprop aircraft, the dimensions and weight of the mobility aid must be provided at the time of booking to confirm it can fit within the cargo hold (cabin door approximately 63cm x 157cm). The aid must be prepared to prevent unintentional activation.
battery_handling_instructions: Batteries must be handled according to IATA Dangerous Goods Regulations. For lithium-ion batteries, if the mobility aid does not provide adequate protection, the battery must be removed, its terminals protected from short circuit, and carried in the passenger cabin. Removed lithium-ion batteries must not exceed 300Wh. For non-spillable batteries, they may remain installed if securely attached and protected from short circuit.
special_assistance_contact_general: Assistance needs should be indicated during booking or through the APG Airlines Global Helpdesk at least 48 hours prior to departure.

airline_name: Turkish Airlines Inc. (Turk Hava Yollari A.O.)
manual_wheelchair_policy: Personal manual wheelchairs are transported free of charge in the aircraft hold. Passengers may use their own wheelchair at the airport until the aircraft door, where it will be collected and stowed. Upon arrival, the wheelchair is typically returned at the aircraft door or in the baggage claim area. A limited number of larger aircraft may accommodate one standard manual wheelchair in the cabin on a first-come, first-served basis. Turkish Airlines also provides complimentary loaner wheelchairs at the airport and narrow onboard wheelchairs for use during the flight.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are transported free of charge in the cargo hold. Passengers must provide advance notice at least 48 hours prior to the flight, specifying the device type, dimensions, weight, and battery specifications. The airline requires that the device be protected against accidental activation and damage. In some cases, the battery may need to be disconnected or removed based on the battery type and airline safety protocols.
battery_handling_instructions: For lithium-ion batteries: If removable, the battery must not exceed 300 Wh (or two batteries of 160 Wh each) and must be removed from the device and carried in the passenger cabin. Spare lithium-ion batteries are limited to one not exceeding 300 Wh or two not exceeding 160 Wh each. For non-spillable batteries: Must be securely attached to the mobility aid with terminals insulated to prevent short circuits. For spillable batteries: Must be stowed in an upright position; if the wheelchair cannot be loaded upright, the battery must be removed and stored in a strong, rigid, leak-proof container in the cargo hold.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers should request special assistance through the 'Manage Booking' section on the official website or mobile app, or by contacting the global call center at least 48 hours before departure.
Legal Name: Turkish Airlines Inc. (Turk Hava Yollari A.O.)

manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual (conventional) wheelchairs can be carried as hand luggage if they can be stored in the overhead compartments or the aircraft closet. If they do not fit, they must be checked as baggage and will be transported from the boarding gate to the aircraft hold at no additional cost. Passengers are permitted up to two items related to their disability (e.g., wheelchair, cane, crutches) free of charge.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Motorized or electric wheelchairs are transported as checked baggage at no cost. The airline requires that batteries be removed from the wheelchair for transport. The passenger must notify the airline and register the assistance request at least 48 hours before the scheduled flight time. Travelers with electric wheelchairs must check in at the airport counter 2 hours and 30 minutes before domestic flights and 3 hours and 30 minutes before international flights.
battery_handling_instructions: For all electric wheelchairs, batteries must be removed and packed in a separate container. All electrical terminals must be properly protected against short circuits (e.g., insulated with tape). Lithium-ion batteries must not exceed 300 Wh for a single battery or 160 Wh each if the device requires two. If the wheelchair uses spillable (wet) batteries, they must be carried in the aircraft hold, and the flight commander must be notified of their presence. It is the passenger's responsibility to know the battery type and technical specifications.
special_assistance_contact_general: Assistance can be requested during the booking process on wingo.com or through their help channels up to 48 hours before departure. This includes the virtual assistant 'Violeta' on WhatsApp and the Call Center.

airline_name: Aerovias de Integracion Regional S.A. (LATAM Airlines Colombia)
manual_wheelchair_policy: Passengers can transport manual wheelchairs and mobility support items (canes, crutches, prostheses) free of charge as they are considered independent of the standard baggage allowance. Manual wheelchairs are typically checked into the hold, but orthopedic devices like canes or crutches can be taken on board. It is recommended to contact the airline at least 24 hours before departure through the Contact Center to request assistance.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric or battery-powered wheelchairs are transported free of charge in the aircraft hold. To ensure proper handling and stowage, passengers must contact the airline at least 24 hours (preferably 48 hours for complex needs) before the flight. At the airport, boarding passes for passengers with motorized wheelchairs are issued at the counter. The wheelchair must be properly prepared for transport according to battery safety regulations.
battery_handling_instructions: Lithium-ion batteries: If the battery is removable, it must be removed and carried in the cabin; if not removable, it must be securely attached and the chair protected from accidental activation. Maximum capacity is 1 battery of 300 Wh or 2 batteries of 160 Wh each. Spare batteries (max 1 of 300 Wh or 2 of 160 Wh) must be carried in cabin baggage with terminals protected by tape or original packaging. Non-spillable batteries must be securely attached to the mobility device with terminals protected from short circuits. Spillable batteries must remain upright or be removed/crated if the wheelchair cannot be stowed upright.
special_assistance_contact_general: Requests for wheelchair assistance or mobility aid transport should be made through the LATAM Contact Center or the 'Help Center' on the official website. For flights from Colombia, passengers can use the dedicated local service lines or the global WhatsApp assistance channel.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Passengers with limited mobility or those requiring a manual wheelchair must contact Solomon Airlines Reservations prior to travel to arrange special assistance. Manual wheelchairs are generally carried as checked baggage; however, passengers can request assistance to the aircraft door or seat. If the mobility aid exceeds certain size and weight limitations, it may need to be transported as freight. Use of the Solomon Airlines Medical Travel Clearance Form is required if the passenger's condition necessitates specific handling or if they are unable to move independently.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric or battery-powered wheelchairs require prior notification and approval from Solomon Airlines. Passengers must contact Reservations at least 48 hours before departure (or at the time of booking) to provide details including the device type, weight, dimensions, and battery specifications. The mobility aid must be prepared for safe transport to prevent accidental activation and damage to the controls.
battery_types_allowed: Non-spillable wet batteries (gel, AGM, sealed lead-acid)
battery_handling_instructions: Passengers must provide specific information on the type of battery installed and instructions on how to isolate the battery to prevent short circuits. For lithium-ion powered aids, batteries must generally be verifiable (UN 38.3 compliant). If the battery is designed to be removed, it must be protected and carried in the passenger cabin. Terminals must be insulated to prevent short circuits if disconnected.
special_assistance_contact_general: For all special assistance requests, passengers should contact Solomon Airlines Reservations. It is recommended to submit requests at least 48 hours prior to the scheduled flight. A 'Medical Travel Clearance Form' may be required for passengers with limited mobility.

manual_wheelchair_policy: La Compagnie transports manual wheelchairs and other assistive devices free of charge; they are not included in the standard baggage allowance. Passengers are requested to inform the airline of their assistance needs at the time of booking, via the 'My bookings' section on the website, or by contacting customer service before departure.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and battery-powered mobility aids are accepted, but passengers must notify the airline in advance (ideally 48 hours before departure) to ensure the device can be accommodated. The airline requests specific information regarding the weight, dimensions, and battery type to provide appropriate assistance. Approval is required before travel.
battery_handling_instructions: Passengers traveling with battery-powered mobility aids must contact the airline's customer service team for detailed criteria and safety requirements. General instructions include ensuring the device is protected from accidental activation and the battery is securely attached or prepared for removal if necessary, according to IATA safety regulations.
special_assistance_contact_general: Contact the La Compagnie customer service team to request assistance or provide mobility device specifications. Recommended notice is at least 48 hours before departure.

manual_wheelchair_policy: One manual wheelchair or mobility aid up to 32kg is carried free of charge in addition to the standard checked baggage allowance. These devices are carried in the aircraft hold and are not permitted in the cabin. On FlyNamibia Safari/Zambezi flights (Cessna aircraft), only one manually operated, fully collapsible wheelchair with a maximum weight of 20kg is permitted, and passengers must be able to board and deboard with minimal assistance.
electric_wheelchair_policy: FlyNamibia does not permit battery-powered wheelchairs or mobility aids weighing more than 32kg onboard; devices exceeding this weight must be transported as cargo and arranged by the passenger. Wheelchairs within the 32kg limit are carried in the hold compartment and are not permitted in the cabin. Transportation is subject to aircraft-specific stowage space restrictions.
battery_handling_instructions: Passengers must notify the airline of the wheelchair's weight and battery type at least three business days prior to departure (or by 15:00 on the preceding Friday for Monday flights). While specific technical disconnection steps are not listed online, passengers are required to complete a Special Medical Needs Request Form (MEDA) to facilitate assessment and handling.
special_assistance_contact_general: Requests for wheelchair assistance must be made through the FlyNamibia Reservations Support desk at least three business days before travel. Assistance can be booked Monday to Friday between 08:00 and 17:00.

airline_name: TAM - Transportes Aéreos del Mercosur Sociedad Anónima (LATAM Airlines Paraguay)
manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs are transported free of charge and do not count toward the standard baggage allowance. One adult-sized folding, collapsible, or break-down manual wheelchair with dimensions of 13 x 36 x 42 inches (33 x 91 x 106 cm) or less can be stowed in the aircraft cabin in dedicated closets or via safety straps, depending on the aircraft model and space availability. Larger manual wheelchairs are transported in the cargo hold.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and mobility aids are transported as checked baggage in the cargo hold. Passengers must request this service at least 48 hours before departure. The device must be protected against accidental activation, and its weight and dimensions must be compatible with the aircraft's cargo hold entry. Only airport check-in is permitted for battery-powered wheelchair users (except on flights from Brazil where online check-in is allowed).
battery_types_allowed: Non-spillable wet batteries (Gel cell, absorbed electrolyte)
Spillable wet batteries (subject to specific containment)
battery_handling_instructions: Batteries must be securely attached to the wheelchair. If the mobility aid design does not provide adequate protection for the battery, it must be removed and carried in the cabin. For lithium-ion batteries, a single battery must not exceed 300 Wh, or two batteries must not exceed 160 Wh each. Spare batteries must be individually protected (terminals taped or in original packaging) and carried in carry-on baggage. Spillable batteries may require removal and specialized packaging if the wheelchair cannot be loaded and stowed in an upright position.
special_assistance_contact_general: Contact the LATAM Airlines Contact Center at least 24 to 48 hours before the flight departure to request wheelchair services or report battery specifications. Assistance can also be requested via the virtual WhatsApp assistant.
Legal Name: TAM - Transportes Aéreos del Mercosur Sociedad Anónima

airline_name: Luxair Société Luxembourgeoise de Navigation Aérienne S.A.
manual_wheelchair_policy: Passengers' own manual wheelchairs are carried free of charge and in addition to the free baggage allowance. For space reasons, they are transported in the hold. Passengers are required to provide the brand, type (foldable or non-foldable), weight, and dimensions at least 48 hours before departure. To minimize height, the measurement is taken with the seat back tilted if possible.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and mobility aids are carried in the cargo hold. Passengers must provide specific information including brand, type, weight, dimensions, and battery type at least 48 hours in advance for confirmation. Spillable batteries are strictly prohibited on Luxair passenger flights and must be transported via a separate cargo carrier. Protective measures must be taken to prevent short circuits and unintentional activation during the flight.
battery_types_allowed: Dry cell batteries (Max 4 in cargo hold)
Wet non-spillable batteries (Max 2 in cargo hold)
Lithium-ion batteries (1 attached in cargo hold; spares in cabin)
battery_handling_instructions: Battery terminals must be securely attached or protected from short circuits and unintentional activation. Spare or removed batteries must be carried in strong, rigid packaging. For Lithium-ion batteries, a maximum of one spare battery not exceeding 300 Wh or two spare batteries each not exceeding 160 Wh may be carried in the passenger cabin. All spare batteries must be protected from short circuits (e.g., terminals covered with tape or placed in individual bags).
special_assistance_contact_general: Assistance must be requested at least 48 hours before departure. This can be done by filling out the official contact form on the Luxair website (Category: Passenger Assistance – Wheelchair) or by calling the Customer Service Centre.
Legal Name: LUXAIR Société Luxembourgeoise de Navigation Aérienne S.A.

airline_name: Aeroméxico (Aerovías de México S.A. de C.V.)
manual_wheelchair_policy: Aeroméxico allows passengers to check manual wheelchairs free of charge. They can be taken to the aircraft door (gate-checked) and returned upon arrival. For stowage in the cargo hold, max size for certain aircraft (like the Embraer 190) is 48 x 40 x 28 inches (122 x 101 x 71 cm). The maximum weight for any wheelchair is 440 lbs (200 kg). Folding wheelchairs can sometimes be stored in the cabin on aircraft like the Boeing 737 and 787 if space is available.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and scooters are transported in the cargo hold. Passengers must complete the 'Mobility Device Handling Form' before arriving at the airport and provide disassembly and assembly instructions. Removable parts (footrests, cushions) should be stored in the cabin or checked with the device. Aeroméxico primarily supports electric wheelchairs with non-spillable batteries; liquid batteries are subject to stricter handling rules.
battery_handling_instructions: For Lithium-ion batteries: If the device is designed for battery removal, the battery must be removed, protected from short circuits (by taping terminals), and carried in the cabin. The single battery limit is 300 Wh; if the device uses two batteries, each must not exceed 160 Wh. For Non-spillable batteries: They may remain installed if securely attached and the electrical circuit is isolated. For Spillable batteries: The device must be kept upright during loading and unloading; if it cannot be kept upright, the battery must be removed and packed in a strong, leak-proof container.
special_assistance_contact_general: Requests for special assistance must be made at least 72 hours before domestic flights and 96 hours before international flights via the official 'Special Travel Accommodation Request' form on the Aeroméxico website or by calling the Customer Service Center.
Legal Name: Aerovías de Mexico S.A. de C.V

manual_wheelchair_policy: Corsair transports up to two mobility aids (such as manual wheelchairs, walkers, or crutches) free of charge and in addition to the standard baggage allowance. These items are typically stowed in the aircraft hold. Passengers must notify the airline of their intent to travel with a wheelchair at the time of booking or at least 48 hours before the scheduled departure. Transport is subject to aircraft door dimensions and available space.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and power-driven mobility aids are accepted for transport in the hold free of charge (up to two aids per passenger). Notification with details of the device's weight, dimensions (length, width, height), and battery type is mandatory at least 48 hours before departure. The device must be prepared for transport by protecting it from accidental activation. Corsair reserves the right to refuse transport if the device cannot fit through the aircraft door for technical or safety reasons.
battery_handling_instructions: Lithium-ion batteries that are removable must be taken into the passenger cabin; a single battery must not exceed 300 Wh, or if there are two, each must not exceed 160 Wh. They must be protected from short circuit and placed in a protective pouch. Non-spillable batteries can generally remain attached to the wheelchair if the terminals are protected and the device is secured against accidental activation. Spillable batteries must be loaded, stowed, and unloaded in an upright position; if this is not possible, the battery must be removed and packed in a strong, rigid, leak-proof container provided by the passenger.
special_assistance_contact_general: Corsair Customer Service and Special Assistance team, available daily from 7:00 AM to 12:00 AM (Mainland France time).

manual_wheelchair_policy: NordStar Airlines carries a passenger's own manual wheelchair free of charge as checked baggage in addition to the standard baggage allowance. Passengers may use their manual wheelchair until the boarding gate or aircraft door, after which it will be stowed in the aircraft hold. For stowage in the cabin, the device must meet standard carry-on dimensions (typically not exceeding 55x40x23 cm) and weight limits, or be stored in a designated cabin closet if available on aircraft with 100+ seats, subject to priority rules.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs must be transported in the aircraft hold as checked baggage. Passengers are required to notify the airline at least 48 hours prior to departure to ensure the device can be accommodated based on aircraft type and cargo door dimensions. The wheelchair must be prepared for transport by disconnecting the battery and isolating the terminals to prevent short circuits. Operating instructions should be provided to airline staff.
battery_handling_instructions: For non-spillable batteries, the battery can remain attached if securely fixed to the mobility aid and protected from accidental activation. Spillable (wet) batteries must be disconnected, removed, and stowed in a special protective container provided by the passenger. Lithium-ion batteries must be removed from collapsible wheelchairs; the removed battery must have protected terminals and be carried in the passenger cabin. Lithium-ion batteries are limited to a maximum of 300 Wh for a single battery or 160 Wh each for two batteries. Passengers must bring tools required for disconnecting battery terminals.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special assistance should contact the NordStar Call Center at least 48 hours before the flight. Assistance can be requested during the booking process on the official website or by calling their support lines.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs and other mobility aids (canes, crutches, walkers) are carried free of charge and do not count toward the passenger's baggage allowance. Due to limited cabin space, they are typically stored in the cargo hold as checked baggage. For non-collapsible wheelchairs, passengers must ensure the device fits within the specific cargo hold dimensions of the aircraft (e.g., A350: 1.65m x 0.85m x 0.70m; B777-300ER: 3.12m x 0.84m x 1.01m). On-board wheelchairs are provided on all wide-body aircraft; for narrow-body aircraft, a request should be made at least 48 hours in advance.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Passengers must notify the airline at least 48 hours before departure for battery-powered wheelchairs. All battery-operated mobility aids require prior airline approval. Devices must be switched off and protected from accidental activation. For safety, the airline requires specific handling based on battery type and the ability of the device to be stowed upright. If the wheelchair cannot be stowed upright, the battery may need to be removed and packed according to hazardous materials regulations.
battery_handling_instructions: 1. Batteries securely attached and protected from damage should remain on the mobility aid; the aid must be switched off. 2. Battery terminals must be insulated (e.g., with tape) to prevent short circuits. 3. If the battery is removable (e.g., for collapsible aids), it must be removed, terminals insulated, and placed in a protective pouch. 4. Lithium-ion batteries: Removable batteries must not exceed 300Wh (single) or 160Wh each (dual) and must be carried in cabin baggage. Non-removable Lithium batteries have no Wh limit but must remain attached. 5. Non-spillable batteries (spares/removed) must be 12V or less and 100Wh or less for cabin carriage. 6. Spillable batteries: If the device cannot be loaded upright, the battery must be removed and placed in strong, leak-proof packaging with absorbent material.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers can request assistance via the 'Manage Booking' portal on the official website or by submitting a 'Special Assistance' request form online. Requests should be made at least 48 hours before departure (5 working days for special equipment like MERU chairs).

manual_wheelchair_policy: MGA provides wheelchair assistance at three levels: WCHR (difficulty walking long distances), WCHS (cannot climb stairs), and WCHC (completely immobile). Manual wheelchairs can be used up to the aircraft door, after which they are stored in the cargo hold and delivered back at the aircraft door upon arrival. Passengers must provide dimensions and weight during registration and are required to request service at least 48 hours before departure.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are accepted for transport in the cargo hold but require prior approval from the airline. Passengers must fill out a specific 'Wheelchair Application Form' on the airline's website, providing the wheelchair type, weight, number of batteries, and battery specifications, including a photo of the battery information. Wheelchairs powered by liquid (wet) batteries (WCHBW) are strictly prohibited for safety reasons.
battery_types_allowed: Lithium-ion batteries (subject to approval and Watt-hour limits)
battery_handling_instructions: Liquid batteries are not accepted. For approved battery types (non-spillable, dry, etc.), battery terminals must be protected from short circuits. Passengers must notify the airline at least 48 hours in advance and provide full technical specifications via the online Wheelchair Application Form. For lithium-ion batteries, standard safety protocols require them to be individually protected and, if removable, carried in the passenger cabin.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers can request assistance during the booking process or by contacting customer service at least 48 hours before departure. A dedicated 'Wheelchair Application Form' is available on the official website under the 'Help & Contact' section.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs are carried free of charge and do not count toward the baggage allowance. They are typically stowed in the aircraft hold. On wide-body aircraft (Airbus A330, A350, A380, and Boeing 777, 787), space is available to stow one manual folding wheelchair in the cabin on a first-come, first-served basis. Folded dimensions for such devices should not exceed 890mm (length) x 415mm (width) x 270mm. Mobility aids over 32kg must be transported as freight unless they can be steered in freewheel mode.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and mobility aids are accepted as checked baggage and stowed in the aircraft hold. Passengers are encouraged to notify the airline at least 48 hours in advance with details including weight, dimensions, and battery type. Depending on the airport and device, passengers may use their own wheelchair to the gate, but this is not guaranteed as the device may require disassembly or battery disconnection prior to loading.
battery_handling_instructions: For lithium-ion batteries: If the battery remains attached to the device, there is no Watt-hour (Wh) limit. If removed, the battery must not exceed 300Wh (or 160Wh each for devices with two batteries). Removed batteries and spares must be protected from short circuits by insulating terminals and must be carried in the passenger cabin in a protective pouch. For spillable batteries, the device must be loaded, stowed, secured, and unloaded in an upright position; otherwise, the battery must be removed and packed in a leak-proof container. Damaged or leaking batteries are strictly prohibited.
special_assistance_contact_general: Assistance can be requested during booking or via the 'Manage Booking' section on the official website up to 48 hours before departure. For U.S. flights, a Complaint Resolution Official (CRO) is available at the airport to assist with disability-related concerns.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs are accepted as checked baggage free of charge and do not count toward the standard free baggage allowance. Customers are encouraged to provide dimensions (height, width, depth) and weight at the time of reservation. Standard airport wheelchairs are available for loan at all airports serviced by the airline. Passengers may use their own wheelchair until the aircraft entrance upon request, subject to airport facilities and aircraft type (primarily Boeing 737-800).
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are accepted as checked baggage. Passengers must provide the battery type, whether it is foldable, and its dimensions and weight during booking. The airline performs a visual inspection of the battery at the airport. Wheelchairs may be loaded on their side if height restrictions of the cargo hold apply, so passengers should consult the airline in advance regarding loading methods. A 'Wheelchair Confirmation Form' may be required at least five days prior to departure for complex configurations.
battery_handling_instructions: Battery terminals must be protected from short circuits by insulation (e.g., taping over terminals or placing in a protective pouch). For lithium-ion batteries, if the battery is removable, it must be removed and carried in the cabin; if the battery is not removable, it must be securely attached to the wheelchair and the power must be turned off. For spillable batteries, the battery must be kept in an upright position and securely attached to the device; if the device cannot be loaded upright, the battery must be removed and packed in a leak-proof container.
special_assistance_contact_general: Special Assistance Desk (JAL Group) provides support for Japan Transocean Air. Available daily from 9:00 to 17:00 JST.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Guests can bring their own manual wheelchair free of charge. To ensure safe handling, manual wheelchairs should generally not exceed 120 cm (47 inches) in height and 60 kg in weight; items exceeding these limits require advance approval. On wide-body aircraft (A380, B787, B777, A350), manual wheelchairs up to 33 cm x 91 cm x 106 cm may be stored in the cabin on a first-come, first-served basis. All aircraft operating to/from the US provide priority cabin stowage for one folding wheelchair.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs require prior approval and must be requested at least 48 hours before departure. The device must be dry-cell, non-spillable, or lithium-ion operated. Etihad must be able to load and unload the device in an upright position. For safety, electrical circuits must be isolated to prevent accidental activation. Weight and height limits are generally 60 kg and 120 cm, though heavier devices can be accommodated with prior coordination.
battery_handling_instructions: Lithium-ion batteries: If the wheelchair is designed for battery removal, the battery must be removed, terminals protected, and carried in the passenger cabin. Watt-hour limits apply: one battery up to 300 Wh or two batteries up to 160 Wh each. One spare up to 300 Wh or two spares up to 160 Wh each are permitted in the cabin. Non-spillable/Nickel-metal hydride/Dry batteries: If detachable, batteries must be removed and packed in strong, rigid packaging for carriage as checked baggage only. Spillable batteries: May remain attached if the wheelchair can be loaded, stowed, and unloaded in an upright position; otherwise, they must be removed and packed as dangerous goods.
special_assistance_contact_general: Requests for special assistance should be made through the 'Manage Booking' section of the website, via the live chat bot, virtual WhatsApp assistant, or by calling a global contact center at least 48 hours before the flight.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs are transported free of charge and do not count towards the passenger's free baggage allowance. They must be checked in as cargo and are not permitted in the cabin. Passengers are advised to provide dimensions (Length x Width x Height) and weight at the time of booking to ensure the device fits within the cargo holds of the specific aircraft (e.g., Embraer 190, Airbus A320). Most narrow-body aircraft doors on the GS fleet have height restrictions (approximately 71-84 cm).
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs must be checked in as baggage. Passengers must notify the airline at least 48 hours in advance or by 16:00 on the day prior to departure. Devices must be protected from accidental activation (switched off and isolated). Due to specific airline variation GS-07, lithium-ion batteries exceeding 100 Wh are not accepted in the cargo compartment and must be removed and carried in the cabin.
battery_types_allowed: Non-spillable wet batteries (Gel, AGM, Sealed Lead-Acid)
battery_handling_instructions: For lithium-ion batteries: If the wheelchair is designed for battery removal, the battery must be removed, terminals insulated (e.g., with tape), and carried in the passenger cabin in a protective pouch. A single removed battery must not exceed 300 Wh; if the device requires two batteries, each must not exceed 160 Wh. For non-spillable batteries: Terminals must be protected from short circuits, and the battery must be securely attached to the wheelchair or removed and packed in a strong, rigid packaging if the wheelchair cannot be stowed upright.
special_assistance_contact_general: Tianjin Airlines Customer Service Center (available 24/7). Passengers are encouraged to contact the airline at the time of booking to arrange for wheelchair ramp or cabin services.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Nesma Airlines permits passengers with disabilities to carry one manual wheelchair free of charge. The wheelchair is accepted as checked baggage and will be stowed in the aircraft's cargo compartment. Passengers are advised to provide notice of their needs at the time of booking or via the special assistance contact.
electric_wheelchair_policy: The airline accepts battery-powered wheelchairs and mobility aids as checked baggage. These devices are generally transported with the battery attached. However, the airline specifically excludes the carriage of 'wet batteries'. Recreational mobility devices such as self-balancing hoverboards are strictly prohibited onboard.
battery_types_allowed: Lithium-ion (implied, as only wet batteries are explicitly excluded)
battery_handling_instructions: Wheelchairs and mobility aids will be transported with the battery attached, except when otherwise noted by the airline or for safety reasons. Batteries must not exhibit any evidence of previous leakage or damage to be accepted for carriage. Passengers are encouraged to contact the airline at least 48 hours in advance to confirm specific handling requirements for their device.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special assistance should contact the airline's dedicated SSR (Special Service Request) team or customer service via email or hotline at least 48 hours before departure. This includes requests for wheelchair assistance and the transport of personal mobility aids.

airline_name: TAAG - Linhas Aéreas de Angola S.A.
manual_wheelchair_policy: TAAG provides free special assistance for passengers with reduced mobility. Manual wheelchairs are accepted and should be requested during the flight booking process. The airline offers three levels of assistance: WCHR (for passengers who can climb stairs but need help with distances), WCHS (for passengers who cannot climb stairs but can walk to their seat), and WCHC (for passengers who are completely immobile and require assistance to be seated). Passengers must inform the airline in advance if they wish to transport their own wheelchair.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are accepted for transport but require prior notification at the time of booking. Passengers must provide the airline with the type of chair, weight, dimensions, and battery specifications. The device must be prepared to prevent accidental activation and protected against short circuits. Handling typically involves stowage in the cargo hold, and the airline may request dimensions to ensure the device fits through the aircraft's cargo doors.
battery_handling_instructions: Passengers must inform TAAG of the battery type and power rating (Wh) before travel. For lithium-ion batteries, a single battery must not exceed 300 Wh, or if the device is powered by two batteries, each must not exceed 160 Wh. Batteries specifically designed to be removed must be carried in the passenger cabin in a protective pouch. Non-spillable batteries must be securely attached to the mobility aid, disconnected, and the terminals insulated to prevent short circuits. The pilot-in-command must be notified of the location of the mobility aid and its batteries.
special_assistance_contact_general: Special assistance must be requested during the booking process or via the global booking center and customer service channels.
Legal Name: TAAG - Linhas Aéreas de Angola S.A.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Volotea allows passengers to transport up to two pieces of mobility equipment (e.g., manual wheelchair, walker) free of charge. Requests for assistance must be made at least 48 hours before the flight's departure. The maximum weight allowed for a manual wheelchair or mobility aid is 150 kg per piece. Specific dimensions for the cargo hold must be respected: for Airbus A319, the limits are 1.42m (height) x 1.817m (width) x 2m (length); for Airbus A320, they are 1.43m (height) x 1.82m (width) x 2m (length).
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and mobility aids must be notified to the airline at least 48 hours in advance to ensure they meet safety and space requirements. The device must not exceed 150 kg. Dimensions must fit within the cargo hold limits of the aircraft (A319: 1.42m H x 1.817m W x 2m L; A320: 1.43m H x 1.82m W x 2m L). Passengers should provide technical specifications including the make, model, weight, and battery type at the time of request.
battery_types_allowed: Non-spillable (Dry cell, Gel cell, Sealed Lead Acid)
battery_handling_instructions: For Lithium-ion batteries: If the battery is removable, it must be removed and carried in the passenger cabin; if it is not removable, it must be securely attached to the device. For non-spillable batteries: They must be disconnected and the terminals must be insulated (e.g., with electrical tape) to prevent short circuits. The device must be protected from accidental activation by being completely switched off or by isolating the power source.
special_assistance_contact_general: Special assistance can be requested during the booking process on the official website or through the 'Manage Your Booking' section. Alternatively, passengers can use the dedicated phone line for PRM assistance.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs and other mobility aids (canes, crutches, prostheses) are transported free of charge and do not count toward the standard baggage allowance. There is no limit on the number of items. For in-cabin stowage, LATAM aircraft are equipped with closets or safety straps to accommodate one adult-sized folding manual wheelchair with dimensions of 13 x 36 x 42 inches (33 x 91 x 106 cm) or less. Larger manual wheelchairs are transported in the cargo hold. Requests for assistance or stowage should be made at least 24 to 48 hours before departure.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric or battery-powered wheelchairs are transported in the aircraft cargo hold. Passengers must notify the airline at least 48 hours in advance through the Contact Center or WhatsApp assistant. When traveling with a motorized wheelchair, boarding passes can only be obtained at the airport check-in counter. The wheelchair must be protected against accidental activation and damage during transport.
battery_types_allowed: Non-spillable wet batteries (Sealed Lead Acid, AGM, Gel)
battery_handling_instructions: Lithium-ion batteries: Allowed if attached to the wheelchair. If the battery is removable or not adequately protected, it must be removed and carried in the passenger cabin (limit: 1 battery up to 300 Wh or 2 batteries up to 160 Wh each). Terminals must be insulated with adhesive tape. Non-spillable batteries: Must remain attached to the device with terminals protected from short circuits; spare batteries must be packed in strong, rigid packaging. Spillable batteries: The wheelchair must be loaded and stowed upright. If upright stowage is not possible, the battery must be removed and transported in a strong, rigid, leak-proof container labeled 'Battery, Wet, with Wheelchair'.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers can request assistance through the LATAM virtual assistant on WhatsApp or by calling the regional Contact Center at least 48 hours before the flight.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Swiftair S.A. (operating passenger services primarily under the UEP! FLY brand) transports manual wheelchairs and mobility aids free of charge in the aircraft hold. Passengers are advised to provide dimensions and weight at the time of booking or at least 48 hours before departure. Due to the use of ATR 72 aircraft on many passenger routes, stowage is subject to hold door dimensions and weight capacity; contact with the airline is required for confirmation of non-standard devices.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and mobility aids are accepted for carriage with prior approval. Passengers must notify the airline at least 48 hours in advance (72 hours is recommended for electric aids). The airline follows IATA Dangerous Goods Regulations for the safe transport of battery-powered devices. The equipment will be stowed in the hold, and passengers may be asked to provide technical specifications (make, model, and battery type) during the approval process.
battery_handling_instructions: Swiftair adheres to IATA Dangerous Goods Regulations (DGR). Batteries must be securely attached to the wheelchair, and the electrical circuits must be isolated to prevent accidental activation. For lithium-ion batteries: if the battery is removable, it must be removed by the passenger, protected from short circuits (e.g., by taping terminals), and carried in the passenger cabin. Lithium-ion batteries must not exceed 300Wh for a single battery or 160Wh each for two batteries. Non-spillable batteries must remain securely attached to the device with terminals protected.
special_assistance_contact_general: Special assistance requests for scheduled passenger flights should be directed to UEP! FLY, Swiftair's dedicated passenger service brand. For charter or other operations, contact Swiftair S.A. corporate headquarters in Madrid.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Passengers may carry their own manual wheelchair free of charge, which is tagged at check-in. Note that handling fees apply for flights departing from Mumbai (USD 30) and Dubai (USD 90). Air Tanzania does not provide onboard wheelchairs; passengers requiring mobility assistance during the flight must bring their own aircraft-compatible personal mobility device.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and battery-powered mobility aids require prior notification at least 48 hours before departure. Passengers must obtain medical clearance by completing a Medical Information Form (MEDIF). The airline requires mobility aids to comply with IATA safety standards for the transport of dangerous goods. Approval is subject to the limited space available on the aircraft.
battery_handling_instructions: Batteries must be dry-cell operated. For devices where the battery is not built-in or lacks protective features, the battery must be removed and stored separately in hand luggage. Terminals must be protected from short circuits. For battery-powered medical equipment, passengers must ensure they have sufficient battery power to last 1.5 times the flight duration.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring special services should contact the Air Tanzania Contact Centre or visit a local town office at least 48 hours before travel. A MEDIF form is required for passengers using battery-powered mobility aids or medical devices.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Egyptair carries personal manual wheelchairs free of charge in the aircraft hold. Passengers are encouraged to use the airline's own wheelchairs (WCHR, WCHS, WCHC) from check-in to the aircraft. Maximum dimensions for wheelchairs vary by aircraft: A330-300 (W 95 x H 62 cm), Boeing 787 (W 1.01 x H 1.14 m), and Boeing 777-300 (W 83 x H 110 cm). Note that suitable backing or wrapping is required for the wheelchair.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are accepted as checked baggage. Egyptair accepts dry cell, gel cell, and non-spillable electric storage batteries. Wet batteries are strictly not accepted. For lithium-ion powered chairs, the battery must be removed if it is specifically designed to be removable, and carried in the cabin. If the battery is fixed, the mobility aid is accepted as checked baggage normally provided it is protected from unintentional activation.
battery_handling_instructions: Terminals must be insulated with non-conductive tape to prevent short circuits. Electrical circuits must be inhibited by a switch or by disconnecting the poles. Removable lithium-ion batteries must not exceed 300 Wh (or 160 Wh each for systems with two batteries) and must be carried in the cabin in a protective pouch. A maximum of one spare battery up to 300 Wh or two spares up to 160 Wh each is allowed in the cabin.
special_assistance_contact_general: Requests for special assistance must be made at least 48 hours before departure. Passengers are advised to arrive at the airport 3 hours before international flights (2 hours for domestic).

manual_wheelchair_policy: Passengers with reduced mobility are allowed to carry one collapsible wheelchair free of charge. Manual wheelchairs must be loaded in the aircraft hold as checked baggage. In accordance with international laws, any single piece of checked baggage, including wheelchairs, must not exceed 32 kg. Notification of the need for wheelchair assistance or carriage is required at least 48 hours prior to departure.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and mobility aids are accepted as checked baggage and kept in the aircraft hold. Jazeera Airways will not accept the transport of damaged or leaking batteries. Passengers must provide sufficient details about the mobility aid and its batteries to the airline staff at least 48 hours prior to travel to ensure adequate safety measures and handling.
battery_handling_instructions: Jazeera Airways follows ICAO and IATA Dangerous Goods Regulations. Removable lithium-ion batteries must be removed from the mobility aid, have their terminals protected from short circuits (e.g., by taping over or using a protective pouch), and be carried in the passenger cabin. The battery capacity is typically limited to 300Wh for a single battery or 160Wh each for two batteries. For non-removable batteries, the mobility aid must be protected from accidental activation and the terminals must be disconnected or insulated.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers must advise Jazeera Airways of their special mobility needs by contacting their local office or the central call center at least 48 hours prior to the flight. Assistance at Jazeera Terminal 5 can be requested at the time of booking or via the contact center.

airline_name: Concesionaria Vuela Compañía de Aviación, S.A.P.I. de C.V. (Volaris)
manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs are transported free of charge and do not count against the standard baggage allowance. Passengers must notify the airline at least 48 hours in advance. The device can be checked at the counter or gate-checked. Assistance is provided for boarding, deplaning, and navigating the airport. While specific dimensions for manual chairs are not explicitly capped, the aircraft cargo hold limits for mobility aids are generally 1.30 meters (length), 0.80 meters (width), and 1.00 meter (height).
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs are subject to a maximum weight of 60 kg and maximum dimensions of 1.30m (Length) x 0.80m (Width) x 1.00m (Height). Passengers must arrive at the airport 3 hours before domestic flights and 4 hours before international flights to facilitate inspection. During check-in, passengers must provide the battery type (manufacturer/model), number of batteries, energy capacity in Wh, and a technical manual or instructions for disassembly. The device will be rejected if the battery shows signs of leakage or damage.
battery_types_allowed: Lithium-ion batteries (Max 300Wh for a single battery)
Lithium-ion batteries (Max 160Wh each if carrying two spares)
battery_handling_instructions: Batteries must be disconnected and terminals insulated with non-conductive tape to prevent short circuits. For lithium-ion powered devices, the battery must be removed if it is not encased in a protective housing and carried in the cabin. Passengers must carry a fire- and explosion-resistant bag (Lipobag) for removable lithium batteries, with dimensions not exceeding 25cm x 35cm. Tools required for disassembly must be brought by the passenger and will be checked with the mobility aid. A Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS) or user manual should be presented at the counter.
special_assistance_contact_general: Volaris Special Assistance can be requested through the 'Tu Experiencia' portal at tuexperiencia.volaris.com or via WhatsApp at +52 55 5898 8599. Notification is required at least 48 hours before the flight.
Legal Name: Concesionara Vuela Comania de Aviación, SA de CV

manual_wheelchair_policy: British Airways accepts manual wheelchairs for travel. Passengers may use their own wheelchair at the airport until the departure gate. One collapsible manual wheelchair can be stored in the aircraft cabin on a first-come, first-served basis if space is available. Maximum dimensions for wheelchairs on flights to/from the UK and Europe (except London City) are 140cm x 85cm x 106cm. For London City (BA CityFlyer), limits are 74cm x 94cm x 73cm (upright). For the rest of the world, height limits may increase to 152cm. Devices weighing more than 250kg (tare) require advance coordination with the Accessibility Team.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and mobility aids require advance notification at least 48 hours before departure. Passengers must provide the device type, dimensions, tare weight, number of batteries, battery type, and instructions for deactivation. The power must be isolated or disconnected to prevent accidental activation during the flight using methods such as removing the key, using an isolation switch, or a Neutrik plug.
battery_types_allowed: Non-spillable wet (Gel, AGM, Sealed Lead Acid)
battery_handling_instructions: Lithium-ion batteries: If removable, the battery must not exceed 300Wh (single) or 160Wh each (if two). Removed or spare lithium batteries must be carried in the cabin in protective pouches. Non-spillable/Dry cell: If securely attached, they can remain in the device if isolated. Removed non-spillable batteries must be in strong, rigid packaging in the hold. Spillable batteries: Advance notice is required as they may need removal and special leak-proof packaging marked 'BATTERY WET WITH WHEELCHAIR' with Class 8 Corrosive labels.
special_assistance_contact_general: Assistance can be requested via 'Manage My Booking' on the official website at least 48 hours before departure. Customers can also use the chatbot on the BA Help & Contacts page.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Air Vanuatu provides wheelchair assistance for passengers with mobility limitations (SSR codes WCHR, WCHS, WCHC). Manual wheelchairs are carried in the aircraft hold at no additional charge. However, due to the narrow-body aircraft fleet (Boeing 737-800, ATR 72, DHC-6 Twin Otter), mobility aids must meet specified size dimensions when adjusted or broken down. Personal wheelchairs are not permitted in the aircraft cabin; however, walking canes, crutches, and collapsible walking frames may be carried on board if they can be safely stowed in overhead lockers or under the seat. Non-collapsible frames must be surrendered at check-in or the departure gate for hold stowage.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and power-driven mobility aids are accepted as checked baggage in the aircraft hold but require prior arrangement and approval from the airline at the time of booking or at least 48 hours before departure. These devices are classified under 'Dangerous Goods' regulations. Because the airline operates narrow-body aircraft, users must ensure the device can be broken down or adjusted to fit within limited cargo hold dimensions. Passengers are required to declare electric mobility aids at the check-in desk to ensure safety protocols are followed.
battery_types_allowed: Spillable (Wet cell) - typically prohibited or highly restricted
battery_handling_instructions: Air Vanuatu follows Australian and IATA/ICAO dangerous goods regulations. For Lithium-ion batteries: if removable, the battery must not exceed 300Wh (or 160Wh each for two batteries) and must be removed and carried in the cabin with terminals protected against short circuits. For non-removable Lithium batteries, there is generally no Wh limit on the installed battery, but the device must be protected from accidental activation. For non-spillable batteries: the battery must be securely attached to the mobility aid, terminals protected, and the electrical circuit isolated. If the device cannot be protected from accidental activation, the battery must be disconnected and terminals insulated. Proof of battery type (label or MSDS) is required at check-in.
special_assistance_contact_general: Passengers requiring mobility assistance must notify their travel agent or an Air Vanuatu Sales Office at the time of booking. For general assistance requests, reservations, and information, passengers can contact the airline's main offices.

manual_wheelchair_policy: Global Crossing Airlines (GlobalX) permits passengers using manually operated wheelchairs to remain in their wheelchair until the boarding gate, while moving between the terminal and the aircraft door, and while moving between the terminal and the aircraft, to the extent permitted by space and facilities. Manual wheelchairs are typically stowed in the aircraft cargo compartment and are returned to the passenger at the gate upon arrival at the destination.
electric_wheelchair_policy: GlobalX complies with U.S. Department of Transportation (DOT) Part 382 and FAA regulations for the transport of electric wheelchairs and mobility aids. Devices must be protected from accidental activation. If the device cannot be stowed upright in the cargo compartment, the airline may need to remove and package the battery separately.
battery_types_allowed: Non-spillable (Gel cell, Absorbed electrolyte sealed lead acid)
Spillable (Wet lead-acid) - subject to specific packaging/stowage if not upright
battery_handling_instructions: Lithium-ion batteries must not exceed 300 Wh for a single battery, or 160 Wh each for two batteries. Removable lithium-ion batteries must be removed from the device, have their terminals protected from short circuits, and be carried in the passenger cabin. For all battery types, terminals must be protected from short circuits and the device must be protected from accidental activation. The pilot-in-command must be notified of the location of any lithium-ion batteries in the cabin.
special_assistance_contact_general: For general special assistance inquiries, passenger emergencies, or legal questions, passengers can contact GlobalX at 786.751.8550. Specific baggage and equipment claims should be directed to the Baggage Inquiries department.

airline_name: ABSA Aerolinhas Brasileiras S.A (LATAM Cargo Brasil)
manual_wheelchair_policy: Manual wheelchairs are transported free of charge and are typically stowed in the aircraft hold. One typical adult-sized folding, collapsible, or break-down manual passenger wheelchair with dimensions of 13 x 36 x 42 inches (33 x 91 x 106 cm) or less may be stowed in the cabin if the aircraft is equipped with suitable closets or safety straps and space is available.
electric_wheelchair_policy: Electric wheelchairs and motorized mobility aids are transported in the cargo hold. Passengers must provide details about the device (weight, dimensions, and battery type) at least 24 to 48 hours before departure. If traveling with a motorized wheelchair, boarding passes generally must be obtained at the airport check-in counter for safety verification, although for flights within Brazil, online check-in may be available.
battery_handling_instructions: Lithium-ion batteries must remain attached to the wheelchair unless the design does not provide adequate protection. If removed, the battery must not exceed 300 Wh (or two batteries of 160 Wh each) and must be carried in the passenger cabin with terminals protected from short circuits. For spillable batteries, the airline may require the battery to be removed and packaged separately if the wheelchair cannot be stowed in an upright position.
